loans.name: Charito

texts.es: Charito tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su conviviente y sus dos hijos que la quieren mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes dentro de su vivienda desde hace 3 años atrás, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus clientes y que los mismos se sientan satisfechos por la atención que ella les da. Le es rentable debido a que a su negocio concurre mucha gente, además que cuenta con una clientela fiel y le va excelentemente. Es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, además comprar más productos para surtirse con lo necesario.
texts.en:
Charito is 33 years old and lives with her partner and her two children who love her very much. She has sold groceries from her home for the past 3 years. What she likes about her work is giving good service to her customers, who feel satisfied with the attention she gives them. Her business is profitable because a lot of people come to her and in addition she has a loyal clientele, so things are going quite well. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is a very punctual with her payments. With the money she requests she would like to enlarge her business as well as buy more products so that she can offer what her customers need.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlarge her business and increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Cony

texts.es: Cony, de 19 años de edad, soltera, vive junto a sus padres y 2 hermanas que la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en las afueras de su vivienda, desde hace 2 años atrás y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degustan de su buena sazón. Le es muy rentable porque su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una buena zona, muy transitada. Lo difícil es no contar con los implementos necesarios para su cocina. Es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar utensilios de cocina y desde luego implementarse con sillas  y mesas para acoger mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cony is 19 years old, single and lives with her parents and 2 sisters who are very supportive of her. For the past 2 years she has sold food in the area outside her house. What she likes about her work is that many people enjoy her good cooking. The business is profitable because it is in a good, high-traffic zone. What is difficult is that she does not have all the utensils she needs for her kitchen. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is a very punctual with her payments. With the money she requests she would like to buy kitchen utensils and of course to set up her business with chairs and tables for the comfort of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cooking utensils and furniture so she can better serve her customers

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es: Dolly  tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que son sus ganas de salir adelante. Ella es propietaria de dos motocarros que los tiene desde hace 3 años, con su negocio de transporte de pasajeros, brinda trabajo a sus hermanos, quienes se dedican a este oficio desde hace 5 años atrás, ellos ahora manejan sus motocarros. Lo bueno de este trabajo es que le produce como es debido, manteniéndola bien económicamente. Le es rentable debido a ella misma administra las ganancias, razón por la cual le va muy bien. Es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a reparar sus motocarros para que trabajen sin dificultad alguna.
texts.en:
Dolly is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and two children, who are her inspiration for getting ahead. She is the owner of two motorcars (3-wheeled motorcycle) which she has had for the past 3 years. With her passenger transportation business she provides work for her brothers, who have been in this type of job for the past 5 years. They now drive her vehicles. What is good about this work is the income which supports them economically. It is profitable because she manages the earnings and things are going very well. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is very punctual with her payments. With the money she requests she will repair her vehicles to that they work better.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her motorcars.

loans.name: Felida

texts.es: Félida tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos que cursan estudios primarios, y vive con su conviviente que la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 3 años, le gusta su trabajo porque tiene  un trato directo con sus clientes y darles una buena atención es lo más importante. Le es rentable debido a que cuenta con una clientela fiel y sobre todo porque los productos que vende son de consumo diario, lo difícil es no contar con un local adecuado para su negocio. Es su sexto préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a construir un kiosco y ambientarlo adecuadamente para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Félida is 30 years old and the mother of 3 children who are in primary school. She lives with her partner who is very supportive of her. For the past 3 years she has sold groceries. She likes her work because she has direct contact with her customers and she gives them good attention, which is so important. It is profitable because she has a loyal clientele and above all because she sells the basic products which are used daily. What is hard is not having a suitable business premise. This is her sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she has been punctual with her payments. With the loan she requests she will have a kiosk built and set up so that she can better accomodate her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosk where she can sell her products

loans.name: Ninfa Rosibel

texts.es:
hola mi nombre es Ninfa Rosibel M. P. me dedico al comarcio, cuento con una pulperia operando bajo el nombre de Pulperia PATRICIA, actividad a la cual me dedico desde hace 5 años, soy viuda, los ingresos que me genera mi negocio he podido sacar adelante mis hijos cubriendo con todos los gastos familiares.
por lo antes mencionado solicito un credito el cual lo invertire en mi negocio para que me genere mayor volumen de venta de mejorar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ninfa Rosibel M. P.. I work in commence and have a convenience store which is called Pulperia Patricia. This is an activity which I have been doing for the past 5 years. I am a widow and the income which my business generates has allowed me to take care of my children and cover all the family expenses. Because of this, I am asking for a loan to invest in my business so that I can sell more and improve my earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Maria Irene V. tengo una tienda en la cual tengo variedad deproductos de liemmpieza para el hogar, productos para damas como ser cremas, lociones, shampoos, acondionadores, cosmeticos, tambien vendo zapatos, sombreros y articulos electrodomesticos para el hogar, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio el cual me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia y algunos gastos personales, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas mercaderia para poder tener bien surtida mi tienda ya que en estas epocas de navidad los productos se venden bastante, por lo antes mencionado estoy solicitando credito y con las ganancias que obtenga poder mejorar la calidad de vida de mi familia.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Maria Irene V.. I have a store in which I sell a variety of home cleaning products along with feminine products such as creams, lotions, shampoos, conditioners, and cosmetics; I also sell shoes, hats, and home electrical appliances. I have worked in this business for several years, and it is how I generate an income for supporting my family and for any personal expenses. Right now I need to purchase more merchandise so that my store can maintain a good selection, since a lot of products are sold during the Christmas holiday season. I am requesting a loan for this reason, and the profits that I would obtain would help me to improve my family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pedro Lorenzo Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "PEDRO LORENZO" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA MARY LUZ, LOS SOCIOS (AS) QUIENES CONFORMAN EL GRUPO SON PERSONAS QUE SE CONOCEN DEL BARRIO. TODOS ELLOS SE GARANTIZAN Y SE COMPROMETEN EN PAGAR  EL TOTAL DEL FINANCIAMIENTO PUNTUALMENTE. TODAS LOS SOCIOS (AS)SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. DIFERENTES PRODUCTOS COMO SER: VENTA D. ROPA, PRODUCTOS COSMÉTICO, COCINERA, VENTA D. COMIDA, VENTA D. BARRIO, VENTA D. REFRESCOS Y ASADITOS, VENTA D. FRUTAS, VENTA D. DULCES Y REFRESCOS, VENTA D. ABARROTES. COMO EN TODO RUBRO D. COMERCIO EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA EN LAS DIVERSAS ACTIVIDADES QUE DESEMPEÑAN PERO EL OBJETIVO ES COMÚN ES EL D. PROGRESAR EN SUS NEGOCIOS PARA MEJORAR EL SUSTENTO D. SU FAMILIA Y SU CALIDAD D. VIDA. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. INSUMOS Y MATERIALES A LA VENTA ASÍ COMO PARA MEJORAR LA CALIDAD D. LOS PRODUCTOS PARA SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA. LA MAYORÍA D. LOS SOCIOS (AS) YA TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE SABEN ADMINISTRAR BIEN SUS FONDOS.
texts.en:
The Pedro Lorenzo group is represented by Mary Luz. The members who make up the group are people who know each other from the neighborhood. All of them guarantee and promise that they will repay the total loan punctually. All of the members are dedicated to selling different products such as clothing, cosmetics, cooking, food, refreshments, kebabs, fruit, candy, sodas, and groceries. Like all things in business, there is competition in the different areas where they work. However, the common goal is to progress with their businesses so that they can improve their families' standard of living. The loan is destined to be invested in stock and material for selling as well as improve the quality of products for their shops. The majority of the members already have experience in joint groups so they know how to manage their funds well.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jonathan, de 34 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos que están estudiando, vive junto a su conviviente quien lo apoya mucho. Su dedicación al transporte de pasajeros la realiza desde hace 2 años, a razón de ser propietario de un motocarro. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conocer a  muchas personas con quien comparte ideas y sobre todo dar un trato amable a sus clientes. Le es muy rentable, ya que el mismo se encarga de administrar sus ganancias. Lo difícil es la competencia, ya que existe mucha demanda en este tipo de transporte, y a veces tiene que dedicarse a trabajar temporalmente en otros oficios, como albañil o carpintero. Es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es un cliente puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a reparar su vehículo de trabajo y así trabajar tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Jonathan, who is 34 years old, is a father to two children who are in school. He lives together with his partner who supports him a lot. He began his job as a taxi driver two years ago when he became owner of a motortaxi (3 wheeled motorcycle). What he likes about his job is getting to know many people who share ideas him and, above all else, providing friendly treatment to his customers. This is very profitable since he is also in charge of managing his earnings. The competition is difficult since there is a lot of demand for this type of transportation and sometimes he has to dedicate himself to working seasonally in other jobs such as masonry or carpentry. This is his seventh loan with MFP and he is a customer who is punctual with his repayments. With the money he is requesting, he will repair his vehicle so that he may work without worry.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his car.

loans.name: Fanny Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sr. Fanny tiene 46 años de edad, casada y habitante de barrio Healeah en la capital de Managua con dos hermosos hijas de 12 y 20 años de edad,  ambas estudiando, sus planes para sus familia es seguir apoyando a sus hijas para que culminen la universidad asegurándole un futuro mejor .Doña Fanny tiene un Cyber y alquiler de teléfono para llamadas locales e internacionales es un negocio donde los clientes vienen hacer muchas llamadas internacionales ya que su costo es bajo, con la solicitud del préstamo va invertir  en remodelaciones dentro y fuera del local. Para dar un mejor servicios Agracias a Afodenic lograra que su negocio este seguro y con una comodidad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fanny is 46 years old, is married and lives in the Healeah neighborhood in the capital of Managua with two beautiful daughters who are 12 and 20 years old. Both are studying. Her plan for her family is to continue to support her daughters so that they may finish university, assuring them a better future. Fanny has an Internet cafe and rents telephones for local and international calls. It is a business where customers come to make a lot of international calls since the cost is low. With the request of a loan, she is going to invest in remodeling inside and outside her shop so that she can provide better services. Thanks to Afodenic, she will ensure that her business is safe and comfortable for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to remodel her shop.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela tiene 39 años, es madre de un hijo estudiante, vive junto a su esposo quien la apoya continuamente. Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cervezas desde hace ya 2 años, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es atender con amabilidad a sus clientes y sobre todo dar lo necesario a su hijo que es la luz por la cual trabaja cada día, desea verlo en un momento dado todo un profesional. El negocio le es rentable, bebido a que los productos que vende son de consumo diario y se encuentra en una buena zona, muy transitada. Le va muy bien, nos cuenta. Es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a construir un kiosco y desde luego implementarse con más bebidas.
texts.en:
Mariela is 39-years-old. She is the mother of one son, who is a student. She lives with her husband, who continuously supports her. She has sold soft drinks and beer for two years. What she likes about her work is attending to her customers with kindness, and above all, giving her son what he needs. He is the light for which she works every day, and she hopes to see him become a professional some day. Her business is very profitable since the products she sells are consumed daily and her business is located in a good, very frequented area. She tells us that it is going very well for her. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very punctual with her payments. With the money requested, she wants to have a kiosk constructed so she can sell more beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of beverages that she sells.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 49 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos que la apoyan  mucho. Su dedicación a la venta de comida la viene realizando desde hace ya un año atrás, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una muy buena atención a sus clientes. Le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar y sobre todo cuenta con una clientela selecta que degustan de su buena sazón. Lo único difícil para ella, es no contar con un local para su restaurante, ya que lo adecua en un espacio de su casa. Es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir en las afueras de su domicilio una ramada (espacio cubierto con un techo de ramas) para vender su comida y además comprar mesas y sillas para dar una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is 49-years-old. She is a single mother and lives with her three children, who support her very much. She has sold food for one year. What she likes about her job is giving good attention to her customers. Her business is profitable for her because it is in a good location, and above all, she has a select clientele that likes the good flavor of her food. The only difficult part for her is not having a location for her restaurant, since she has adapted a space in her house for it. This is her sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is punctual with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she will have a ramada (a space covered with a roof of branches) constructed outside her house where she can sell her food. She will also buy tables and chairs to give good attention to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement an adequate space where she can sell her food

loans.name: Roya

texts.es: La señora Roya, de 41 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos que están estudiando, vive junto a su conviviente quien siempre la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a crianza  de pollos en las instalaciones de su vivienda, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año atrás, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen cuidado a sus pollos, para luego llevarlos a vender con un buen pezo y sobre todo sanos. Este  negocio le es rentable, ya que cada 45 días está enviando sus pollos al mercado. Es su 5to préstamo con MFP, ella es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un galpón para sus animales y comprar alimento balanceado para ellos.
texts.en:
Señora Roya is 41-years-old and is the mother of 3 children, who are in school. She lives with her husband who always supports her a lot. She raises chickens in cages at her home. She has done this work for one year. What she likes about it is giving good care to her chickens and then taking them to sell at a good weight, and above all, in healthy condition. This business is profitable for her, since she sends her chickens to market every 45 days. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is punctual with her payments. With the money she is requesting, she is going to have a shed constructed for her animals and she will purchase balanced nutrition for them.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a shed where she can raise her chickens

loans.name: Zadith

texts.es: Zadith, de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos que la apoyan mucho en sus labores. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, el cual es manejado por uno de sus hijos para brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros, esta herramienta de trabajo la tiene desde hace 6 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que le es muy productivo y genera muchos ingresos, ya que lo maneja su propio hijo y lo cuida como es debido. Lo más difícil para ella son los cambios climatológicos, cuando llueve mucho es difícil trasladarse. Es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, ella es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar otro motocarro y desde luego mandar a reparar el que ahora tiene, para que esté en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Zadith is 39-years-old and is a single mother. She lives with her 3 children who support her a lot in her work. She owns a motorcycle rickshaw, which is driven by one of her sons to offer transportation service to passengers. She has had the rickshaw for 6 years. What she likes about her business is that it's productive and generates a lot of income, since her own son drives and cares for the rickshaw like he should. The most difficult part is the changes in weather. When it rains a lot, it's hard to move the rickshaw. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is punctual with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she wants to buy another motorcycle rickshaw and repair the one that she has now so it will be in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle rickshaw and to repair the one she has

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 49 años  de edad, vive solo con sus tres hijos que estudian, ya que ella es madre soltera. Su actividad diaria es la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, sus productos los vende en las afueras de su vivienda en unas mesas que implementó para ello, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a mucha gente con quien comparte muchas conversaciones. Su bodeguita le es rentable, porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y le va bien. Es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir un kiosco e implementarse de más productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Adela is 49-years-old and lives only with her three children, who are in school, because she is a single mother. She has sold groceries and basic goods for four years. She sells her products outside of her home on some tables she implemented for this. She likes her job a lot because she gets to know many people with whom she shares many conversations. Her little store is profitable because it's in a good loacation and it's going well for her. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is punctual with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she is going to have a kiosk constructed so she can sell more products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Creciendo Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Mujeres Creciendo” forma parte de la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace mas de diez  años. La mencionada asociación  pertenece al centro focal  Juan Pablo II, ubicada  en la zona Ferropetrol de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con catorce miembros que  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación podemos decir que son comerciantes en su mayoría, por ejemplo Melody se  dedica a la venta de zapatos, que los comercializa realizando viajes a la ciudad de Santa Cruz, su mamá se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida, otras son artesanas, realizan tejidos y bordados que luego los venden en la calle Sagarnaga de la ciudad de La Paz, 
La asociación Mujeres Creciendo precisa de créditos para materia prima y/o insumos en diferentes casos, principalmente por las prontas fiestas navideñas que ya llegan, es seguro que sus ventas aumentaran y también sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The association named “Mujeres Creciendo” (“Growing Women”) has been a part of the Pro-Mujer family for more than ten years. This association belongs to the focal center of Juan Pablo II, located in the Ferropetrol zone of the city of El Alto. To date, they have fourteen members that have demonstrated themselves as an organized group with regard to their payments and internal activities. Various types of businesses exist within the group but we can say that, for the most part, they are made up of merchants. Melody, for example, dedicates herself to selling shoes which she markets on trips to the city of Santa Cruz. Her mother works preparing and selling food. Others make crafts, handwoven textiles and borders that they later sell on Sagarnaga Street in the city of La Paz. The association requires a loan for raw materials and other supplies. In particular, these would be for the nearing holiday season -- a time when their businesses will see growing sales and their incomes will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and other supplies.

loans.name: Nuevo Porvenir Group

texts.es:
En la zona Panamericana, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Nuevo Porvenir” Un grupo muy simpático y particular formado por 16 miembros que trabajan de manera organizada en todas sus actividades de grupo, cumpliendo mas de un año de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer.  Las actividades que realiza la asociación Nuevo Porvenir, son de todo variadas; se dedican a la venta de verdura,  otras realizan tejidos de chompas, también se  dedican a la venta  de adornos para el hogar, venta de ropa, entre otros.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de productos al por mayor, están seguras que sus ventas se duplicaran por las fiestas de fin de año, de este modo obtendrán mayores ganancias y beneficios para sus familias
texts.en:
In the Panamerican zone exists a focal center by the same name. Here belongs the association named “Nuevo Porvenir” (“New Future”). This is a very agreeable group made up of sixteen members who work in an organized manner in all their activities, having celebrated one year of working with Pro Mujer. The activities realized by the members of Nuevo Porvenir are varied. Some members sell vegetables, other knit sweaters, while some also sell decorations for the home, clothing, and other items. They state that they need additional working capital to purchase products at wholesale. They are sure that their sales will double during the holiday season and, in this manner, they will obtain greater profits for the benefit of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products at wholesale.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo lives in a typical village in San Isidro in the province of Quirino, Isabela. He is married to Ronalyn, who is a housewife who takes good care of their two children, the eldest three years old and the youngest one year old.

For five years, Alfredo is engaged in the farming business as the major source of income that supports the daily needs of his family.

Alfredo would like to improve his farming techniques in order to generate a higher income for the next harvest season. In line with this, he is requesting a loan of PHP15,000.00 (USD$325) that he will use as additional capital for his farming needs.

Alfredo believes that entrusting everything to God is the best solution to every problem. Thus he prays for the success of his farming business for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: Additional working capital for his farm.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer lives happily with his wife Norma and their 18-year-old son Eugi, who is now in college. Elmer hopes to have a progressive life through his farming business. In order to do this, he needs to improve his rice and corn crops for a better yield. He therefore asks for a loan amounting to PHP15,000 (USD$325) to assist him financially.

To learn to be contented in life is the guiding principle of Elmer. He does not complain on what life brings him. He is thankful for giving him a family, even though they are not wealthy, because they are always in good health.

Part of Elmer's dreams is to have their house renovated and to have electric supply. He knows that he will be able to fulfill these dreams when he has enough resources to utilize.

loans.use: Additional working capital for his farm.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
“Work is done by people and mercy is done by God.” These are the lines from which Aurora gets strength every time she needs to combat life’s challenges.

Aurora L. is a patient mother to her nine children. She got married when she was 17 years old to a farmer and carpenter named Antonio Yamongan. Their children are Nympha, 32 years old, married high school graduate; Nelia, 28 years old, married, college level; Nenit, 25 years old, college graduate now working in Manila; Norbert, 23 years old, still studying in college; Nymrad, 20 years old, criminology student; Myrell, 18 years old, Information Technology student; Nerissa, 14 years old, high school student; Neilkim, 11 years old, grade five student; and Nathaniel, 9 years old, grade three. They live in a rural village of Sisim Alto Tumauini, Isabela where a day care school is available. Like other villages, the main source of livelihood for most of the people here is farming.

Aurora deals in vegetable and rice vending. Most of the vegetables she sells are harvested from their own backyard. In order to sell more kinds of vegetables and to purchase sacks of rice to meet her customers’ needs, Aurora requests a loan of PHP7,000 (USD$150). She will also use some of the money to sustain their farming business.

Aurora will use the income generated from the business to provide the tuition fees and allowances for her children in school and for her family’s daily necessities. She hopes to plant other vegetables in order to increase their income, which will surely benefit her whole family.

loans.use: To expand the types of vegetables she sells.

loans.name: Najmy

texts.en: O. Najmy lives in the B.Gafurov region but she works in the Khujand local bazaar, “Panjshanbe”. She trades in vegetable oil. She works with the suppliers so she has the opportunity to sell at low prices. Mrs.O. is the loving mother of 5 children and she works hard to ensure a good future her children. The oldest children help her. Mrs.O. has been engaged in this business for 3 years and she has repeat customers. Mrs. O. applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: Increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Toshpulot

texts.en: Toshpulot S. first applied to MicroInvest in 2008, but he already has a good reputation and has not had any delays in the previous loan payments. Mr.S. is engaged in the family business of livestock. He is married and has 4 children. He is skilled in livestock with 40 years experience. He stared the livestock business when he was a young boy and helped his father to take care of animals. In addition, his wife sells milk and the milk products such as curd, sour cream and kefir. Mr.S. has one milk cow and 3 rams. Now he applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 3000 STJ for 6 months to purchase a bull, as the price for bulls are lower now than in any other season.

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Neema E.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Neema M. from Kyela. She is married with four children, between the ages of 10 and 18. Neema has been running a ratail shop since 2005. She purchases commodities at wholesale and sells them at retail to people around the area. The commodities she sells are rice, cooking oil, soda, soap, matches, etc.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Neema currently earns about 40 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and soda in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock. Neema thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and soda in bulk

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.en:
B. Tutiniso has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. She has proven herself a serious and reliable client; she has not any problems with previous loan repayments.

Mrs. B. is engaged in the commercial service and trade. She has sold eggs in the Panjshanbe bazaar for the last 8 years. She is very polite and kind by nature, so she has a lot of repeat customers. Mrs. B. applies to KIVA for business development loan of 2300 STJ for 6 months to increase her turnover capital.

loans.use: Increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Boltaeva

texts.en: B. Gulsara has been an active client of our program since 2005. She applied when she heard from her friend about our loan program. She started her business practically from scratch, but thanks to previous loans, now she has a trade outlet in the central bazaar in Khujand, where she sells sugar, sweets and chocolate. She works with the suppliers from Russia and Kyrgyzstan so her prices are lower than the bazaar prices. She has a lot of repeat customers. Mrs.B. asks the KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 STJ for 12 months to import New Year candies. She thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: Import New Year candies

loans.name: Fanesa

texts.en:
"For richer and for poorer, our family will stay together." Fanesa always told herself this although they have always been poor.

Fanesa is 33 years old and married to Samuel, a farmer in the village. They are blessed with a 10-year-old son named John who is already a grade IV student. The family lives in a place where people are united and very cooperative.

Fanesa's goal to improve her family's life gives her the strength to be more diligent in life. She and her husband are working together in cultivating their farm, but they lack the money to sustain their farming needs, so she would like to request a loan of PHP10,000 (USD$225). This will be a great help to her family not only in maintaining their farm but also in sustaining their immediate needs.

Fanesa hopes to have an increased income during her next harvest so she can start to save for the education of their son and for the repair of their house. She believes that everything is possible if we commit everything to God. She prays for the success of her business and to have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: Additional capital to support her farm.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Z. Inobat has been working tightly with our program since 2005. She is an active client of our program and she recommended herself as a serious client. Thanks to the previous loans, she has improved the business significantly and increased the business turnover. She lives in the B. Gafurov region and trades in the local bazaar called Farovon. She buys and sells children's clothing. She brings the goods from Istaravshan and the Kyrgyz Republic where she goes twice per month. She has a good assortment. Now Mrs. Z. is applying to KIVA with the request of a business development loan of 3000 STJ for 2 months so she can import seasonal wear.

loans.use: To import seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo P. is happily married and blessed with two intelligent children. He is 41 years old and is engaged in farming while his wife is making soft brooms for sale in their community. His earnings support the daily needs of his family and he wants to ensure that he can provide a good future for them. However, he is experiencing difficulty with the cost of farm materials such as fertilizer, which have become expensive lately.

To solve this dilemma, Bernardo thinks of converting into organic farming - the traditional way of farming which is a lot cheaper than commercial farming. Such a shift to a healthier method of farming will require additional capital of P15,000 (USD$325), that is why he wants to borrow money from a local institution.

Bernardo always dreams for the health and unity of his family. He also wants his children - Mary Ann, 16, and Mary Jane, 15 - to finish college education because he knows how important it is for his children to have a better future. At the moment, he is so proud of his children who are able to help them in making soft brooms by simply going around the community to collect the materials they need.

loans.use: Additional capital to convert to organic farming methods.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe lives in Antagan 1st, one of the farthest barangays ("districts") in Tumauini, Isabela, an area rich in agricultural land. Farmers in the community benefit from the non-stop availability of water even during drought since their water irrigation comes from Magoli river wherein water comes from the mountain.

Fe is married to Aquino A. Sr. who is also a farmer. The couple have six children of which five are already studying. Their children are: Albert - 18, high School graduate; Aquino Jr. - 16, high school level; Daisy - 13, freshman high school student; Kelvin - 11, grade five elementary student; and their youngest, Jericho, 4 years old.

Fe is a member of the ANSAFA group in Antagan 1st. ANSAFA is composed of people engaged in the farming business.

Fe asks for a loan of PHP12,000.00 (USD$250) to support their farming needs. This amount would mean a lot to them for it will give them the opportunity to increase their income which would benefit their family and also allow them to save for the college education of their children. Moreover, they can avoid borrowing from traders who are offering higher interest.

According to Fe, working together is one of the best ways to fulfill their ambitions in life. Thus, she works hard in the farm to help her husband minimize their labor expenses in terms of cultivating and maintaining their rice field.

loans.use: Additional capital to support her farm.

loans.name: Tulituuka Group D

texts.en:
Florence, 41, is the friendly and dedicated mother of four children, ages 13 to 20, and a loving wife to a clinical assistant. She owns a pharmacy in nearby Bukoloto, where she sells medicines, healthcare and skin products. Florence, a warm and friendly woman, uses the loans to replenish her supplies of medical products. Each week she travels two hours to Kampala where she can find the best terms on bulk wholesale drugs. Her average weekly profit is 15,000 Ush. 

She has been a Pearl member for 15 years, and she estimates this is her 30th loan. Florence’s business goal is to become a wholesale drug distributor, which provides a more consistent and predictable income stream. The family depends upon her income to support their school fees and make ends meet. She will be happy when all of her children complete their educations.

Other people in this group loan are interested in achieving similar goals.

loans.use: Replenishing supplies of medical products for her pharmacy

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia B. is a hard-working woman who dreams to see her two children finish college education. She is 39 years old and married to Roosevelt who is also her business partner. Their children are Sheila Mae - 16 years old, a college student and Lara Kaye - 11 years old, a high school student.

Her family lives in a community surrounded by hospitable, responsible and God-fearing people. She and her husband are engaged in farming which is their major source of income, but with their desire to provide a better life for their family, they also engage in other businesses such as hog-raising, furniture-making, welding and a small store in their village. Delia's products include basic commodities, rice, soft drinks, personal care items and hog feed.

Delia is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 (USD$325) which will be used in their farm business since their income is not enough to sustain the next planting season. She hopes that through her loan their economic status will improve.

loans.use: Additional capital for her farm.

loans.name: Tulituuka Group C

texts.en:
Soft-spoken Hanifa, 38, is married with 6 children ages 2 to 18. She also cares for three cousins and her sister. Hanifa sells smoked fish caught in Lake Victoria. Local favorites are tilapia and Nile perch. Her customers are families and restaurants in her local village. Hard-working Hanifa goes the fish market in Lugazi, an hour and a half away on a public bus, every Monday, Wednesday and Friday to buy fresh fish to sell in local markets. She smokes the fish because she cannot afford a cold storage unit. Her business is robust: each week, she buys 1,000,000 Ush worth of fish in Lugazi and makes a weekly profit of over 200,000 Ush. Still, she can only save trace amounts of her income as very little is left after paying school fees and living expenses.  

Hanifa hopes to buy her own fishing nets and employ local boys to fish exclusively for her. This would significantly improve her profits. Further, if she could afford a refrigerator, she could sell higher-margin fresh fish as well as sell fish on a wholesale basis to more restaurants and retailers.Hanifa’s husband is a lorry driver. They would like to afford to put their children in boarding school, as day schools in their village are not good and they hope their children can complete university-level education. She has been a Pearl borrower for for over 10 years, and this is Hanifa’s 38th cycle.

Other members of her group have similar aspirations.

loans.use: Buying fresh fish at the wholseale market for resale

loans.name: Tulituuka Group B

texts.en:
Twenty-seven-year-old Simon is a clever entrepreneur. He owns and drives a boda boda (motorcycle taxi), and he jointly owns with his a wife a motorcycle repair and parts shop. This greatly reduces his maintenance and repair costs, allows him to naturally solicit his colleagues for business, and it keeps his family working together. Simon is a seasoned veteran, having been driving a boda boda for nine years. Over the years, he has acquired a faithful clientele. 

The loan proceeds will be used to replenish the stock in the spare parts shop. Simon’s ambition is to turn the spare parts business into a wholesale distribution business. This is a less cyclical business and larger volumes will contribute more income to the household. Simon also aspires to own a small fleet of motorcycles for rental of them to drivers on a daily basis. He and his wife struggle to pay school fees for their three young children and dream of one day sending them to Uganda’s finest schools.

Other entrepeneurs in this group have similar goals.

loans.use: Replenishing the inventory in his motorcycle spare parts shop

loans.name: Tursunali

texts.en: A. Tursunali is 48 years old. He is married with three children. Tursunali is a teacher. He saw a need for his students to be able to buy used books and office supplies, so he opened a store. Together with his loving family he has operated it successfully for the past 22 years. Tursunali has had good orders for different kinds of books and office supplies. He applied to IMON for a loan to fulfill his orders. This will allow him to earn more and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: Books and office supplies to expand the business.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: K. Zulfiya is 38 years old. She is married with two adorable children. Zulfiya and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating their children, so that they become highly employable in the future. Zulfiya sells perfume and cosmetics in a store that she rents. She has been in this business for 20 years. Zulfiya is dreaming of expanding her business. She wants to open her own store and establish contacts with the suppliers of well-known products. Today Zulfiya requests 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) in order to purchase new perfume and cosmetics such as hair color, nail polish, and lipstick to increase the variety of goods in her store. She would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her cosmetics store.

loans.name: Tulituuka Group A

texts.en:
Josephine is a cheerful 47-year-old married mother of 6 children aged 11 to 25. Her husband is a mechanic. She is a nurse and owns and operates a pharmacy in Kayunga, dispensing medicines for common maladies such as malaria, headaches and upset stomach. Josephine has been a pharmacist for eleven years. She is using the loan proceeds to replenish her stock of medicines. She buys pharmaceuticals from the central market in Jinja in bulk quantities to ensure her shop is well-stocked.

Josephine and her husband hope to save enough money to build a rental home and purchase a plot of land for growing pineapples and matoke. Their immediate priority is the education of their remaining school-age children. Most of their income is used to pay school fees. 

Josephine has been the devoted Chairperson of the Tilituuka Group since its formation in 1997. The other members have very similar aspirations.

loans.use: Replenishing the stock of medicines & health care products for her pharmacy

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. is 47 years old and married to Germinihildo. They work together in their farm. They have three children: Joe - 28 years old, elementary graduate; Janicell - 25 years old, college graduate and currently working as a teacher; and Jimson - 22 years old, also an elementary graduate. Elizabeth is thankful to God for giving her a wonderful family. Alhough her two sons are not interested in studying, they are very responsible and are helping them in the farm.

Elizabeth aims to develop their farmland so that they will be able to increase their income. However, they do not have the needed capital for this so she requests a loan of PHP15,000 (USD$325). The money will be used to sustain the needed farm inputs such as fertilizers.

One of their main goals in life is to really improve their farmland. That is why they never get tired of cultivating it, because they know that this will really give them a better future.

loans.use: For purchasing fertilizer and other farming needs.

loans.name: Tulituuka Group E

texts.en:
Cheerful Rose is the 50-year-old mother of three grown children and the wife to a commercial truck driver. Rose is a farmer. She grows cassava, matoke, beans and sweet potatoes and sells them at Kampala’s busting Nakasero market, two hours away by lorry, on Monday, Tuesday and Friday. Her customers, mainly loyal repeat buyers, are families, grocery shops and restaurants. She provides service to her customers with honesty and friendliness and good prices. 

This is Rose’s fourth loan cycle. She uses the loans to buy produce from other farmers in her village, then she sells at Nakasero as a way to boost her income. Before becoming a Pearl member, Rose could only sell small quantities of produce she grew herself, and she had to depend on friends to sell it because she could not afford to travel to Kampala. Now she’s able to earn about 30,000 Ush a week. Traveling by lorry is difficult. It confines Rose to a fixed schedule and lorries are crowded, unsafe and uncomfortable. She wants to earn enough to afford a private lorry to give her greater capacity and flexibility and thus, earning power. Her personal goal is only to live a long and happy life.

Other members of her group have similar goals and needs.

loans.use: Buying produce from other local farmers to sell alongside her own.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: R. Gulnora is 28 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three wonderful children. Her husband is a barber and does not earn enough to support the family.  So Gulnora has been running a grocery store for the past 8 years. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and variety. Gulnora is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again. Gulnora is seeking to keep her business strong and has requested a loan of 1800 Somoni ($550 USD) for the term of 3 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her dreams is that her children progress by means of their studies. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Gulnora reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: To increase her grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Mashrabkhon

texts.en: Mashrabkhon is a widow from Isfara, Tajikistan. She runs a business selling different kinds of food in the central city market. Despite losing her husband, Mashrabkhon has managed to regain her enthusiasm and determination. Three years of being in business have helped her venture flourish into a successful enterprise. Mashrabkhon would like to see her business grow further. She believes additional financial assistance will help guarantee expansion and higher profits. Mashrabkhon’s integrity, good reputation, stability and rich experience working in commerce should secure prompt repayment of this loan and consistent progress in her business.

loans.use: To increase her grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
"If you grow because of someone, let someone grow because of you." This is the principle in life of Analyn C..

Analyn is a mother of two healthy children, Johan, eight, already a Grade II student, and Jovany, five, who is a pre-school student. She is married to Joie who works as a farmer. They live in Barangay Antagan 1st, Tumauini, Isabela.

Analyn is a teacher in their community. However, her monthly salary is not sufficient to meet the daily needs of their family and in supporting her husband's farming business due to the increased cost of farm inputs such as fertilizers.

With her desire to uplift their lives, Analyn is asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP15,000 (USD$325). This will be used to assist her husband in the latter's farming business. They will buy seeds, fertilizers and pay the wages of the workers.

Her dreams for her family include a progressive life and a good harvest every year. For herself, she aspires to always have a stable job so that she can help her husband in fulfilling their dreams which also include, of course, supporting the education of their children. They want their children to finish their studies and hopefully be employed and have decent jobs in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay wages.

loans.name: Mavziniso

texts.en: V. Mavziniso is a dynamic and ambitious 45-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. For 15 years she has had a small business processing dried apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products and the experience she gained in this sphere of business, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers. The demand for her goods has grown, allowing Mavziniso to contribute significantly to the household. Now Mavziniso requests 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for the term of 12 months. She is going to use the loan for purchasing dried apricots to process and resell. Mavziniso hopes to continue supporting her children so they will be able to receive an adequate education. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots to process and resell

loans.name: Mustakim

texts.en: Y. Mustakim is 28 years old. He lives in Isfara; he is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper. Mustakim sells dried apricots in the central local market. He purchases dried apricots and processes them himself. Because he buys dried apricots wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Mustakim to make his business quite successful and provide a stable income for his family. Today Mustakim requests 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 8 months. He is going to spend the loan on more dried apricots to process and sell. He would like to increase his income and give his children a good education. Mustakim expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: To buy more dried apricots to process and sell.

loans.name: Nezikokolima Group

texts.en:
Yeko is Chairman of the Nezikokolima Group in Nkokonjeru, a rural agricultural village in the Mukono region of southeastern Uganda. She is married, 45 years old, and has six children, ages 6 to 22. Yeko also takes care of two grandchildren and her husband’s second wife’s daughter. 

Yeko is a light-hearted and clever purveyor of fresh fruits and matoke, a traditional local dish made from bananas.  She uses her loans from Pearl Microfinance to purchase passion fruit, sweet bananas and sweet potatos from local farmers in her village, and she sells them and the matoke in the Lugazi Food Market, seven miles away, every Tuesday and Wednesday. On a good day, Yeko will make a 20,000 Ush profit for her efforts. She invests her profits in coffee. She buys 200 kilos of whole coffee beans for 1,000 Ush per kilo, then dries, roasts and packages them for sale to a variety of retail food stores and markets in and near her village. Yeko’s husband, a home builder, spends most of his time with his other wife and does not contribute any of his income to supporting his primary family. Yeko depends on the income from her food businesses to keep her children in school and pay for living costs.

Other members of her loan group are in similar situations.

loans.use: Purchase passion fruit, sweet bananas and sweet potatos from local farmers in her village.

loans.name: Rahimberdi

texts.en: I. Rahimberdi is 44 years old. He is married with two children. He has been a father for 21 years, which has helped him to understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house. Rahimberdi works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. He grows potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables in his garden. Rahimberdi dreams of a good education and a bright future for his children. That is why he works from early morning until late at night. He wants to borrow 1000 Somoni ($300 USD) for the term of 7 months so he can buy mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. This request is in support of making his dream come true, and Rahimberdi is asking for help from your generous heart.

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer and other farming supplies

loans.name: Tusekile H.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Tusekile M. from Kyela. She is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 11. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans.

Tusekile has been running a charcoal business since 2007. These small, black dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. 

The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Tusekile currently earns about $190 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $325 in order to purchase more charcoal in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another store of charcoal for reselling. Tusekile thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal in bulk to sell

loans.name: I Ketut Sada

texts.id: I Ketut Sada memiliki lahan seluas 1 hektar. Seluruh lahan yang dimilikinya ditanami dengan padi, karena pengairan yang cukup memadai sepanjang tahun. Selama 1 tahun, tanaman padi bisa dipanen sebanyak 3 kali. Sebelumnya, I Ketut Sada menanam padi dengan bibit jenis lokal karena harganya yang lebih murah. Namun, keuntungan yang didapatnya tidak maksimal, karena bibit jenis lokal mudah terserang penyakit. Dalam satu kali panen ( 4 bulan ), ia hanya mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 500.000.- setelah dikurangi semua biaya untuk pengolahan tanah dan perawatan tanaman. Hal itu dirasakan belum mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya, apalagi dengan kondisi ekonomi saat ini. Karena ingin meningkatkan taraf hidupnya dan keluarganya, I Ketut Sada mengajukan pinjaman ke Yayasan Dinari sebesar Rp. 6.000.000.- Pinjaman tersebut dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit padi kwalitas unggul sebesar Rp. 3.000.000.-, biaya pengolahan tanah dengan menyewa pekerja sebesar Rp. 1.000.000.- dan membeli pupuk serta anti hama sebesar Rp. 2.000.000.- I Ketut Sada sudah belajar dengan petani yang sudah lebih dulu menggunakan bibit kwalitas unggul sehingga ia tidak ragu untuk mendapat pinjaman, karena sesuai dengan kenyataan, bibit padi kwalitas unggul mampu menghasilkan hingga 3 kali lipat dibanding dengan bibit jenis lokal. Satu kali panen, bibit unggul bisa mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1.500.000.- hingga Rp. 2.000.000.- Dengan terus didampingi oleh staf Dinari dan petani padi yang telah sukses dengan bibit padi kwalitas unggul, I Ketut Sada optimis yakin usahanya akan sukses.
texts.en:
I Ketut Sada owns a land of 1 hectare (around 2.5 acres). Due to his land does not have a proper irrigation system, he uses his whole land for paddy farming. He can harvests his paddy farming 3 times a year. He used local paddy seeds in the past because they were cheaper. However he was not able to get a good result out of it. In one harvest season (around 4 month period) he can only get a profit of IDR 500 thousand (around USD 45). That was certainly not enough to make a living especially in this current economic condition.

He applied for a loan from Dinari foundation for an amount of IDR 6 million (around USD 550). He used IDR 3 million (USD 275) to buy high quality paddy seeds, another IDR 1 million (USD 92) was spent for hiring some men to clear and work the land, and IDR 2 million (USD 183) to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

I Ketut Sada has learned from senior farmers in farming with high quality seeds, hence he is confidence he can succeed this time. He can triple his revenue using this quality seeds, so instead of having a profit of UD 45 per harvest seasons, he can earn up to USD 135 - USD 180/ harvest season. I Ketut Sada is also going to be guided by Dinari Foundation's field instructor, so he is confident that he will succeed this time around.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: High quality paddy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: I Ketut Sarna

texts.id:
I Ketut Sarna, tinggal disebuah desa di Bali barat yang hampir semua penduduknya berprofesi sebagai petani. Karena tinggal didaerah yang terpencil, hampir semua petani didaerahnya bercocok tanam dengan cara yang sangat tradisional. Hal itu berakibat kepada hasil yang tidak maksimal dan bahkan seringkali kekurangan untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga. I Ketut Sarna mendapat informasi dari temannya yang juga seorang petani dari lain desa. Petani tersebut sudah berhasil karena bercocok tanam dengan cara modern dan menggunakan bibit padi jenis unggul.
I Ketut Sarna ingin menjadi pelopor untuk mengadakan perubahan didesanya. Ia ingin menanami sawahnya dengan bibit padi kwalitas unggul untuk hasil yang maksimal. Untuk mewujudkan hal itu, I Ketut Sarna mengajukan pinjaman ke Yayasan Dinari dan mohon pembinaan untuk proses menanamnya. Dengan adanya pendampingan usaha dari Dinari dan bantuan dari temannya yang telah sukses, I Ketut Sarna optimis usahanya akan berhasil dan akan menjadi contoh didesanya.
texts.en:
I Ketut Sarna lives in a village in the west of Bali. Almost all men in that village are farmers. They are using traditional ways in farming because their village is located in a remote area. As a result they cannot get the best result from their farming activities.

I Ketut Sarna got an information from his friend who live in another village. His friend is a successful farmer because he already uses modern farming methods and also he uses high quality paddy seeds. I Ketut Sarna wants to be pioneer in the modern farming method in his village. He also wants to pioneering the usage of high quality paddy seeds.

Therefore he applied for a loan of IDR 6 million (around USD 550) from Dinari foundation. He also requested to be guided by Dinari Foundation's farming specialist so he can succeed in this. He is hoping that he can succeed in this so he can inspire his fellow village men.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: High quality paddy seeds, fertilizer, pesticide

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib, 41, lives in Nabatieh, a town in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Habib has been painting houses for 25 years. He is requesting a loan of $1000US from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his house and to support his family expenses. This is the first time that Habib has requested a loan.

He decided to start his own business because he wanted to be independent and have a better income.Habib has a good reputation because of the quality of his work and his competitive prices. He is not only a house painter, but he also takes care of water leaks. His clients include his friends and family members.

When he first started his business, Habib faced the difficulty of convincing people that he was capable of doing good work. His future plan is to expand by enlarging his territory of clients as he wants to be known not only in his village, but in other villages.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on the family house and support his family expenses.

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto E. lives in San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela where most of the residents are his relatives. He is married and his wife works as a domestic helper abroad leaving him with their two children, Christian, 12, a graduating elementary student and Crisel Joy, four years old.

Crisanto would like to request a loan amounting to PHP15,000 (USD$325) that he can use in cultivating his half-hectare rice field and 0.9 hectare corn field. He has been working these fields for almost 10 years. He is striving hard in order to provide a better life for his family especially to support his children's educational needs. Crisanto does not want to depend on the remittances of his wife for he believes that, as the head of the family, he should be the one responsible for giving them a good life.

Crisanto also hopes that his wife will become successful and he always prays for her good health. They sacrificed to be away from one another to improve their lives, to achieve their dreams and to support the studies of their children until college.

loans.use: To support his rice and corn cultivation.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 52, lives in the town of Nabatieh in southern Lebanon with his wife and their six children. Ali has been a taxi driver for 22 years. He is requesting a loan of $1000US from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali’s wanted to be a government employee, but unfortunately he couldn’t, so that is why he decided to be a taxi driver. When he first started his business, he found difficulty in being accepted by other taxi drivers. Ali excels in his work because of his driving skills and his good relationships with his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors, family and others.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on a taxi used for income

loans.name: Fenie

texts.en:
Feme is 20 years old and married to Marvin, 23, who works as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). They have a two-year-old son named Mark Lester.

Like most of her neighbors, Feme is engaged in the farming business, but due to the increasing prices of farm inputs (fertilizers, seeds, and so on.) she needs additional capital to sustain her farming needs. A loan amount of PHP15,000 (USD$325) is enough for her to purchase the basic farm inputs.

One of Feme's dreams is to have a progressive and united family life despite the fact that her husband works in another country. She also hopes that her son will grow with a normal and healthy life and have the best education in order to become successful in the future.

Feme believes that God is merciful to those who strive to work hard for the betterment of their lives. Moreover, while her son is still young and has limited expenses, Feme is doing her best to save for his future education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and other farming needs.

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
Jomar A. is 37 years old and married to Marilyn who is a housewife. The couple did not have the chance to have a child after many years of being married, but they still pray hard to have a child who will give them inspiration.

Jomar maintains a 0.8 hectare rice field and two hectares of banana plantation. He also pawned a small portion of the land. This is one reason why he strives to have a higher income in the coming harvest, in order to repay the amount and therefore have an additional farm to utilize.

In order to pursue this plan, Jomar requests a loan amounting to PHP15,000 (USD$325) which he will use to sustain his rice field and banana plants. Some of the loan will be used to buy feed for his hog-raising business.

Jomar believes that a lazy person will never receive the blessings which God pours out. Thus, Jomar and his wife keep on working so they will have a stable and sustainable source of living (and hopefully for their child, if their prayers to have one would be granted).

loans.use: Additional capital for his rice and banana crops.

loans.name: I Ketut Sulia

texts.id: Memiliki lahan yang luas tidak menjamin mendapat hasil yang maksimal. Hal tersebut terjadi kepada I Ketut Sulia. Ia memiliki lahan seluas 2 hektar yang ditanami jagung dimusim kering dan padi dimusim penghujan. Namun, karena keterbatasan dana dan pengetahuan, seringkali I Ketut Sulia tidak mendapat hasil yang maksimal bahkan merugi. Hal itu terjadi karena besarnya biaya yang dibutuhkan untuk pengolahan tanah. Sejak mengenal Dinari dari kelompok wanita didesanya, I Ketut Sulia berminat untuk bergabung dalam pinjaman untuk biaya pengolahan tanahnya. Selain itu, I Ketut Sulia mencari informasi tentang menanam padi dengan bibit kwalitas unggul dari temannya sesama petani. Dengan pendampingan dari Dinari dan temannya, I Ketut Sulia merencanakan pinjaman sebesar Rp. 6.000.000.- Pinjaman tersebut dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit padi kwalitas unggul sebesar Rp. 3.000.000.-, biaya pengolahan tanah dengan menyewa pekerja sebesar Rp. 1.000.000.- dan membeli pupuk serta anti hama sebesar Rp. 2.000.000.- Semangat yang dimiliki I Ketut Sulia membuatnya yakin usahanya akan berjalan dengan baik dan sukses.
texts.en:
I Ketut Sulia owns a land of 2 hectares (around 5 acres) but this does not automatically make him a successful farmer. Due to his lack of knowledge on best farming techniques, he often fails to get the best result out of his farms.

He wants to join the Dinari foundation program so he can be guided by Dinari foundation's farming specialist and also to get funding to enable him to implement better farming methods.

He applies for a loan of IDR 6 million (around USD 550) from Dinari foundation. He is using IDR 3 million (USD 275) to buy high quality paddy seeds, another IDR 1 million (USD 92) is to be spent for hiring some men to clear and work the land, and IDR 2 million (USD 183) to buy fertilizer and pesticide.


Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: High quality paddy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married, has one child. She owns a retail business and sells clothing at the central market in Ordzhonikidze city. Her working capital is 18,000 UAH, and her profit is 2,100 UAH.

Irina has been in this business for 6 years. She decided to start this business and sell clothing because she saw the constant demand for it. Being quite entrepreneurial and a hardworking person, Irina was able to develop her business. Good quality and pricing of her goods brought her numerous repeat clients.

Irina would like to get a loan of 2,500 UAH to buy more inventory. She needs to bring more winter clothing out because in the cold winter, such clothing would be in high demand. Irina's goal for her business is to have a stable income and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, especially for winter, to resell

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
At 60, Beatriz is still assiduous about their farming business. She is married to a responsible man and they have nine children; four of them are already married and three are still studying. The family is living happily in the community even though life is quite difficult.

She and her husband manage a .06 hectare rice field, .05 vegetable field and a two fish ponds as their main source of income. Sometimes when they are not busy with their own farm, they work as farm laborers for others.

Beatriz and her husband observed that managing a vegetable farm is more profitable than planting corn and rice. So she wants to prioritize and expand her vegetable business and she is asking for a loan capital of PHP20, 000.00. She will utilize her loan to maintain her vegetable plants and her rice and corn fields.

She believes that God is merciful to those who do everything in life just to succeed. Thus, Beatriz really works hard for she knows that God will answer her prayers at an unexpected time.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand P. is already a widower at the age of 36. His two children serve as his inspiration to move on and work hard in order to send them to school. His eldest is Jane, 15 years old, a senior high school student and the other one is Fredimar, 14 years old and a junior high school student. They live in Barangay Rizal and their house is located just near their rice field, since the place is surrounded by agricultural land.

Ferdinand is busy managing his farm. With the help of his carabao (water buffalo) and cow, cultivating his rice field becomes a little easier. Thus, to avoid having debts from traders with high interest, Ferdinand is requesting a loan of only PHP10, 000.00 that he can use to purchase the farm inputs he needs.

Aside from farming, Ferdinand is also maintaining native mango trees which are harvested once a year. He is thankful that he can easily sell the mangoes at their market.

His dream is for his business to prosper so he can provide the educational needs of his children especially when they reach the college level. To fulfill his family's dream, Ferdinand is striving to work hard.

loans.use: additional working capital for his farm

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Hello from Aline U. in Kigali town in Rwanda! This entrepreneur is 31 years old, married with four children. Aline started her business when she was 14 years old, selling avocados and fruits like oranges, passion fruit, lemons, etc., carrying the basket on her head.

This entrepreneur has seen her business grow over the past years and she is now selling food items. She buys beans, rice, and sorghum in tons (many kilograms) and keeps them in her warehouse where she sells them at an increased price when they are in short supply and during the planting season. Besides the business, she also plants beans for both home consumption and for sale.

She is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Frws to increase her food stocks and be able to make money to pay for her children’s school fees next year; they study in secondary schools. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Increase her stock of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en: Mrs Bui Thi L.  lives in the Tan Huong commune, Ninh Giang district, Hai Duong province. She is 51 years old and has 2 children. She has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2003. Her family’s main income is trading poultry.  For the next loan cycle, Mrs. L. is requesting a loan of 10 million VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: Invest in poultry business

loans.name: Habib

texts.en: Habib, 40, lives in Saida, a town in southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Habib has been a taxi driver for ten years. He is requesting a loan of$ 700US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new taxi car. His clients are his friends and tourists. Habib has been a micro-credit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To purchase a new taxi car.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa E. is 36 years old and dreams to have a progressive family life and a stable job for her children so that they will not experience life's difficulties in the future.  She is married to Edwin, a farmer and their two children are: Lorgi – 21 years old, high school graduate and working as a factory worker and Rhea Mae – 11 years old, currently in elementary level.  

Teresa has been exposed to farming since she was a child so when she got married to a farmer, it became easy for her to help her husband in managing their farm.  Due to lack of capital, Teresa is requesting a loan of PHP18,000 which she can use this coming planting season.  She hopes to have a good yield for their business to become profitable and for them to continuously afford to send their children to school.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is married and has one child. He rents a store in Ordzhonikidze and sells clothing. Victor has been in this business for 12 years. He has been able to develop his business over this time and always tries to have a large variety of goods in order to satisfy his clients. Victor would like a loan to purchase more clothing for the winter season coming. Victor hopes that increased sales will bring him more income and is hoping to eventually own his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed, 26, lives in the town of Saida in southern Lebanon. Mohamed has been a carpenter for four years. He is requesting a loan of $1000US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase new blades for his saws. This is the first time that Rabih has requested a loan.

Mohamed has a speciA. niche in his community because he and his brother are the only carpenters in the region. This has been a family business. In the future, he plans to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase new blades for saws.

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Dương Thị K. năm nay 44  tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện nay chị là chủ cửa hàng làm đầu, chăm sóc sắc đẹp cho phụ nữ còn chồng chị  sửa chữa đồ điện gia dụng tại nhà. Với mức thu nhập hàng tháng đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng công việc kinh doanh và cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn  được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm trang thiết bị mở rộng cửa hàng.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. Thi Duong, 44 years old, has been participating in the fund since 2007. Currently, she is the owner of a beauty salon for women and her husband is an electrical repairman working out of their home. With an income of 4,000,000 VND per month, her family's finances are becoming increasingly stable and her family's quality of life is improving day by day. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in buying more equipment to expand her salon.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more equipment

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 35-year-old man who lives in Saida, a town in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Mohamed has been selling fruits and vegetables since 1989. He is requesting a loan of $500US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for his shop. This is his fifth loan and he has always paid on schedule.

The loans have influenced his life in a good way. Mohamed is known for his work because he sells quality products. His customers are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, Mohamed faced some difficulty paying the rent of his shop. He used to have a pick up that he used to sell his products. He plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a father of three children and a responsible husband to Luzviminda. Their children are: Franklin – 28 years old, college graduate, married and presently working as a security guard in Manila. Second is Jennifer, a computer course graduate and also working and the youngest is Francisco Jr., also a college graduate and working as a computer technologist.  Through their farming business, they were able to send their children to school and luckily gained college diplomas.  

Francisco is managing a one hectare field equally divided for their tobacco and rice farming. Every harvest, he is generating an estimated amount of PHP15,000 which is not enough to use as capital for the next planting season due to the increased cost of farm inputs.  He, therefore, requests a loan of PHP11,000 to be able to buy the needed farm inputs like fertilizer, seeds, etc.  Also, if the loan would be granted to him, he would not borrow from traders who collect higher interest rates. 

Francisco and his family are living a simple life in the community.  They maintain close family ties and hope that their bond will stay forever even when their children already have their own families.  He also prays that they will always be blessed with good health and able to overcome the challenges and calamities that may happen in their business.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Xiếp năm nay 50 tuổi. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành tại Thị trấn Gia Lộc tỉnh Hải Dương. Cả hai vợ chồng chị đều làm nghề kinh doanh buôn bán. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang có một cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh điện thoại di động với mức thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị Xiếp trong thời gian qua.
Vòngvốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh điện thoại di động.
texts.en:
Mrs. X. Thi Hoang is 50 years old. Mrs. Hoang is currently living with her husband and two adult children in the town of GIa Loc, province of Hai Duong. Both Mrs. Hoang and her husband do business trading goods. Currently, the family owns a store that sells mobile phones with an income of 3,000,000 VND per month. This business has also been the main source of income for the family in the past. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in the cell phone store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business
