loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih, 31, lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. Rabih has been selling compact discs for the past four years. He is requesting a loan of $700US from A. Majmoua in order to buy gifts for the “Eid”. (Eid is an Arabic word meaning "festivity".) This is the first time that Rabih has requested a loan.
  
Rabih is the only businessman in his neighborhood who sells computer hardware. His customers are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Rabih needs the loan to buy gifts for the "Eid".

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.en:
Geronimo is a simple farmer with simple dreams – to uplift their economic life and send their children to school with the help of his industrious wife.  He is married to Marina, who works as a vendor in their village.  Their inspirations in life are their two children: John Paul – 10 years old, grade IV elementary student and John Henry – 4 years old.
 
Farming has been their major source of income.  Geronimo produces rice every three to four months He earns a net income between PHP10,000 to PHP15,000 every harvest season.  Because of the expensive farm inputs, traders buy their rice products at a lower price. Because of this, he requests a loan of PHP18,000 to support his farming business and to avoid asking credits from traders with higher interest.  He is grateful that he was able to borrow from lenders that offers small interest and creates better opportunities in their lives - thus, helps their family to be free from poverty.  
	
Geronimo said that through prayers and hard work, his dreams can be achieved someday.  Providing his children their right to education is one of the important things that Geronimo prioritizes.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Rahmonberdi

texts.en: I. Rahmonberdi is 51 years old. He is married with two grown children. Rahmonberdi is a farmer. He has been working in agriculture for 20 years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. He has been producing such crops as potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables. Each year he produces enough to feed his family and to support his vegetable business.  The business is the family's main source of income. In order to generate a stable income, the business requires considerable funding. Today he is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300 USD). Rahmonberdi would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production.  This will allow him to increase the quality of his yield, along with his earnings at the time of sale. The loan will be repaid in 7 months. Rahmonberdi and his family are counting on your help. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Dib

texts.en:
Dib is a 67-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon with his wife and one child. Dib has been a carpenter for more than 25 years. He makes chairs and bedroom sets. He is requesting a loan of $500US from Al Majmoua in order to pay the mechanical taxes on his truck. This is his third loan and he has always paid on schedule.

He used to work in the civil defense sector, but then decided to open his own business.

loans.use: To pay his truck taxes.

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi: Chị Mai Thị Thử năm nay 46 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 5 năm. Ban đầu khi mới tham gia Quỹ chị vay mức vốn 700.000đ và đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Đến nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn T. rất ổn định từ dịch vụ  cày ruộng T.ê của chồng.. Với mức T. nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Thử đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn , hai con của chị cũng được đầu tư cho ăn học ngày càng tốt hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay  10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm máy bơm  nước và 1 máy cày mới nhằm  phục vụ ngày càng tốt hơn nhu cầu của người dân địa phương
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Thi Mai, 46 years old, has been participating in the Fund for 5 years. In the beginning, she borrowed 700,000 VND to invest in raising livestock. Besides livestock, the family also has a very stable income stream from her husband's field tilling service. With an income of 3,000,000 VND/month, Mrs. Mai's family is seeing a steady improvement in their quality of life. Her two children can also go to school. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in a water pump and a new tilling machine to provide better service for the locals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy water pump and plow

loans.name: Herlosita

texts.en:
Herlosita is married to Hipolito, a farmer in their village.  Their marriage has been gifted with six children: Gilbert – 34 years old, college undergraduate, working abroad; Bernard – 32 years old, high school graduate; Crisanto – 30 years old, high school graduate; Gerard – 25 years old, college undergraduate, also working abroad; Gersalin – 22 years old, also college undergraduate and Geny – 15 years old, a 3rd year high school student.  Three of their children are already married.  Her family lives in the hilly and peaceful Barangay of San Isidro.  

Herlosita is engaged in farm activities.  However, they lack financial resources to sustain their business so she is asking a loan of PHP10,000.  She intends to utilize the loan to buy their needed farm inputs like fertilizers, seedlings, insecticide and herbicide. Some of the amount will also be used to pay for labor works for those who will help them during the planting period. 

She is proud that despite their old age, she and her husband are continuously helping and supporting each other in reaching their dreams.  They want their farming business to grow in order to generate higher income and provide for the educational needs of their youngest child who is now in high school. They hope that they can provide her educational needs until college and finish her desire course.  

If the loan will be granted to her, Herlosita will no longer borrow from traders and somehow be free from asking credits to them in times of financial needs.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like fertilizers, seedlings, insecticide and herbicide and pay additional farm labor

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ năm nay 35 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương. Hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị đều đi buôn bán hoa quả. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Với  những kinh ngjiệm đã được tích luỹ trong nhiều năm và  sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị Huệ đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và đem lại cho gia đình chị nguồn thu nhập  ổn định 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 20.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh daonh hoa quả tăng thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Huệ is 35 years old. She, her husband, and their 2 children live in Ninh Giang district in the province of Hải Dương. They sell fruits and vegetables for a living, this is their main source of income. They have had multiple loans before which were used effectively combined with their experience in this domain, their business has become quite successful. Their income is 3.000.000 VND a month. This time Mrs Huệ is requesting a loan of 20.000.000 VND to invest in their business thus to increase their income in the long run.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her fruits & vegetables business

loans.name: Karimberdi

texts.en: I. Karimberdi is 40 years old. He is married and has two children. Karimberdi has an engineering education, but he switched to agriculture to increase his salary.  He has to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. Karimberdi works hard to cultivate his products such as potatoes, carrots, onions and other vegetables. He works from early morning until late night hoping to have a rich harvest. Karimberdi sells his crops in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business. Today Karimberdi is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300 USD) for the term of 7 months to buy bags to keep his products fresh to sell later, when the price for them will increase. Let's help Karimberdi as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Purchasing bags to keep his products fresh

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 30, lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ali has been working as a car mechanic for almost ten years. He is requesting a loan of $1000US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase machines for his business. This is his sixth loan and he has always paid on schedule.

Ali decided to start his business because he has been repairing cars since he was young. He is in demand because he has competitive prices and performs quality work. In the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing more sophisticated machines.

loans.use: To purchase auto mechanical machines for his business.

loans.name: Kuchak

texts.en: I. Kuchak is 56 years old. He is married with 4 daughters. Thanks to Kuchak's effort, all of his daughters are married with their own families. Kuchak provides taxi services with his car. He has been in this business for the last 8 years and has gained rich driving experience. Kuchak always tries to provide high-quality service at an attractive price. Kuchak is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable, as he is the main breadwinner in his large family. He is ready to work from early morning until late at night in order to keep his customers and obtain new ones. His car needs thorough repairing, so he is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1000 USD) for the term of 11 months. He wants to purchase spare parts and supplies such as an accumulator, wheels, antifreeze, and other supplies. Kuchak thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose D. became a widower during the early stage of his marriage.  Since then, he has been the father and mother of his three daughters: Lean – 17 years old, a high school graduate; Shella – 16 years old, fourth year high school student and Melvin Joy – 14 years old, a second year high school student.  

Jose is very assiduous in his farming business.  But due to lack of money, he could not sustain all his farming needs.  He really needs to continue his farming business because it is the only means for him to send his children to school and for his eldest child to pursue her college education.  He requests a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds.  He is really thankful to God that there people who are willing to lend him without asking for high interest compared to the traders.

He is proud that despite being a single parent, he still manages to send his children to school.  He is able to do this because he manages the farm and hog raising businesses well.

Jose is a man with a word of honor.  He does not promise anything that he is not sure of.  He said that he will sacrifice everything to provide a better life for her children, so he has to work hard and pray for his success.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: R. Muhabbat is a very diligent 42-year-old woman. She is married with 7 children. Her husband is a farmer. Thanks to her dear parents' skills, she is very familiar with agricultural work. Her loving father gave her farming fields 7 years ago, and she's been working them ever since. This activity has helped to cover the expenses of her family. Muhabbat wishes to improve the quality of her products.  So she is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300 USD) for the term of 12 months to buy mineral fertilizers; then she will have excellent products in this harvesting season. Please fulfill her request so that this hardworking mother can continue to develop her work with a lot of satisfaction.

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Nkokonjeru Model Group

texts.en: M. Grace is the leader of Nkokonjeru Model One in Lugazi. She is 40 years old and married with 6 children, ages 4 to 23 and all attending school. Grace has a poultry farm business where she keeps chicken both for meat and for egg. Her market is in Nkokonjeru and Lugazi. She has spent 8 years in the same business and as a result, she has been able to own an organized home. She also has cows that she milks to pay fees for her children. Very soon the eldest child will school. Grace needs a loan to be able to buy more feed in bulk for her chickens since buying in small quantities is costly due to transport fees.

loans.use: Buy more chicken feeds in bulk.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Hanaa has been working as a hair dresser for ten years. She is requesting a loan of $1000US from Al Majmoua in order to pay her medical treatment expenses. This is her third loan and she has always paid on time.

When Hanaa first started her business, she had to rely on her own funding because she didn’t receive any family support. She decided to do start this business because of her social condition. Her business is special because she goes to private houses. Hanaa doesn’t have a shop for her hairdresser. Her customers are her friends and her neighbors.

loans.use: To pay for personal medical treatment expenses.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
For almost 22 years, Rudy has been in the farming business. He is now 47 years old, married and has two children: Rudylyn – 21 years old, a college graduate and Rudy Mar – 11 years old, still at the elementary level. Their house is located in Barangay San Vicente in the province of Quirino, Isabela and it is considered a hilly place. The main products in their town are corn, rice, and tobacco. Vegetables are mostly planted in the backyards of the residents.

Rudy is in need of financial assistance to maintain his .8 hectare of rice and corn field. For this, he is asking if he can have a loan of PHP 10,000.00. This loan is not enough to cover all his needs but he chose to borrow a smaller amount to make sure that he can pay it back on time. Some of the things that he would like to purchase are fertilizer and hybrid seeds for his rice field.

He will do his best in order for his business to become profitable and provide for the immediate needs of his family. According to Rudy, he should work and work and work in order to become progressive.

loans.use: additional working capital for his farm

loans.name: Neyaz

texts.en:
Neyaz is a 48-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, a southern suburb of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Neyez has been selling clothes, books and games for four years. She is requesting a loan of $800US to pay school tuition fees. This is her fourth loan and she has always paid on time.

Past loans have improved her business. Neyaz buys items depending on the season. For example, before school season, she sells school supplies like books, pencils and other products related to school. Before Christmas, she sells Christmas gifts and clothes. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Neyaz decided to opening her shop because of her sociA. condition. She plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Vững năm nay 49 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành tại huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn làm nghề buôn bán thịt lợn và đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Với mức thu nhập bình quân đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Vững đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn thịt về giết mổ phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu thụ thực phẩm của người dân địa phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Vững is 49 years old. She participates in TYM fund since 2002. She, husband and their 2 children live in Ninh Giang district, Hải Dương province. Their 2 children are grown up. They raise poultry and sell pork, this later is their main source of revenue. They make 3.000.000 VND a month. This gives them financial stability. For this round of loan, she is requesting 20.000.000 VND to buy more pigs in preparation for the upcoming Tet rush.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy pigs

loans.name: Nhữthị

texts.vi:
Chị Nhữ Thị G. năm nay 49 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành tại thị trấn Gia Lộc tỉnh Hải Dương. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn mở cửa hàng kinh doanh phân bón.Với mức thu nhập bình quân đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị G. đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 để đầu tư cho công việc kinh daonh phân bón tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. NhữThị G. is 49 years old. She has been participating in the TYM Fund since 2002. She is currently living in the town of Gia Lộc Hải Dương District with her husband. Her two children are grown. In addition to raising livestock, her family has a fertilizer retail business. With an average income of 3,000,000 VND per month, the family's financial situation becomes more stable and continues to improve daily. For this loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest further in their fertilizer retail business to increase the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest further into her fertilizer retail business

loans.name: Nkokonjeru Model Two Group

texts.en:
Annet M. is the leader of Nkokonjeru Model Two in Lugazi. She is 43 years old, and married with 4 children who are all in school. Annet has a retail shop business where she sells spare parts for generators, saw milling machines, boda bodas, and so much more. The loans have been so helpful in recapitalizing this shop and the profits have helped Annet in opening up another business in poultry. Here, Annet keeps layers for eggs and this helps her to bring in a daily income from the sale of eggs alone. She has a hope that in future, she will be able to sell the layers and buy others to replace the current ones.

She has spent 8 years in the shop business and 2 years with poultry, and her family and business life is far better off as a result of the loans. Annet needs a loan for both businesses, to buy more spare parts and feed for the layers.

loans.use: Buying machine spare parts and feeds for the chicken.

loans.name: Bouran

texts.en:
Bouran, 33, lives in Bourj el Barajneh, a southern suburb of Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. She has been selling cleaning products and seasonA. food merchandise for four years. Bouran is requesting a loan of $800US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for her shop and to pay school tuition fees. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan.

The loan will help her improve her family's income. She has a good reputation because of her honesty and the way she treats her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Bouran decided to open her business because her family needed more income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop and pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Christophe

texts.en:
Greetingz from Christopher H. from the northern province of Rwanda! Christopher H. is 31 years old with 4 children.

This entrepreneur has a stand in Musanze market where he sells clothes and shoes for men, women, and children.

Christopher is requesting a loan worth 515 000 Rwf to increase his working capital and be able to make enough money to pay his children’ school fees next year. This loan will be repaid in 8 months

loans.use: Increase his working capital

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
“I am worried and a bit concerned about how would I spend our limited income to meet all my family needs”, says Luzviminda E., 47-year-old mother of four children from Lagao, General Santos City. As a loving wife, she has been helping her spouse nurture their family well.  As a couple, they jointly work hard to raise all their children and provide quality education by sending all of them to school. 

To augment their income, she is engaged in making doormats, which she sells in her neighborhood and to Star Bright Company in Polomolok, South Cotabato.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,0000 to purchase more materials in making doormats. She also considers trying to invest in other possible income areas. “I wanted to contributure to the family income to provide my children’s need”, she said. “ I believe that my being part of CEVI could help me achieve my aspirations. Now, I am well provided with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI offers”, she added.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials in making doormats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more cellphones and cellphone cards to resell

loans.name: Donatien

texts.en:
Muraho (Hello!) from Donatien U. in the northern province of Rwanda! Donatien is 26 years old.

Donatien started by selling groundnuts (peanuts) in the center of Masha, Cyabingo Sector, with a capital of 300 Rwf given him by his mother. This 300 Rwf working capital increased to 3000 Rwf in six months; then he started to sell salt. This business grew and enabled him to buy land for his mother and a bike, which helps him with transport.

After 3 years, his capital had increased to 80,000 Rwf and he started selling clothes in the market of Masha Center in Cyabingo sector. The business has been prosperous since he has reached a working capital of 300 000 Rwf, and with that amount, he opened a small shop in the same center of Masha. He decided to shift that rural center to Musanze Town after reaching a working capital of 400 000 Rwf. There, he is running a business selling different articles such as perfumes, soaps, bags, and detergent.

Donatien is requesting a loan worth 400 000 Rwf which will help him to expand his business. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Further expand his ever-growing business

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza C. is just 20 years old; but despite her youthful age, she aspires to have better life for her parents and siblings. She is a typical daughter from Polomolok South Cotabato who found herself joining other entrepreneur hopefuls in the CEVI credit program.

She sells second-hand shoes, earning for her enough for her family needs. She works hard like a head of the family to make sure that they will have enough food to share in their table.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI to purchase more second-hand shoes to sell. “ Being young doesn’t stop me to hope and dream for my family, I joined CEVI because I see that they really lift up poor people like us who want to change their lives’, she said. “ My participation in the program entitled me easy access to credit assistance, training and insurance coverage of CEVI. This really is something that I was so happy about considering that I really need assistance to grow my business, she added.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand shoes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Venyll

texts.en:
Venyll J., a 31-year old mother, owns a flower shop in Polomolok, South Cotabato. Her husband, who is working in a food chain store, has also been helping her run the business. As a mother, she dreamed to give the best to his son who is still studying. She decided joining other wives in CEVI credit program because she believes her participation could help her realize her dreams.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional flowers for her business expansion and improvement  of her shop. She stressed that she needs a much better place to display all her flowers.  “This is to attract more customers and augment my sales”, she added.

“By joining CEVI, I have access to credit assistance, training and insurance coverage they provide to all their clients”, she said. “I also had the chance to talk with other entrepreneurs how they manage their businesses”, she added.

loans.use: To buy additional flowers for sale and for improvement of her shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
“ It pains me when I see my grandchildren not being provided with the things they need”, says Juana O., a 61-year-old mother from Polomolok South Cotabato. Five of her children are already married and have their own family. She is already old and doesn’t want to depend on them because they have separate lives already. "What I need to do is to focus more on my store to increase my sales because I want to help my children raise their kids”, she added. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from CEVI to purchase additional items to sell in her store. She also considers looking into some other possible income-generating ventures like retailing charcoal to augment her income.

She is happy that she became part of CEVI credit program, now she has access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage it offers.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita B., age 44, is a widow and has no children. Making dresses is her only source of income. In an interview after the death of her husband, she sadly shares that she has been very lonely. Sewing rugs and dress making is her only source of living. People come to her to have nice dresses made. Estelita says, “My mother taught me how to properly sew all the fabrics and design clothes, and I am still using her sewing machine for the food that I eat”.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 to purchase fabrics for rugs and dresses. She also wants to try some other lines of business to augment her income. In this way she could expand her business and employ more helpers.

She believes that by joining CEVI, she will realize her plans. Now, she enjoys credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage through CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to use in making rugs and dresses.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Greetings from Vicky G. in Kigali, Rwanda! Vicky is 33 years old, married with 3 children and one adopted orphan.

Vicky owns her Internet café, located in Kicukiro, a suburb of Kigali. In her Internet café, she charges customers for using the Internet at a rate of about US$ 1 for an hour. In the café also, she does secretarial work for her customers and gets paid. Rwanda is becoming a communications hub for east and central Africa, so most people use the Internet.

Vicky is looking for a loan worth 500,000 Frws to be repaid in 8 months. The loan would be used to buy more paper, ink for printers, files, etc. and more internet broadband. Her dream is to buy more computers for her growing business.

loans.use: buying necessary supplies for her internet cafe

loans.name: Groupement Novissi

texts.en:
The Novisi Group is a sewing business that consists of 10 entrepreneurs who live and work in Wome, Togo, a small village located approximately 130 kilometers from the capital. The group consists of 8 women – Iveth K., Prisca D., Aimée A., Beatice Y., Abra E. A., Cecile A., Aku M. T. and Afua G. – and 2 men, Dieu Donne A. and Moussilé T.. Everyone in the group is married with children except for the woman on the far right in the photo, who is 19 years old and an apprentice.

The Novisi Group provides sewing and other tailoring services for their community and has earned a very positive reputation in the 5 years that it has been in operation. With this loan from FECECAV, the Novisi Group hopes to buy 3 more sewing machines and a fresh inventory of thread, buttons, and zippers. They also hope to expand the space in which they work. With the expansion of their business, each member of the Novisi Group will be able to support the needs of their families and continue to provide this important service to their community.

loans.use: Buy sewing machines and additional inventory

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.en: I. Saifullo is 49 years old and lives in the village of Penjikent. He is married with two children. He supports his children as well as his wife and parents.  His main source of income is farming and raising livestock. Saifullo is an experienced livestock breeder. In order to better manage his herds and increase productivity, he needs to build an enclosure for them.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for the term of 11 months. This will allow him to make his livestock business more profitable so that he can better support his family.

loans.use: Building an enclosure for his livestock.

loans.name: Eliphaz

texts.en:
Greetings from Eliphaz Z. in Kigali, Rwanda! Eliphaz is 40 years old, married with four children and two adopted orphans.

This entrepreneur has a clothes shop where he sells various clothes for women, men, both children and adults in his hometown. Besides his business, he rents out two houses and earns about US$ 38 every month.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan in the amount of 500,000 Frws to be repaid in 8 months. The loan use is buying more clothes for his inventory since he is expecting high sales during the Christmas festivities. His future plan is to open up a big clothing shop in downtown Kigali.

loans.use: Increase his inventory of clothing

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A. O. is a 46-year-old widow and responsible for providing for 5 children. Three of the children are orphans that Pamela cares for, and all 5 children are currently enrolled in school.

Pamela has owned a butcher shop in the market in Rongo, Kenya since 2003. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings ($150.00) to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.use: Buy additional meat for sale

loans.name: Mustafokul

texts.en: S. Mustafokul is 51 years old. He is married with a 10-year-old son. Mustafokul rents a little store where he sells construction supplies. He buys his goods from different cities, wherever they are cheaper, and sells them in his store. He purchases goods every week. His family members also help him at the store. He has many constant clients. He wants to take a loan for purchasing more goods so he can earn more profit. With the bigger profit, he plans to purchase his own store someday.

loans.use: construction supplies

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Greetings from Rachel in Byumba, Rwanda! She is 38 years old with three children.

She manages a clothes shop for women and children in Byumba city center. Rachel works hard and travels often to neighboring country, Uganda, to import some goods.While her business has a steady and loyal clientele, during the rainy season her business faces difficulty in attracting new customers. Therefore, Rachel is requesting a loan of 200,000 Rwf to improve and expand her business. 

She has been a good client of Vision Finance Company for 3 years. Her previous loans from VFC have helped her improve her business so that she can feed the family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Z. Rano is 48 years old mother of two children. For most of her family life, she has been dedicated to raising livestock. The self-sacrifice and attention that she brings to raising each one of her young cows has resulted in an increase of the quantity of calves. As a result, she is able to give her children the opportunity to pursue university studies, giving her much pride and satisfaction. 

Her next goal is to expand the business into selling milk. This business would generate enough additional income to sustain her home and enable her to pay the university costs for her children. In order to meet her goals, Rano is asking for a loan to buy more cattle. Rano hopes that her expanded business will help her realize the dream of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina L., a 46-year-old woman, is married with three children. Marina has been breeding calves in the small village of Imishli since 2000. Since living with her husband, she has bought and sold cattle. Marina works as an administrator of a local kindergarten, but her salary is not enough to cover the basic needs of her three children. Now Marina wants to expand her business, and as her children grow, she thinks that she will be able to sell more cattle with their help. She is requesting 1200 USD for the term of 15 months in order to purchase cattle. Marina expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Khaladdin

texts.en: Khaladdin S. is 48 years old and married with three children. Thirteen years ago, he started his business of raising sheep. His primary business is with the local restaurants. As mutton is very popular among Azerbaijani people, this business can bring stable income. Khaladdin works as a farmer to help with the harvest. Despite having two jobs, his business is still quite small and doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Khaladdin would like to request a loan to expand his business. He will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. Khaladdin is asking for a loan of 1200 USD in order to buy more sheep to raise. He thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: Purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara R. sells clothing and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Sara is 27 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is a policeman. Her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to keep sending her child to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Dayanet

texts.en: Dayanet A. is 26 years old and lives in Imishli in southern Azerbaijan. He lives with his parents and is not married yet. He is a small business owner who sells different kinds of foodstuff and detergents in his store which is very famous in his community, thus allowing him to have a good clientele. This store generates the only financial income for his family and Dayanet tries very hard to run his business successfully. He is also very focused on being polite with his customers. Today Dayanet is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. Dayanet's main goal is to get married in near future and provide welfare to his current and future family. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more food inventories

loans.name: Hejer

texts.en: Hejer G. has an established business selling textiles, tablecloths, curtains, and towels in a rented place in a big market. She started her business four years ago in her hometown, the southern city of Sabirabad. She has an entrepreneurial mind, and she has worked hard to develop her business. Buying textile inventory from Baku, the capital city, where she can get better prices, is one way in which she is able to gain a competitive business advantage. Moreover, she is planning on bringing goods in from Turkey. Hejer is married and she has four children. One of her goals for the future is to provide all of her children with houses. Hejer is requesting a loan of 1200 USD in order to expand her rented place and purchase more textiles. With additional inventories, she will be able to increase her sales and will continue to provide a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory and enlarge her store

loans.name: Intizar

texts.en: Intizar Q. is 40 years old, married, and has two children whom she supports by selling textiles for curtains and sewing them for orders. Having worked in this business for almost two years, Intizar has good taste and is trusted by her clients to choose various textiles for many different kinds of occasions. Most of her clientele are young ladies preparing for marriage who purchase curtains for dowry. Intizar's commercial success recently allowed her to enlarge her current place of work, and her overall income is now enough to send her son to university. In order to further develop her business, Intizar is requesting a loan of 1200 USD, which she will use to purchase an even wider array of curtains for resale.

loans.use: Enlarge place of work via purchase of more curtain textiles

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en:
Assisted by her husband and children, Zarifa Q., a mother of 10, has been raising livestock for 20 years in the small village of Imishli, located in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Because Zarifa and her family look to nourish the animals and keep them happy in hopes of ultimately selling them at a just price, each morning she arises early so that they may graze among the hills all day.

That she and her family are able to sustain themselves fills Zarifa with great satisfaction, and she is now requesting a loan to purchase more livestock to expand her enterprise. With your support, Zarifa will be able to accomplish her business goals.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Marifet

texts.en:
Marifet M. is 25-year-old single man who lives with his parents and takes care of them. Marifet is a hard-working man who was taught farming by his father. 

He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business about three years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and is proud to say that the business has been running well. However, he now needs additional capital to expand his business. Therefore, Marifet is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to purchase four cows for an estimated cost 300 USD each. 

He thanks you very much for the support that you offer him in helping to expand his business and helping him to give his parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret B. sells food at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Margret is 30 years old and is divorced. She has three children, all of whom are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham Q. is 45 years old, married and has three children. His principal work is the buying and selling of cattle. Ilham lives in the small village of Imishli city in the southern part of Azerbaijan. 

He purchase baby calves, fattens and raises them and after 5-6 months sells them in the local Imishli livestock bazaar. The business is very profitable, but his lack of capital makes his income insignificant, and living conditions remain difficult in his household.

To strengthen his business, he is asking for a loan of 1200 USD, which will serve to buy more cattle to expand his business. This will allow him to more effectively meet the needs of his household.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Ruzi

texts.en:
Ruzi M. is 21 years old, young and full of energy.  He runs a cattle breeding business in a small village in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Ruzi is a hard-working man who started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment.

He knew many people who purchased cattle and this motivated him to start his own business four years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales and he is proud to say that the business has been running well. 

Ruzi now needs additional capital to expand his business. Therefore, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to purchase additional cattle to sell. More specifically, he will reinvest the loan proceeds and grow the business, as he has been doing. He thanks you very much for the support that you offer him in helping to expand his business and give his old parents a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Safadur

texts.en:
Safadur Q. is a 57-year-old man who breeds calves and sells dairy products to local people and dairy factories. He is married and has ten children!

The difficult circumstances and hardships in his life made him recognize from a very young age the value of work. For more than 20 years, he has been purchasing young cattle in the local market, and then fattening and selling them. Raising livestock is the main financial income source in his family. Safadur wakes up early every morning to feed his calves and cow, with the goal of selling them at the best price in the local market when they have grown enough.

Safadur's main goal is to provide an education for his youngest two kids who are studying at school now. With this purpose in mind, he has applied for a loan in the amount of $1200 USD to buy calves in order to expand his business. Let's support this hard-working man and hold our hands out to help him.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. sells beer at the bar in wholesale and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Grace is 28 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a secretary in the ministry. Her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor-bike for hire.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen Adrew sells sugar, beans, soap, and beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Hellen is 25 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a soldier. Her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Tashkilat

texts.en: Tashkilat Q. is 48 years old, married and has four children who he supports by raising and selling cattle. By purchasing cattle in the central market and caring for them, Tashkilat is able to resell them at much higher prices. He learned this trade from his father and is recognized in his village as being an expert with livestock. Despite the fact that Tashkilat rises at five o'clock every morning to care for his animals, and continues working until it is dark again at night, his family is still poor and struggles to pay for basic necessities. In order to improve their standard of living, he is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase more calves and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Yawo

texts.en:
Yawo B. is 39 years old and a married father. In the local language, Ewe, his first name indicates that he was born on a Thursday. Yawo lives in Wome, a small town approximately 130 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Wome is situated in a lush and beautiful area of Togo near the border with Ghana and is somewhat isolated.

Yawo operates a taxi-moto business to take many residents of Wome to nearby villages. Yawo picks up passengers along the road and drops them off at their destination. His services are always in demand.

To better serve his clients, Yawo hopes to use this loan from Kiva to buy a newer, more comfortable motorcycle. With the profits he will earn with the new motorcycle, Yawo can better provide for his wife and children and save money to send them to school.

loans.use: Buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Ziyadkhan

texts.en:
Ziyadkhan J. is a hard-working entrepreneur from a southern city of Azerbaijan called Sabirabad. He is married and the happy father of three children. He owns a market vending business where he sells men’s shirts, hats and shoes. Ziyadkhan decided to start his own business when he retired on pension. It was very hard to keep his family on a pension that was very low. Now, Ziyadkhan has a successful business and works in his own store all day. Income coming from this store is the only financial source in his family.

Ziyadkhan has requested a loan of $1200 USD. He will purchase suits with the purpose of increasing his profit. Ziyadkhan will use the profits from his business to improve his standard of living and do some remodelling of his home.

loans.use: To purchase suits for sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty M. sells fried fish and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Betty is 27 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is a soldier. Her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land and build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Join

texts.en:
Join J. sells charcoal and beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Join is 35 years old, married, and has eight children. Her husband is a store keeper in the UN office. Her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty D. sells sugar and oil and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Betty is 38 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband is a peasant. Her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a vehicle.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos que están estudiando y a su conviviente que lo apoya en todo. El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su propio motocarro, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace ya ocho años, trabaja durante todo el día por los diferentes lugares de su zona. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto directo con el público, y le es rentable, ya que es él mismo quien administra los ingresos y egresos de su feria y gastos familiares, por lo que le va muy bien. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar repuestos para mandar a reparar su moto y así seguir produciendo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 36 years old and lives with his three sons who are studying, and his partner who supports him in everything. He dedicates himself to provide transportation services in his own motorcar, an activity which he has been doing for eight years. He works during the day in various areas of his zone. What he enjoys most about his work is being in direct contact with the public, and it is profitable for him as he himself administers his income from fares and his family’s expenses and this all goes very well for him. This is his third loan with MFP, and he has demonstrated himself to be responsible with his payments. With the funds requested, he will purchase replacement parts so he can send his vehicle out for repair and that way be able to continue producing what’s necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts to repair his motocar.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 45 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos que están estudiando, vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en todo. Se dedica al arte textil, lo viene haciendo desde hace ocho años atrás, confecciona prendas para adultos, como también trabaja para algunas instituciones que requieren de sus buenos servicios y le hacen diferentes pedidos, como uniformes, etc. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer mucha gente con quienes comparte muchos diálogos y debido a que cuenta con muchos clientes fieles que recurren a ella desde que se inició en el negocio, le va muy bien. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir su taller textil, también quiere comprar materiales como telas, hilos, agujas, entre otros, para la confección de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Alicia is 45 years old, the mother of four children who are in school, and lives with her husband who supports her in everything. She dedicates herself to textile arts, which she has been doing for eight years. She creates clothing for adults, and also works for some companies who require her excellent services and order different items from her such as uniforms, etc. What she likes about her work is getting to know many people with whom she can dialogue and, because she enjoys repeat business from many loyal customers, things are going very well for her. This is her third loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments. With the funds she is requesting, she will start the construction on her textile workshop. She also wants to buy materials such as fabrics, threads, needles, and other items for making her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her textile workshop and purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es: Benjamín tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, vive junto a sus padres, quienes lo ayudan en lo posible. El es propietario de un motocarro, con el cual se dedica al transporte de pasajeros por los distintos lugares de la zona donde vive, esto desde hace 5 años atrás, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es entablar relación y darles un buen trato a sus pasajeros, le es muy rentable este trabajo, ya que él mismo administra sus ganancias diarias y no cuenta con mucha responsabilidad económica por el momento, por lo que le va bien laboral y personalmente. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a reparar su moto para poder trabajar tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Benjamín is 27 years old, single, and lives with his parents who help him as much as possible. He owns his motocar, which he has used to transport passengers to the different areas of the zone where he lives for the past five years. What he likes about his work is establishing relationships and providing quality service to his passengers. His enterprise is very profitable for him, since he himself administers his daily earnings and he doesn’t have many financial responsibilities at this time. Things go well for him both in work and in his personal life. This is his first loan with MFP, and he pledges to be punctual with his installments. With the funds he is requesting, he will send his motocar for repair so he can work without disruptions.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to his motocar.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose G. sells Irish potatoes and beans and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rose is 40 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a peasant. Her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build an internet café. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline A. O. is a 28-year-old woman living in Rongo, Kenya. She is married to a farmer, and together they are raising 5 children, who are all currently enrolled in school.

Roseline has been selling fish in the local market since 2003. She purchases the fish from nearby Mbita and Homabay. She has recently applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings ($150.00) in order to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: Buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Cleris

texts.es: Cleris tiene 30 años de edad, es madre dos niños pequeños, vive junto a su esposo que la ayuda en todo y está de acuerdo con sus decisiones para la mejora de su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas, hace un año pudo abrir una pequeña fuente de soda, trabajo que le gusta mucho realizar, y da una buena atención día a día a sus clientes. Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicado en un buen lugar y es muy concurrido por personas que degustan de sus bebidas, debido al  clima caluroso y a su amable trato. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a ampliar, ambientar e implementar mejor su negocio para tener más acogida.
texts.en:
Cleris is 30 years old, mother of two small children, and she lives with her husband who helps her with everything and support her decisions to improve her business. She sells beverages. A year ago she opened a small soda fountain, work that she enjoys very much, and she provides excellent customer service. This business is very profitable for her, as it is located in a good place and frequented by people who enjoy her beverages due to the hot climate and friendly service. This is her second loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated to be responsible with her payments. With the money she will expand, decorate, and improve her business to be more welcoming.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and decorate her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 24 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo pequeño que la quiere mucho, ella vive junto a sus padres que la apoyan mucho en su negocio. Su actividad diaria es la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, la cual le gusta mucho porque le permite interactuar con sus vecinos y otras personas que compran sus productos, ella los recibe siempre con una buena atención para que se sientan a gusto. Le es rentable porque su bodega tiene un ingreso diario por la gran concurrencia que tiene, le va excelentemente, nos comenta. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, además de implementar con más productos y ambientarlo adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Delia is 24 years old, a single mother of one small son who she loves very much. She lives with her parents and they support her a lot in her business. She sells groceries and basic needs products daily, work she has been doing for 4 years. She likes the work because it enables her to interact with her neighbors and other people that buy her products, and she treats her customers well so they feel comfortable. Her store is profitable because she has customers daily, and she tells us her business is going well. This is her 4th loand with MFP, and she has been responsible with her payments. With the money she will expand her business, add products, and adequately decorate her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the products that she sells

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Dar es salaam, Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Mariam K. M.. She is the proud mother of Salim, who is 10, as well as the supporter of one dependent who was orphaned. Mariam is a Tanzanian entrepreneur who has owned a tailoring business since 2004. Mainly she makes and sells clothes at her business; however, sometimes she sells other cloth items, such as bedsheets, at her store in order to meet customer demand.

Her business is doing well and she is able to make an average monthly profit of about 200 USD. Mariam is requesting a loan of 800 USD in order to buy an additional sewing machine, cloth, and thread. She is planning to hire more employees because she is currently working for more than 16 hours a day, which is simply too many hours for one individual to sustain. She thanks you in advance for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine, cloth, and thread for her business

loans.name: Iddy

texts.en:
Greetings from Iddy in Kigali, Rwanda! Iddy is 28 years old, single and has two adopted orphans.

Iddy has been a motorbike taxi driver for three years. He gets up at 5 am everyday to start transporting people to their work places. He needs to pay $6 per day to the owner of the motorbike in order to use it.  

Iddy is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf to buy his own motorbike taxi. He will be paying this loan in 8 months. His goal is to send all his siblings to school and build a house for the family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es: Delicia es madre soltera, tiene 40 años de edad y vive junto a sus dos hijos que estudian y la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y adultos, actividad que  viene realizando desde hace dos años, le gusta su trabajo porque es muy conversadora y eso le permite dar una buena atención a sus clientes y lo que le agrada mucho es  conocer a mucha gente con quienes comparte diferentes ideas. Este negocio le resulta rentable porque sus prendas las lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona o también por pedidos, como sus clientes constantemente le solicitan le va muy bien. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. El motivo por el que solicita este monto es para comprar más ropa, posteriormente quiere alquilar un local para poner una tienda estable para su negocio.
texts.en:
Delicia is a single mother, 40 years old, and lives with her two children who study and support her very much. She sells clothing for children and adults, a profession she has done for two years. She likes her work because she is very talkative and this enables her to provide good attention to her customers. She enjoys meeting people with whom she can share different ideas. This business is profitable for her because she sells her clothing in different places throughout her neighborhood and also by order, as her customers constantly ask her for items so things are going well for her. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she has been responsible with her payments. She will use the loan to buy more clothing, then she wants to rent a locale to open a store for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of clothing to sell

loans.name: Vobia

texts.en:
Vobia D. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Vobia is 38 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband is a peasant. Her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo pequeño y vive junto a su conviviente que siempre la ayuda en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado en un puesto del mercado, desde hace seis años atrás, lo que le  gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes. Le es muy rentable porque sus pescados salen como pan caliente, nos dice, además cuenta con una clientela selecta y fiel a su puesto. Lo que dificulta su labor es durante las temporadas de lluvias porque no cuenta con un kiosco que la pueda cubrir. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere  mandar a construir un kiosco y así protegerse de las lluvias, a ella y a su producto.
texts.en:
Elsa is 23-years-old. She has a young son and lives with her husband, who always supports her in everything. She has sold fish at a stand in the market for 6 years. What she likes about her job is giving good attention to her customers. She tells us that her business is profitable because her fish sell like hot cakes. She also has a select and loyal clientele that buy from her stand. The difficult part of her work is during times of rain because she doesn't have a kiosk that she can cover her fish with. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has proven to be responsible with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she wants to have a kiosk constructed to protect herself and her products from the rain.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk to sell her products

loans.name: Enoc

texts.es: Enoc tiene 34 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos estudiantes, vive junto a su esposa quien lo apoya mucho. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace dos años atrás. Él es propietario de un motocarro, y él mismo es quien lo maneja durante el día para brindar su servicio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer a muchas personas y darles un buen trato, eso es lo primordial, nos menciona. Le es rentable porque el mismo administra las ganancias y como no tiene que contratar un chofer, entones los ingresos van directamente a sus manos. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su herramienta de trabajo y trabajar tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Enoc is 34 years old, father to 2 school-aged children, and he lives with his wife who supports him very much. For two years he has worked providing public transportation. He is the owner of a motorcar, and he himself drives it during the day to provide his service. What he enjoys of his work is meeting many people and providing them good service, and this is the most important thing, he tells us. It is profitable because he himself keeps the earnings and as he doesn’t have to contract a driver, the income goes directly into his hands. This is his 4th loan with MFP, and he has demonstrated responsibility with his payments. With this loan he will buy parts to repair his motorcar and therefore work tranquilly.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts for his motorcar

loans.name: Guida

texts.es: Guida es madre soltera, vive junto a sus 3 hijos que están estudiando y la apoyan mucho. Su dedicación a la venta de comida logró que pudiera construir en su propio domicilio su pequeño restaurante, donde por las noches vende salchipollo (salchicha y pedazos de pollo fritos), debido a que sus clientes se lo pedían, por su buena atención y sazón, se ha ganado el cariño y respeto de sus comensales, ete negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, le gusta mucho cocinar bien para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos. Le es rentable, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y le va excelente, nos cuenta. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar mesas y sillas, para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Guida is a single mother who lives with her 3 children who are students and support her a lot. Her dedication selling food enable her to be able to build a small restaurant in her own home, where in the evenings she sells “salchipollo” (sausage and pieces of fried chicken), as this is what her customers ask her to prepare, and because of her good attention and seasoning, she has won the love and respect of her companions. She has had this business for 10 years. She very much enjoys cooking well so that her customers will be satisfied. Her business is profitable, as it is located in a good area and it is going well, she tells us. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her payments. With the money she wants to buy tables and chairs to provide a more inviting environment for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture for her restaurant.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old and married with 6 children, who are all enrolled in school.

Joyce A. O. has been selling cereals in the local market in Rongo, Kenya since 2002. Over the past 6 years, Joyce has been purchasing her cereal supplies from the towns of Sinare, Busia, and Ahero. She has recently decided to expand her business and would like a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings ($150.00) to expand her inventory and purchase larger quantities of cereals.

loans.use: Buy more cereal to sell

loans.name: Selua

texts.en:
Selua J. sells fresh fish and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Selua is 35 years old, married, and has eight children, Her husband is a soldier. Her children all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier tiene 44 años, es padre de tres hijos que estudian, vive con su conviviente  quien lo apoya mucho. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas en un espacio que implementó dentro de su vivienda, formando así su pequeña bodega, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace un año atrás, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus clientes quienes son el factor importante de su negocio. Le es rentable ya que él mismo se encarga de administrar su negocio. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos y así surtir su bodega con lo necesario.
texts.en:
Javier is 44 years old, father to three school-ages children, and lives with his wife who supports him a lot. He sells groceries and beverages in a space that he opened within his home, creating a small convenience store. He has had this business for a year, and what he likes about the work is providing good service to his customers who are the most important part of his business. It is profitable as he himself is in charge of and manages his business. This is his 3rd loan with MFP, and he has demonstrated being responsibility with his payments. With the money from the loan he will buy more products and stock his store with what is needed.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in his store

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus hijos que están estudiando y la quieren mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, la lleva a vender por los diferentes caseríos del río Ucayali, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y mucha gente. Le es rentable debido a que lleva sus prendas y las vende personalmente, además no hay lugares cercanos donde sus clientes puedan comprar ropa, por lo que la esperan para comprar sus prendas. Lo que no le gusta es dejar a sus hijos, pero tiene a su hermana quien los cuida mientras ella está lejos. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita va a alquilar un local para poner su tienda de ropa estable y así poder estar más cerca de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jessica is 28-years-old; is a single mother; and lives with her children who are in school and who love her very much. She sells used clothing, which she takes to sell in the different towns of the Ucayali River. What she likes about her job is getting to know many places and people. It is profitable since she takes her clothes and sells them personally. There also aren't any nearby places where her customers can buy clothing, so they wait to buy clothes from her. What she doesn't like is leaving her children, but she has a sister who takes care of them while she is far away. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has proven to be responsible with her payments. With the money she is requesting, she is going to rent a location to start a stable clothing store so she can be closer to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a location to sell her clothing

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, quien por le momento se encuentra mal de salud y sus 6 hijos que son independientes y de familia. Su labor diaria, y a la que se dedica arduamente es la venta de plátanos y frutas regionales, con esta labor puede sostener los gastos de su hogar, lo que viene realizando desde hace un año atrás, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una muy buena acogida a su clientes, además le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y sobre todo es un lugar muy concurrido, por lo que sus productos se agotan pronto y le va muy bien. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un kiosco para vender sus plátanos y frutas regionales tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Juana is 53-years-old and lives with her husband, who for the moment is in bad health. They have six children who are independent and have families. The work to which she dedicates herself arduously every day is selling plantains and regional fruits. With this work she can pay for her home's expenses. She has done this work for a year. What she likes about her job is giving a good welcome to her customers. It is profitable for her because it is located in a good area and above all, a very frequented place. Her products sell out quickly, and it is going very well for her. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she promises to be punctual with her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she will construct a kiosk to sell her plantains and regional fruits peacefully.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 37 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos y vive junto a su esposo quien L. apoya mucho en su negocio. Se dedica a L. compra y venta D. repuestos para maquinaria pesada, actividad que viene realizando desD. hace seis años, lo que le gusta D. este trabajo es que conoce mucho D. repuestos y mecánica, además D. conocer muchas personas, le es rentable, porque este negocio es bueno, debido a que muchas personas requieren los repuestos que elL. tiene y son únicos en su zona. Le va bien. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un local adecuado para exhibir sus repuestos D. mejor manera y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is 37 years old, mother of four children, and lives with her husband who supports her very much in her business. She buys and sells parts for heavy equipment, a job she has had for 6 years. What she liks about this work is knowing a lot about the parts and mechanics, in addition to meeting many people. It is profitable and this business is good, due to many people need the parts that she has and they are the only parts in the area. Her business is going well. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her payments. With the money she will build a locale in which she can better display her parts and proviD. a welcoming environment for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a locale for her business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity M. is currently in the business of making bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Charity is 30 years old and is married and has one child. Her husband is a clerk. Her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret O. is 44 years old, married, and has 6 children. Three of her children are in college, and one other is attending secondary school.

Margaret runs a small "hotel" in Rongo, Kenya (many of the small restaurants in the area are locally known as hotels). In her hotel, Margaret cooks local dishes to serve to the community. Her business has been open for under a year. Because this is a relatively new business, Margaret is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings ($150.00) to give the hotel a financial boost to start things off positively.

loans.use: Buy restaurant supplies

loans.name: Benoît

texts.fr: Né vers 1963 dans l’arrondissement de HOUEDOME de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur D. Benoît est marié et père de 8 enfants dont 5 scolarisés.
