texts.es: Cesar, joven de 19 años de edad, es el hijo mayor y vive en la casa de sus padres con sus hermanos menores. En el Pueblo de Cesar se dedican a labrar la tierra desde noviembre hasta mayo, con sumo cuidado en los sembríos, y el resto del año en pastar ganado, cada fin de semana va de compras a la ciudad y de paso visita a sus familiares. A él le agrada mucho las labores agrícolas, pero lo malo es que no puede confiarse mucho de la chacra porque son temporales, entonces tiene que esperar a la lluvia, para que la  semilla germine. Ha sembrado 2 hectáreas de papa y está preocupado por la falta de lluvia, por ello tiene anhelos de comprar terreno de regadío, para no tener que preocuparse más por la  lluvia o por el hielo, que provocan la perdida de sus sembríos. Es la primera vez que acude a MFP, por lo cual se compromete en pagar sus cuotas en las fechas fijadas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará 6 sacos de fertilizantes y abono para su chacra, además está muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young man of 19 years old. He is the oldest child and lives in his parents' house with his younger siblings. In his village, Cesar works the land from November until May, taking utmost care in planting, and the rest of the year he grazes livestock. Every weekend he goes to the city to go shopping and to visit his relatives. They are very grateful to him for his agricultural work, but the bad thing is that he cannot rely heavily on the crops because they are seasonal, so he has to wait for the rain for the seeds to germinate. He has planted 2 hectares of potatoes and is worried about the lack of rain. He therefore longs to purchase irrigated land, so that he no longer has to worry about the rain or ice, which can cause him to lose his crops. This is the first time that he has come to MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma, a Kiva field partner), and therefore he commits to making his payments on the set dates. With the money requested, he will buy 6 sacks of fertilizer for his small farm. Additionally, he is very grateful for the opportunity this brings him.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his small farm

loans.name: Rumana

texts.en:
Rumana G. is a married with two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with the husband and her kids in Accra. She works very hard, because part of the responsibility for her kids rests on her shoulders, as a mother who wants to see her kids to the university level. She is now 23 years old. 

Rumana sells home products, like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates. She makes her sales by ‘hawking’, which is door-to-door sales. Rumana is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to support her kids in school. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She would be very grateful for support. 

Rumana belongs to the Boldness Trust community group. The group members guarantee a loan through repayment pledges and support one another to repay the loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more plastic materials and kitchen sets

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Teodoro tiene 40 años de edad, vive con la madre de sus tres hijos desde hace 10 años. Sus padres le enseñaron al arte de cultivar la tierra, y siempre ha tratado de sembrar varias hectáreas para que la cosecha no falte en ninguna temporada, en esta oportunidad está sembrando papa con 15 sacos de semilla y después sembrará arvejas de tres sacos de semilla. Para Teodoro no hay descanso, terminan de cosechar una, y la otra chacra está para trabajar, y en la otra vuelve a sembrar y de ese modo siempre puedan estar en permanente cosecha y no les falte el dinero. Comenta que para la agricultura hay que tener mucha paciencia y suerte porque hay temporadas donde no se gana, y temporadas muy buenas. Pero igual tiene que seguir sembrando sea rentable o no. Es un cliente que vienen trabajando por cuarta vez con MFPrisma, siendo muy responsable en sus pagos.  Además está muy agradecido por facilitarles los préstamos que le permite seguir sembrando. Como va sembrar papa de 15 sacos, para ello le falta abono que cuesta 180 soles el saco, asimismo comprará las 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Teodoro, 40, has lived for 10 years with the mother of his three children. His parents taught him the art of cultivating the land, and he has always tried to sow his hectares so that he would have a crop in every season. At this time he is sowing potatoes with 15 sacks of seed, after which he will sow three sacks of peas. There is no rest for Teodoro, as soon as one crop has been harvested, another field needs work, then he goes back to sow the first, and in this way they can always be harvesting and they don't run out of money. He says that to do agriculture needs much patience and luck, because there are seasons where there is no profit, and other seasons are very good, but either way he has to keep sowing, profitable or not. He is a client who is now working for the fourth time with MFPrisma, being very responsible in his payments. Moreover, he is very grateful for the loans that have been facilitated, permitting him to keep planting. Since he is going to sow 15 sacks of potatoes, he needs fertilizer costing $60 per sack, and at the same time he will buy the 3 sacks of pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Tamaly I.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Tamaly A. from Kyela. She is a widow with two children, ages 5 and 11. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent orphan. Tamaly has been running a crops-selling business since 2006. She buys cocoa seeds and rice from farmers and sells them in the market at a higher price.

Tamaly works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Tamaly currently earns about 180 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more cocoa and rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to establish another business. Tamaly thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cocoa and rice in bulk

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es: Elizabet cuenta con 43 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales, vive con 4 de ellos. Su esposo se dedica a las labores agrícolas desde muy joven, y ella lo apoya, sobre todo en los tiempos de cosecha, los otros días de la semana vende golosinas en la puerta de su casa, tiene como clientes a los niños que salen de la escuela y consumen lo que ella vende. Durante los días de clase vende muy bien, pero cuando no hay clases aprovecha en ir a la chacra. Lo que desea es acondicionar su casa para tener una pequeña bodega, cree que le ira muy bien por ser rentable, y a la vez no tendrá necesidad de ir a otra tienda, y sobre todo trata de generarse otro ingreso a su economía, por el momento le hace un poco dificultoso por la falta de dinero. Es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP, y viene pagando de forma puntual sus cuotas, está muy agradecida con su  IMF por apoyarla reiteradas veces. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mercadería como arroz, azúcar y otros productos para iniciar su pequeña bodega.
texts.en:
Elizabet is 43 years old, is married, and has 5 children, 4 of whom she lives with. Her husband has worked in agriculture since he was very young and she helps him, especially during the planting seasons. On other days of the week, she sells candy from the door of her house. Her clients are the children that are leaving school and eat what she sells. On class days, her sales are good, but when there are not classes, she takes the opportunity to go to the farm. Her desire is to set up her house to have a small convenience store. She thinks that it would do very well in being profitable, and at the same time she would not have the need to go to another store. Above all, she tries to generate more income for her finances. At the moment things are a little difficult because of a lack of money. This is her ninth loan with MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA, a Kiva field partner) and she makes her payments punctually. She is very grateful to the MFI (microfinance institution) for helping her repeated times. With the requested money, she will purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, and other products to start up her small store.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to start up her store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
A sus 40 años de edad Francisca, aun convive con el padre de sus seis hijos, de los cuales cinco viven con ella. Las manos agrietadas de Francisca son muestras de una mujer que labra la tierra tan igual como su esposo, se levanta a la 4.00 am preparar el menú del día y luego alistar a sus hijos para la escuela, a eso de las 9.00am carga el almuerzo sobre sus hombros con destino a la chacra. A ella le agrada su labor, comenta que anteriormente gastaban más en los fertilizantes, pero ahora con la asesoría de un agrónomo están más orientados sobre qué remedios deba utilizar en sus sembríos. 
El año pasado han invertido 400 soles en remedios y ahora con la misma cantidad de siembra solo invirtió 280 soles, gracias a la orientación del agrónomo. Ella está muy feliz y ahora que va a sembrar nuevamente papa lo hará con los insecticidas que le recomienda el profesional. Es la cuarta vez que Francisca tiene un préstamo con MFP, y en los pagos no tuvo dificultades. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de remedios y abonos, ya que tiene la semilla lista y sin el abono no hay siembra.
texts.en:
At 40 years of age, Francisca still lives with the father of her six children, 5 of which live with her. Francisca's cracked hands are a sign of a woman who works the land as hard as her husband. She gets up at 4:00am to prepare the meal for the day and then get her children ready for school. At 9:00am she carries the lunch up on her shoulders, heading to the farm. She appreciates her work, and comments that she previously spent more on fertilizers, but now with the consultancy of an agronomist they are more focused on what alternative products she should use in her crops. Last year she invested 400 Soles in products and now, with the same quantity of seeds, she only invested 280 Soles thanks to the guidance of the agronomist. She is very happy and now that she is going to plant potatoes again, she will do it with the insecticides that the professional recommends. This is the fourth time Francisca has a loan with MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA, a Kiva field partner), and has not had difficulty with her payments. The money she is now requesting is to purchase the alternative products and fertilizers, since she already has the seeds ready and without the fertilizer she will not have a crop.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and medicine for her crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start selling clothing in her community.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
A united family with love as their foundation, Lilia D. G. and her family live in a barangay which is considered as the largest supplier of rice in Tumauni, Isabela because of its wiD. agricultural land.   Lilia is married to Arnulfo, a responsible husband who works as a farmer.  The couple has three children: Hobert – 28 years old, high school graduate; Ofelia – 26 years old, college graduate and Angelo – 24 years old high school graduate. Two of whom are already married.  

Lilia and her husband are engaged in farming.  But asiD. from their rice field, the couple is also planting vegetables in their farm and backyard for their food supply.  She hopes to borrow PHP 15,000 to help them in the maintenance of their business.  In this way, they do not have to borrow from traders with high interest.  

In order to generate more income and support the basic needs of their family, Lilia sometimes work as a farm laborer when she is not busy in their own farm. 
 
She dreams of having a better life in the future.  For her to reach her dreams, Lilia is patiently waiting for the right time and is diligent in helping her husband in the farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Merida B.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Merida N. from Kyela. She is married with three children between the ages of one and eight years old. She has been running a crops-selling business since 2006. She buys rice and cocoa from farmers and sell them in the market at higher price. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 7 days per week.

Merida currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more rice and cocoa in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Merida thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and cocoa in bulk

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven is 42 years old and married to Belinda.  They have two children:  Christopher – 21 years old, a college graduate but still unemployed and Carleslie – 18 years old, and currently in her college level.  They are living in a community where livelihood opportunities are available and with helpful and kind neighbors. 

For him to start cultivating their ricefield, Joven is requesting a loan of PHP11,000 that he will use to buy seedlings and fertilizers.  Part of the loan will be used as payment for farm laborer that they will hire to help them during the planting season and as rental fee for the hand tractor.  Part of their expenses is their snacks and food for the whole day's work. 

Meanwhile, his wife is in charge of their hog-raising business to generate additional income to further support the needs of their family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers and pay for additional farm labor and tractor rental fee

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in natural health products to keep operating a small business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. Oscar R Benavides Nº 989, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 50 años D. edad, es madre D. 8 hijos, 7 mayores D. edad, y uno que aún depenD. D. ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor D. Educación Secundaria. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. salchipapa. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en casa. Se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus actividades del hogar, luego va al mercado y atienD. su negocio.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará un saco D. arroz, un saco D. azúcar, una caja D. huevos, 2 cajas D. leche, 4 cajas D. galletas, sillao, etc.

Victoria se siente feliz porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su habilidad y al apoyo D. Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the communal bank "Loreto", located at Jr. Oscar R Benavides Nº 989, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, in the department of Ucayali. She is 50 years old and is the mother of 8 children, 7 of whom are older and one who still depends on her. She is married and her husband works as a high school teacher. With the first loan of 300 Soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling "salchipapa" (a Peruvian dish of pan-fried hot dogs mixed with french fries). She has worked with the communal bank for six years. Nowadays she has a small store in her house. She gets up very early to take care of her household tasks, and then she goes to the market and takes care of her business. With this loan of 3,000 Soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, a box of eggs, 2 boxes of milk, 4 boxes of cookies, soy sauce, etc. Victoria feels very happy because all that she has acheived is thanks to her ability and to the support of Manuela Ramos (a Kiva field partner).

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, a box of eggs, 2 boxes of milk, 4 boxes of cookies, soy sauce, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in various cleaning products for a small business.

loans.name: Bitris M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Bitris B. from Kyela. She is married with three children between the ages of one and 13. Bitris has been running a used clothing business since 2005. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages.

These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially among the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. Although there are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

Bitris works at her business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Bitris currently earns about 220 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to purchase more used clothes and cocoa in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business by adding more clothes for reselling. Bitris thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes and cocoa in bulk

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is a simple man but full of hopes. He always believes in the saying “if others can, why can’t he?” Loreto is married to Josephine, who is working as a recruiter of domestic helpers who want to work abroad. They are blessed with three healthy children: Love Joy, 9 years old; Jhondel, 7 years old and Jelo, 5 years old. Two of them are already in elementary level. They live in Barangay Rizal, one of the farthest barangays in Quirino province wherein farming is the major source of livelihood.

Loreto works as a farmer in their village. However, his income is not enough to meet all the needs of his family. So he and his wife decided to engage in another business that would generate additional income. He requests a loan of PHP15,000 which they can use to put up a sari-sari store (a community-based store) in their village. They plan to sell basic commodities needed in their community. He also plans to use some of the loan to register their jeep (four wheel vehicle) to use as a passenger jeep which can also be another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase basic commodities for sale in their retail store

loans.name: Tumpe M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Tumpe K. from Kyela. She is married with three children between the ages of six and nine. Tumpe has been running a vitenge (a traditional sarong-like garment for women) and crops business since 2004. She buys vitenge and crops on a wholesale basis and sells them in the market for a profit.

She works at the business 9 to 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Tumpe currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more vitenge and rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Tumpe thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more vitenge and rice in bulk

loans.name: Enely A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 19-years-old Enely M. from Kyela. She is married with one child, who is one year old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because the child's parents can not take care of him.

Enely has been running a general store business since 2006. She sells rice, cooking oil, soda, soap, matches, and so forth. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Enely currently earns about 50 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 775 USD in order to purchase additional stock of sugar, cooking oil, salt, soap and soda. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock. Enely thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of sugar, cooking oil, salt, soap and soda

loans.name: Maryglo

texts.en:
Maryglo M. is one of the farmers in their community.  She is 31 years old and a mother of three lovely daughters: Jewel May – 7 years old, an elementary student; Juliana Marie – 5 years old and Althea Nicole – 2 years old.  Her husband is also a farmer and sometimes works as a part-time laborer of B-MEG Company (a feeds manufacturer)  in the province to earn extra income.  

With her wish is to be free from traders who ask for high interest rate, Maryglo joined ASKI to help her financially with lower interest and with better programs and services.  She now asks for a loan of PHP13,000 to be used as additional working capital for their farm since it is their only source of income.  

She is hoping that through her business, they can have a stable life and save for the education of their children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a woman who treasures her family more than anything else.  She is happily married to Dominador, the man of her dreams, and they have five children: Sharmaine – 25 years old, Dominador – 24 years old, Danilo – 22 years old, Imee Marie – 21 years old and Jerwin – 15 years old.  All of them did not finish their studies since they could not afford to send them to school.  They live in Antagan 1st, wherein farming is the main source of livelihood of the people.  

Luzviminda works as a farmer.  Due to financial difficulties in buying the needed farm inputs, she would like to ask for financial assistance.  The amount of PHP12,000 will enable her to acquire the necessary inputs for her farm.  She does not want to borrow from traders because aside from asking for collaterals or security, interest is also higher which sometimes they could not afford since they are only work as farm tenants.  

She is hopeful that her request will be granted and she is already thankful that they were given this kind of opportunity and a chance to prove that they can make it.  “Someday, I hope to experience a better life than what we have right now”, added Luzviminda.  

She prays that God will bless them with good health for them to pursue their farming activity .

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: José Alfredo González ya había tenido crédito al ver nosotros que fue un buen cliente y pago puntualmente pensamos en ofrecerle otro. El recurrió a nosotros con la mayor confianza de que si se lo podíamos otorgar el comento que lo deseaba para tener mas amplia su casa. Anteriormente su crédito lo utilizo para hacer este cuarto que se ve en la imagen ahora el quiere hacer un cuarto en la parte de arriba. Para esto el necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra la cantidad que el solicita es la cantidad de $14,000 pesos. El señor José Alfredo se dedica a vender automóviles y su esposa es maestra de primaria con estos ingresos pagaran el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
José Alfredo González has already had a loan. Upon seeing that he was a good client and he paid punctually, we though to offer him another one. He came to us with the utmost faith that if we granted him a loan he would be able to achieve his goal of expanding his house. Previously he used his loan to construct this room, which you see in the picture. Now he wants to construct another room in the area above. For this he needs to buy materials and pay for the manpower. The amount that he requests is the amount of $14,000 pesos. José Alfredo sells automobiles and his wife is an elementary school teacher. With this income they will repay the loan given to them.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and labor for construction

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Having a happy family encourages Merlin to dream for a better life through patience and hard work. She is 31 years old, married to Salvador, 43 years old and a farmer. Their three children are Joel – 15 years old, junior high school student; Jenessa – 11 years old, grade six elementary student and John Loyd - 5 years old. They live in a village wherein farming is the main source of livelihood by most of the residents. 

Merlyn and her husband are engaged in farming.  The couple is helping each other in managing their corn field.  But due to lack of capital, they request a loan of PHP13,000 in order to sustain their farming business.  She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer needed for their corn field. 

She prays that the growth of their crops continues so that they will be able to have a good harvest. She also prays that calamities will not affect their crops so that they will able to pay for their loans and support all the needs of their family especially the education of their children. 

Merlyn said that smiling at your problems will ease burdens in life, thus, she chooses to keep smiling everyday despite their problems.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for their cornfield

loans.name: Oliver F.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 35 years old Oliver M. from Kyela. She is married with two children, ages of 15 and 17. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because their parents died of HIV. Oliver has been running a shoe business since 2005. 

She works at her business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Oliver  currently earns about $30 USD a month from her business. 

She is requesting a loan of $425 USD to purchase more shoes to sell. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of here stock. Oliver thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Pedro Daniel

texts.es: El joven Pedro Daniel Hernandez González vive en la casa de su abuelita y de su mamá pero el al ver que la casa necesita arreglos y composturas se hace responsable de  mantener en comodidad a su familia. Este nuevo préstamo lo quiere para poner vitropiso en una de las recamaras en anterior crédito lo utilizo para poner en parte de la sala pero aun le falto en esta habitación que sale en la fotografía. El trabaja en maquiladora al igual que su mama y su hermano.
texts.en:
The young Pedro Daniel Hernandez González lives in the house of his grandmother and his mother, but upon seeing that the house needed repairs and maintenance he became responsible for maintaining the comfort of his family. He wants this new loan to install ceramic tile in one of the bedrooms. He used the previous loan to put it in part of the living room, but he is still missing this room, which is shown in the photograph. He works in a maquiladora (factory), the same as his mother and his brother.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ceramic tile materials

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson has been in the farming business for 31 years.  It is through farming that he was able to provide the needs of his family and send his children to school even though they were not able to earn a college degree.  His wife Lilia is managing a sari-sari store (a community based store).  They have three children:  Janet – 29 years old, college undergraduate and currently working abroad as domestic helper; Jonel – 27 years old, a vocational course graduate and served as an army and Jonar – 22 years old, also a vocational course graduate and working as a security guard. They live in the hilly and peaceful place of San Vicente in Quirino, Isabela.  

He would like to request a loan of PHP10,000 which he can use to buy necessary farm inputs like fertilizers since they are very expensive.  This amount is not enough to sustain the needs of his 1.5 hectare of rice field, 2 hectares of corn field and.5 hectare of tobacco.  He is very optimistic that this amount will somehow improve his yield and he hopes to have a continuous partnership with the lenders.  

Nelson always makes sure that he respects the people around him since he believes that respect begets respect.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Nolvia Cecilia

texts.es: La Sr. Nolvia tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio Waspan Norte en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 17 años de edad ambos los tiene estudiando, casada, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privado y doña Nolvia trabaja como supervisora. Los planes que tiene para su familia es dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio para su futuro. El préstamo que se solicita es para terminar la construcción de su casa brindándole seguridad y protección. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic realizara sus planes y lograra mejorar su nivel de vida social.
texts.en:
Nolvia is 37 years old and lives in the Waspan Norte neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has two children of 2 and 17 years old, both of whom she has studying. She is married and her husband works in a private business and Nolvia works as a supervisor. The plans that she has for her family is to leave her children with an inheritance for their future. The loan that she requests is to finish the construction of her house, bringing security and protection to her family. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC (a Kiva field partner), she will accomplish these plans and will be able to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish her house

loans.name: Tabia F.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Tabia M. from Kyela. She is married with two children, ages of 1 and 3. Tabia has been running a general store since 2006. She buys commodities wholesale and sell them retail to people around the area. 

She works at her business for 13-16 hours per day, 6 days per week. She is requesting a loan of $325 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of sugar, soda, soap, and cooking oil. In the future, she plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock. Tabia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of sugar, soda, soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
“If you persevere, you will reap the fruit of your success”, said Nestor E..  A man who never loses hopes that someday he will become successful in life through proper management of his farming business.  

He is married and a father of five children: Beverly – 17 years old, 1st year college; Haris – 15 years old, 3rd year high school; Harold – 14 years old, 2nd year high school; Neslie – 12 years old, Grade VI and Harvie – 6 years old, already in pre-school.  They live in Barangay Antagan 1st in Tumauini, Isabela.  The place is abundant with agricultural land which has its own water supply for the field.  The place is along the mountainside of Sierra Madre. 

Nestor chose farming as their main source of livelihood even when being in this business is quite difficult due to the increasing price of farm inputs.  Because of this, Nestor asks for a financial assistance of PHP 13,000.00 to support his needs in cultivating their rice field.  He is glad that he has his own carabao and cow which are a big help to him in cultivating and harrowing his farmland.  

He believes that all his sacrifices are worthy.  He is happy that through his business they were able to send their children to school and he hopes that they will all finish their studies and be successful in the future.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Kiko

texts.es: Kiko, joven trabajador de 24 años de edad, vive  en la casa de su madre en compañía de su hermano menor. Los padres de Kiko fueron agricultores, sembraban papa en grandes cantidades, pero hubo un mal tiempo donde ellos se quedaron sin capital, desde entonces, hace 5 años Kiko trabaja en las chacras de sus vecinos, le pagaban diario 15 soles, incluido almuerzo.  Y hace como 2 años que empezó a sembrar su propia chacra, donde tiene cultivado dos hectáreas de papa, y otro poco de arvejas, cuando cosecha los lleva al mercados y eso le causa mucha satisfacción. Tiene anhelos de progresar sembrando en grandes cantidades, debido al buen precio que se está cotizando actualmente en el mercado;  pero a la vez le es imposible por la falta dinero, ya que los fertilizantes son muy costosos. Esta es la séptima vez que viene trabajando Kiko con un préstamo de MFP, pagando sus cuotas en las fechas fijadas, sin mora alguna. El dinero que le facilitarán, es para la compra del fertilizante llamado “Alimuful” que sirve para el desarrollo de la papa.
texts.en:
Kiko, a young worker of 24 years old, lives in the house of his mother and in the company of his younger brother. Kiko's parents were farmers. They grew potatoes in large quantities, but had a bad season where they were left without money. After that, starting five years ago Kiko worked in the farms of his neighbors. They paid him 15 Soles daily, including lunch. And about 2 years ago he began to farm his own plot of land, where he is cultivating two hectares of potatoes and another little bit of peas. When he harvests, he takes them to the markets and this gives him much satisfaction. He longs to continue growing large quantities, owing to the good prices that he is receiving nowadays in the market; but at the same time it is impossible because of a lack of money, since the fertilizers are very costly. This is the seventh time that Kiko comes working with a loan from MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA, a Kiva field partner), making his payments on the set dates without a single late payment. The money that they will give him is to buy the fertilizer called "Alimuful", which helps in the growth of the potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 26 years old, single and still lives with his parents.  He became a farmer when his parents became too old to cultivate their farm. They live in a peaceful community where there are lot of food sources available such as vegetables, root crops, and other exotic foods. 

He has been in this business since 2002.  He realized that this business requires a big capital for him to maintain good harvest.  Because of this Oliver requests at least PHP 8,000 loan to serve as his additional working capital in their farm.  He will use this in purchasing farm inputs. 

Oliver hopes that he can have a good harvest so that income will also be good and there will be enough resources for his parents and for his future family.  He is very patient in waiting for his dream to come true.  

His parents are still helping him in order to maximize their expenses in terms of labor works.  He is thankful for the support they are giving him and he also prays for their good health.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Maurilio

texts.es: Maurilio tiene 47 años de edad, es casado,  tiene cinco hijos, actualmente solo viven con tres de ellos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, y los días de feria lleva al mercado su producto, para Maurelio la cosecha es donde disfruta mayormente y le dedican mucho tiempo para clasificar la papa que comercializará, porque dependerá del tamaño de la papa, su precio. Clasificar la papa le es mucho más rentable, aunque esté un poco lastimada la papa se vende, pero con otro precio, “aquí nada se pierde”, comenta sonriente. Dedicarse a la agricultura le llena de satisfacción a él y a su familia, aún más cuando los vende a un buen precio en el mercado, eso lo motiva a seguir sembrando. Es el noveno préstamo que tiene Maurelio con MFP, paga en las fechas indicadas sus cuotas. Y está muy agradecido con todos los que le apoyan, porque le permiten dar bienestar a su familia. Con el dinero solicitado comprará abonos para su chacra de papa.
texts.en:
Maurilio is 47 years old, is married, and has five children; he is currently living with only three of them. All of his life he has devoted to agricultural work, and on market days he brings his products to the market. For Maurilio the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting the potatoes that he will sell, because the price will depend on the size of the potato. Sorted, the potato is more profitable, although the potatoes he sells are not in great shape, but at another price, "there is nothing to lose," he says smiling. Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family, even more when they sell for a good price at the market; that is the motivation to continue planting. This is the ninth loan that Maurilio has with MFP, making his payments on time. And he is very grateful to those who support him, because they allow him to provide well-being to his family. With the money requested, he will buy fertilizer for his small potato farm.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his small potato farm

loans.name: Tumaini I.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Tumaini E. from Kyela. She is single with two children, ages of 11 and 13. She is also responsible for supporting one dependant, because her parents cannot take care of her. 

Tumaini has been running a fish and milk business since 2006. She buys fish from fisherman at the lake and sells them in town. She also buys milk wholesale and sells it retail. She works at her business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Tumaini currently earns about $454 USD a month from her business. 

She is requesting a loan of $750 USD to buy a deep freezer for storing the fish and milk. In the future, she plans to open the same business at another location. Tumain thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer for storing fish and milk

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios and her husband work together as farmers. Their marriage has been blessed with six children, two sons and four daughters. Their children are: Martha, 34 years old, a high school graduate; Berth, 28 years old, a high school graduate; Maricel, 24 years old, a high school graduate; Mary Rose, 18 years old, also a high school graduate; Romy, a third year high school student; and Shena Mae, 11 years old and a 1st year high school student. Four of their children are already married. They have three grandchildren. Their family happily lives in Barangay Rizal Quirino, Isabela. Here, people are united in their work for their community and for their families.

Aside from farming, Remedios and her husband also raise two hogs and vend cogon (a native grass). The couple is doing everything they can to earn a living.

In order to avoid asking for credit from traders, Remedios would like to take this opportunity to request a loan of PHP 13,000. This will provide for their farm and help to maintain their hog raising business.

Remedios said that they must work hard in order to improve their lives.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 26 años de edad, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos, en casa de su madre. La niñez de Mery fue muy precaria, para ella su juguete era la sartén sujeta a un mango, le era útil para cavar la tierra, pasaron los años y su labor agrícola no ha cambiado, pero con gran alegría espera  las temporadas de cosecha de papa que han cultivado con su esposo. Negociar sus productos en el mercado le produce gran satisfacción, su esposo y ella están convencidos que es su única fuente de trabajo y le es rentable por el momento, les permite devolver la inversión  realizada y cubrir sus gastos, no tiene dificultades en su chacra, pero sí con su hijo menor que se enferman constantemente, y eso les ocasionan gastos en su recuperación. Es la novena vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y no tiene dificultades en sus pagos, y está agradecida con todos aquellos que le apoyan para que pueda sembrar. El dinero solicitado será destinado para la compra de abono, considera que quizás le falte una cantidad por el alto costo de los fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Mery is 26 years old, and lives in the company of her husband and two children in her mother's house. Mery's childhood was very unstable; her toy was a frying pan with a handle, which was useful for her to dig the land. The years passed and her agricultural work had not changed, but with great happiness she waits for the time to harvest the potatoes that she has cultivated with her husband. Selling her products in the market produces great satisfaction, she and her husband are convinced that it's her only source of work and it's profitable for the moment. It allows them to repay their investment and cover their expenses. She doesn't have difficulties in her farm, but her oldest son is constantly falling ill, this causes expenses for his recovery. This is the ninth time that she has a loan with MFP, and she has no difficulties making her payments, and she is grateful to all of those who support her so she can plant. The money requested will be for buying fertilizer; she believes she will be lacking some due to the high cost of fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her land

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es: Ubaldina tiene 38 años, no tuvo suerte en el matrimonio, vive con su hijo de 12 años y su madre de 80 años de edad. Se dedica a las labores agrícolas, desde que era niña, su padre le enseñó a trabajar en la chacra, se levanta a las 5.00 a.m. para preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo para su madre y su hijo que estudia, luego tiene que caminar como 4 kilómetros para llegar a su chacra. A ella le causa complacencia que sus cultivos reaccionen bien después de que haya abonado la papa, depende de ello que obtenga buenos productos al cosechar. Para Ubaldina siempre la agricultura le fue rentable, ya que es su única fuente de ingreso, y los costos del mercado varían, pero igual le dejan ganancias, siente dificultad al no tener dinero suficiente para que pueda sembrar en mayor cantidad. Es la cuarta vez que Ubaldina tiene un préstamo con MFP, sin dificultades de pago. Y agradece a todos los que le apoyan con su actividad. Con esta cantidad que solicita va a comprar sacos de abono que están a 170 soles cada uno, también comprará calcio para la papa e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Ubaldina is 38 years old - she did not have luck in her marriage - she lives with her 12 year old son and her 80 year old mother. She has been devoted to agricultural work since she was a girl; her father taught her to work on the farm. She gets up at 5:00am to prepare breakfast and lunch for her mother and her son who is studying; then she walks about four kilometers to the farm. It causes her satisfaction that her crops are doing well after the potatoes have been fertilized; she depends on the fertilizer to have good products to harvest. For Ubaldina agriculture has always been profitable; it is her only source of income, and the costs at the market vary, but they provide income just the same. She finds it difficult in that she does not have sufficient money to be able to plant larger quantities. This is the fourth time Ubaldina has a loan with MFP, without difficulty making payments. And she's grateful to those who support her with her activity. With the amount she is soliciting she is going to buy sacks of fertilizer that cost 170 soles ($56) each, also she will buy calcium for the potatoes and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly B. lives in San Isidro Quirino, Isabela with his wife Barbara and their four year old son Rolando. His wife stays at home and takes good care of their son. Rolly spends his days working on their farm. Most of the residents in San Isidro Quirino are farmers; the major crops are rice, tobacco and corn.

Rolly manages a three hectare corn field and a half hectare rice field. Due to the prevailing crisis in agriculture, he lacks the financial capital to continue cultivating his farm. Since the farm is their only source of living, Rolly is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to increase his working capital. He hopes that his income will increase so that he can save for the education of his son.

Rolly dreams for a better life someday. He is very confident and believes that he can fulfill his dream.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel is happily married to his wife, Marichou. Their marriage has been blessed with three lovely children: Welmar, who is 10 years old and in grade 4; Romanae, who is seven years old, and in grade 2; and Meljo, who is five years old and in pre-school.

Romel has decided that he wants to live the rest of this life in Barangay San Isidro Quirino, Isabela. He not only loves the peaceful environment, but it also houses their major source of income - farming.

He has been involved in farm activities since childhood; he is used to the heat of the sun. Romel has worked as a farmer for the past 20 years. However, life has been difficult and progress slow. Because he lacks financial resources, Romel would like to borrow at least PHP 15,000 so that he can buy liters of crude oil for his hand tractor. He uses the tractor to cultivate his farm. He will use the remaining money to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds so he can start planting rice and corn.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina lives in a community where the people work together to better their livelihoods and develop their village.

She is 56 years old and already a widow. She is responsible for raising her five children by herself. Her eldest is Bernard, 33 years old, married and has finished a vocational course. Next is Marrieta, who is 28 years old, married, and a college undergraduate working abroad to support her own family. Basilio, is 25 years old, also a vocational course graduate and now serving in the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP). Saturnino is 21 years old, and a high school graduate. The youngest is Dominic, 15 years old and an elementary school graduate.

She supported her five children through her farm. Saturnina is thankful to God that she was able to raise her children to grow up with good attitudes, even though she didn't have enough money to provide them with a high level of education.

Currently, Saturnina hopes to create better opportunities in her farming and hog raising business. She is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 20,000.00 so she can buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds. She will also use the loan to purchase feed supplies for her hogs.

She is glad that they have their own hand tractor because it makes farm cultivation easy. The family also owns a tricycle, which serves as another source of income.

Saturnina believes that praying to God is the best way to become successful in life.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a woman who is contented with her simple life in her community. She lives with her three children: Riden, who is 18 years old; Imee, who is 17 years old; and Joseph, who is 16 years old. Her children only finished their education through high school because she could not afford to send them to college. Soledad's husband is Elger. He is a farmer in their village. They enjoy living in Antagan because it is peaceful and rich in agricultural land with a good water supply. A sufficient supply of water is essential for their farming business.

The family farms rice and corn. Their rice field is located in the lowland while their corn field is in the upland.

Because of the ever-changing price of farm inputs, they sometimes cannot afford them. Soledad has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to help maintain the farm. The loan will enable her to purchase their needed inputs. Some of the loan will also be used to compensate the laborers who help them during the planting season.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Valentino

texts.en:
Valentino G. is a widower. His wife died earlier this year; she was killed by a gun shot in the head. His wife was formerly an active adviser in SAFARI (the name of their group in the Microfinance Institution where they borrow money). She was also an active leader in their community in Rizal Quirino, Isabela. He has been left taking care of their two children, Jhon Mark (13 years old) and Donabel (11 years old). Both of them already study at the high school level. Their house is located among their rice fields. Their neighbors live far from their house.

Valentino makes a living farming. He is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000.00, which he will use for farm maintenance. He hopes that he can improve his livelihood so he can provide a better life for his children and afford to send them to school.

He also plans to improve their house and make it safer to protect his children from what happened to his wife.

Valentino is thankful for this opportunity because through the Microfinance Institute he can acquire a loan so he does not have to borrow from traders. The traders charge higher interest rates.

According to Valentino, one should be patient in achieving one's goals in life and God will do the rest.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano P. resides in Barangay Rizal in Quirino, Isabela. He is married to Adelaida and they are blessed with seven children. Most of the children are high school graduates. Some of the children were able to reach college, but never graduated because they didn't haven enough money to complete their studies.

Victoriano makes a living planting vegetables and rice. In addition to farming vegetables and rice, he also maintains mango plants, which are around their house. This provides extra income for their family, especially during summer.

Since Victoriano lacks financial resources, he is hoping to borrow PHP 18,000.00 so he can purchase additional farm inputs to cultivate his farm and plant rice. Some of his loan will be used to pay for laborers who will help him plant the crops. The loan will also help to pay for food and snacks to sustain him and his laborers during their work.

Victoriano wants to sustain his farming business and hopefully grow it so he eventually has a hectare of farmland to provide for the future of his family.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor Manuel es una persona honesta, y trabajadora ya que lo ha de mostrado no solo dentro del trabajo sino dentro de la sociedad, el esta solicitando el crédito para terminar el proyecto de la división de su casa y la colocación del vitropiso, para asi darle a su vivienda mayor amplitud y comodidad.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is an honest person, and a hard worker who has shown that not only within his work, but within society. He is requesting credit to finish a project partitioning his house and laying down flooring, in order to give his house more space and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete partitioning and laying floor in his house

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor has a happy family, which inspires him to work hard. He has a farm where he cultivates rice and corn. He is married to Merlita, a housewife. They have been gifted with five children. Three of their children are already married. They all graduated from college. Two of the children work abroad as domestic helpers. One of the children is a high school graduate. The youngest is a first year high school student.

Victor is 50 years old. He supports his family through his farm. He manages a half hectacre rice field and a 2.5 hectacre corn field. Aside from managing his own farm, he sometimes works as a laborer for extra income on other farms.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 10 000.00 for additional working capital. This will help to sustain his business and grow the business, so it can become more profitable.

Victor wants to send his youngest child to school and help her finish a college degree so she will not experience the hardship of farming. He is getting older and weaker so he is hoping that he can provide all her educational needs.

Victor has promised himself that he will do everything he can for the sake of his children.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es:
La familia de la señora Imelda Rodríguez  son sus 2 hijos, ellos aún están pequeños; los ha ido sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a su entereza.
Formó su propio negocio el cual lo tiene en su casa, un cuarto fue adaptado para dar el servicio de salón de belleza.
Quiere ampliar la vivienda y construir una recamara, para que cada uno de sus hijos tenga su espacio propio, ella les estará muy agradecida por el gesto de generosidad hacia su familia.
texts.en:
The family of Imelda Rodriquez are her two children, they are still young; she has progressed forward with a lot of strength and determination. She formed her own business which she has in her house, a room that was adapted to service her beauty salon. She wants to expand her house and construct a bedroom, so that one of her children will have their own room; she will be very grateful for the gesture of generosity toward her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a room

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
The word honor best describes Mrs. Wilma R.. She is married to Arturo and together they care for their family farm. They have two children, Aldrich, which is 23 years old and Bernadeth, who is 21 years old. Aldrich has graduated from elementary school and Bernadeth graduated from college, but she is still unemployed due to the stiff employment competition in their area. They live in a community in Rizal Quirino, Isabela. Agriculture is the main source of income for the people there.

Wilma and her husband farm different crops, including rice, corn and vegetables. In a week, they are able to earn at least PHP 1,500.00 from selling vegetables, which they harvest on their own. It takes them three to five months to harvest and then be able to sell the rice and corn crops.

To maintain their farming business and to avoid high-interest debts with other lenders, Wilma has asked for an additional loan of PHP 18,000 so she can finance their farming needs. Wilma is also planning to use some of the loan to expand their hog raising business. She she will manage the hogs while her husband is working on the farm.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora María del Carmen es originaria de Michoacán y vino a Piedras Negras buscando una estabilidad económica  por ello ya tiene establecida aquí diez años, ahora ella tiene su propio negocio de abarrotes, cerca de su negocio no existen otras tienditas, esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión de mas mercancía y asi incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is from Michoacán and came to Piedras Negras to seek economic stability. She has been settled here for ten years and now has her own grocery business. There aren't any other shops near her business. She is requesting this loan to invest in more merchandise and to increase her sales.


Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in merchandise for the business

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson P. is 22 years old, single and living in Rizal Quirino, Isabela. Even at his young age, he is already responsible and has big dreams, which serve as his guiding principle in life. He does not want to depend on his parents for money.

Wilson, together with his family, would like to have the better life that they dream of someday. This is why he is preparing for the future now.

To earn money, Wilson runs a farm. For five years, he has been cultivating the farm entrusted to him by his parents. To further improve his crops and to have a better yield, Wilson is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000.00, which will provide additional capital for his farming business. Part of the loan will be used to start his electronic load business, commonly called "e-load," which will provide extra income while waiting for the harvest season.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Martin Librado

texts.es: El señor Martín es padre de familia y persona muy responsable y trabajadora, el tiene su propio negocio de ventanas y puertas de aluminio, el y su familia están solicitando este crédito para terminar la construcción de una barda junto con los acabados exteriores de la vivienda para darle un mejor.
texts.en:
Martín is a family man and a very responsible and hard-working person. He has his own business selling aluminum windows and doors. He and his family are seeking this loan so they can complete construction of a wall and exterior details to improve their house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wall and exterior improvements

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.es: La señora Rosa Isela es ama de casa, esposa, trabajadora y muy pronto madre de un nuevo bebe, ella al igual que su esposo están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones en puertas y ventanas para mayor seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Isela is a hard-working homemaker and wife and will very soon be the mother of a new baby! She and her husband are requesting this loan to install security devices on their windows and doors in order to have a safer home for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hardware (security devices for windows and doors)

loans.name: Jose Ervey

texts.es: El señor José Ervey es una persona pensionada, pero cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa e hija, están solicitando el crédito para la construcción de una barda y colocación de un portón para protección y seguridad de ellos mismos.
texts.en:
José Ervey is a pensioner and has the support of his wife and daughter. They are requesting a loan to build a fence and install a gate for their own safety and security.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a fence and installation of a gate

loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.en:
The Santa Barbara Village Bank consists of 20 members, most of whom are women. The group is part of FINCA Peru’s Wari Project, an effort to proviD. microloans to people who live far from FINCA’s Ayacucho office by sending loan officers out to the villages in which the clients themselves live. Fourteen group members live in the village of Santa Barbara, while six live in the neighboring villages of Huaynacondo and Ñeque.

The group members are involved in a variety of businesses, but the most common economic activity is raising guinea pigs, or “cuyes,” a Peruvian delicacy. Some clients have just a few dozen guinea pigs, while others have many more. Gloria Susana, for example, has almost 500 guinea pigs, breeding, raising, and selling them to stores, restaurants and individuals to prepare.

Guinea pigs are very delicate, temperature-sensitive animals, so caring for them is quite labor-intensive. Many clients go out themselves at 4 or 5 p.m. each day to cut fresh alfalfa to feed them. Some other group members raise different animals, large and small, such as chickens, cows, and sheep, which they then fatten up and sell at livestock fairs.

Other group members sell dry goods and grains; many travel between Santa Barbara and the city of Ayacucho (which is about an hour away by car) to buy, sell or traD. their wares.

Most of the members plan to use their loans to buy more merchandise to sell, more young animals to raise, or more materials to make their products. Ambrosio, for example, buys seasonal local produce which he loads into a rented truck and brings to the city of Lima to sell. Right now, it is prickly pear season, so he will use his share of the loan to buy boxes of prickly pears. Leonardo is a basket-weaver, so he will use his loan to buy more reeds to make his baskets. Leonarda has a small store and also raises guinea pigs; she will use her loan portion to buy rice, sugar and soda to sell.

The group is pictured along with their loan officer, Hector (far right) and the Wari Project supervisor, Derek Visser (center).

loans.use: To buy young animals, prickly pears, reeds for basket-weaving, merchandise for stores, etc.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Jesús R. prácticamente tiene una familia grande, está formada por su esposa y sus tres hijos, actualmente su casa solo cuenta con dos habitaciones por lo que él y su esposa ocupan una y sus tres hijos la otra.
Necesitan urgentemente construir una tercera habitación pues su hija ya necesita más privacidad.
Sus servicios laborales los presta a una empresa como contador, con el ingreso que tiene le es imposible construir el cuarto pues son costos que solo mediante un préstamo se pueden lograr.
texts.en:
Jesús R. has a large family. He lives with his wife and his three children. His house currently has only two bedrooms. He and his wife share one and his three children share the other. They urgently need to build a third bedroom, as his daughter needs more privacy. He works as an accountant. His income is not enough for him to afford construction costs, so only with the help of this loan will he be able to achieve his goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of an addition to the ground floor

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: El señor Feliciano es propietario de una panadería la cual cuenta con una antigüedad de cinco años establecida, el esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de su pan y seguir incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Feliciano has five years experience of running his own bakery. He is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients to make his bread and continue growing his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to bake his bread

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El señor Julio es una persona que se dedica a trabajar de cocinero en un conocido restaurant de la ciudad y ademas realiza platillos para su venta como ayuda extra, el esta requiriendo este credito para terminar el proyecto del enjarre de las paredes de su casa, ya que quiere recibir a su familia que vienen a visitarlo, un hogar mas acogedor y se sientan comodos en esta navidad.
texts.en:
Julio makes a living working as a cook in a well-known restaurant in his city and also makes his own meals to sell for extra income. He is requesting this loan to finish replastering the walls of his home since he wants to welcome visiting family members in a more friendly home and for them to feel comfortable this Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replaster the walls of his home

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Azucenas (“White Lilies”) Village Bank. Sixty-two years old and married with ten children, Esther is a traveling salesperson buying fruits, vegetables and spices in Ayacucho and bringing them to rural markets to sell. She works alone since most of her children are adults and have their own jobs, while her three youngest children are still in school.

Esther is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fruit to sell, including apples, pineapples, mangoes and bananas. Her goals are to continue to support her children’s educational pursuits and to build a home of her own.

loans.use: To buy apples, pineapples, mangoes and bananas.

loans.name: Jisunu Group

texts.es: LAS  SOCIAS QUIENES CONFORMAN EL GRUPO "JISUNU" SON PERSONAS QUE SE CONOCEN YA QUE RESIDEN EN EL MISMO BARRIO, ELLAS SE ENCUENTRAN REPRESENTADAS POR LA SEÑORA  ORFA. TODOS LOS SOCIOS (AS) SE GARANTIZAN Y SE COMPROMETEN EN PAGAR  CON PUNTUALIDAD YA QUE SON GENTE RESPONSABLE Y COMPROMETIDA CON SU GRUPO. EN SU MAYORÍA LOS SOCIOS (AS) SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO Y VENTA D. DIFERENTES PRODUCTOS COMO SER VENTA D. ROPA, PRODUCTOS COSMÉTICO, VENTA D. COMIDA, VENTA D. ABARROTES EN TIENDAS D. BARRIO, VENTA D. REFRESCOS, VENTA D. ARTESANÍAS. COMO EN TODO RUBRO COMERCIAL EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA EN LAS DIVERSAS ACTIVIDADES QUE DESEMPEÑAN PERO EL OBJETIVO ES COMÚN EL SACAR ADELANTE A SU FAMILIA A TRAVÉS D. SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO FINANCIADO POR LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL SERÁ PARA AUMENTAR LA CALIDAD D. SUS PRODUCTOS ASÍ COMO LOS INSUMOS Y HERRAMIENTAS PARA EL LA ELABORACIÓN D. ALGUNOS PRODUCTOS A LA VENTA. EN GENERAL LOS SOCIOS (AS) TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE SABEN ADMINISTRAR BIEN EL CAPITAL OTORGADO ASÍ COMO LA RESPONSABILIDAD QUE SE REQUIERE PARA UN FINANCIAMIENTO Y EL CUMPLIMIENTO A LOS PLANES D. PAGOS.
texts.en:
The members who form the group "Jisunu" are people they know who resiD. in the same neighborhood. The women are represented by Orfa Peña A.. All the members are grateful for your support and promise to make their payments punctualy because they are responsible people. The majority of the members make a living selling different products such as clothing, cosmetics, food, grocery items, beverages and crafts. As in any commercial traD., competition exists in the members' various activities, but the goal is the same: make headway for their family through the work at their sales posts. The loan the group is requesting will be used to increase the quality of of their products, such as the ingredients and tools needed to make some of the products they sell. In general, the members have experience in these types of groups because they know how to administer the loan well and have the responsibility required to fulfill the payment terms.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide capital for the members' various business activities

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank, is 45 years old and married with three children, two in college and one still in high school. Gladys sells basic grocery items and spices in the Nazarena Market in the city of Ayacucho, working at her stand from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. each day, assisted by her children when they are not in school.

Gladys is requesting a loan to buy more eggs, milk, and sacks of sugar. She says that she has more clients when she offers more varied merchandise. Her goal is to continue to improve her business and buy a wider variety of products to sell.

loans.use: To buy more eggs, milk and sacks of sugar to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Callutaca  de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Su esposo trabaja como maestro albañil en la universidad de la Localidad.
Vive junto a su esposa, y sus dos hijos de 22 y 16 años respectivamente. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos..
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Juana makes a living raising cattle, whose milk is commercialized at the Andina Milk Industrialization Plant. She lives in Callutaca in the Andes, about two hours away from the Bolivian capital city of La Paz. Her husband teaches construction at the local university. They live together with their two children, ages 22 and 16. The loan will be used to purchase a good stock of cattle to increase their production of milk and thus their income. This is her first loan with Kiva partner Impro, and her evaluation qualified her as a recipient.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Bonanza Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "BONANZA" TIENE COMO PRESIDENTA A LA SEÑORA PATRICIA ELLA ES SOLTERA Y TIENE CUATRO HIJOS MENORES DE 12 AÑOS, ELLA ES UN APERSONA ÁGIL Y MUY CAPAZ AL IGUAL QUE TODOS SUS COMPAÑEROS (AS) DE GRUPO YA QUE TODOS SON RESPONSABLES Y CUMPLIDAS. EN SU MAYORÍA SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO DE ROPA, FRUTAS, COMIDA, COSMÉTICOS OTROS SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES COMO A LA ELABORACIÓN DE PAN, REPARACIÓN DE COMPUTADORAS Y AL SERVICIO DOMESTICO. ELLOS (AS) TIENEN MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE ESA MANERA ADMINISTRAN BIEN SUS FONDOS PARA PODER CUMPLIR CON LOS COMPROMISOS, ES LA PRIMERA DE VEZ QUE TRABAJAN CON LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL PERO TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE SABEN DE LA RESPONSABILIDAD QUE CUALQUIER FINANCIAMIENTO REQUIERE. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO DE PRODUCTOS E INSUMOS PARA LA VENTA ASÍ COMO PARA LA MEJORA DE LA CALIDAD DE SUS PRODUCTOS ELABORADOS.
texts.en:
The president of the loan group "Bonanza" is Patricia C. E.. She is single and has four children under the age of 12. She is a lively and very capable person, much like all her group members, all of whom are responsible. The majority of the members make a living selling items such as clothing, fruits, food, cosmetics, while others dedicate themselves to baking bread, repairing computers and as domestic servants. The members have a lot of experience selling their products and in this group form they administer the funds well so they can fulfill their promises. This is the first time they have worked with Kiva partner Fundación Agrocapital, but they have previous experience with loan groups so they know the responsibility required. The loan will be used to purchase more supplies and/or ingredients so they can improve the quality of the products they sell or make.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for the members' various business activities

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia, a member of the Manantial (“Spring”) Village Bank, is 61 years old and married, with nine children and 15 grandchildren. All of her children work and are independent, except for her youngest who is 22 years old and currently studying.

Pelagia has had a stand at the Nery Garcia Market where she sells vegetables for many years. She is now requesting a loan to buy more tomatoes, carrots, squash and onions. Pelagia’s goals for the future are to strengthen her business and improve everything in her life so that her children and grandchildren will have a better future.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, carrots, squash and onions

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: Ermelinda tiene 28 años, actualmente vive en la casa de su actual compromiso, junto a con sus 2 hijos menores de edad. Se dedica al bordado de mandiles para señoras, actividad que viene practicando por  más de 10 años, gracias a que desde muy joven le encantó trabajar elaborando diversos tipos de vestimenta para los vecinos de su pueblo, ya que para ello se requiere mucha creatividad y arte, sobre todo en las lentejuelas que se ponen en los alrededores de las faldas, ya que es el brillo lo que llama la atención de las señoras  y por lo tanto son los más solicitados por sus clientas, quienes acuden constantemente a doña Ermelinda  para realizar sus pedidos. Ella es puntual en sus pagos, este es su 3er préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado desea incrementar los materiales que usa para los acabados de los mandiles, los cuales tiene que entregar con prontitud.
texts.en:
Ermelinda is 28 years old, and currently lives with her fiancé and her two small children. She works making embroidered aprons for women, an activity that she has been engaged in for more than 10 years. Ever since Ermelinda was very young she has enjoyed making different types of clothing for the residents of her town, work that requires much creativity and skill. She especially likes sewing the sequins along the edges of skirts, since the sparkle is what grabs the attention of the women. Such sequined items are very popular with her customers, who constantly come to Ermelinda to place their orders. Ermelinda is punctual in making her payments. This is her 3rd loan with Kiva partner MFP. With the money she has requested she wants to increase the materials she uses to finish the aprons, which she has to deliver soon.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials for making embroidery

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza tiene 28 años, vive con sus 4 hijos y su madre. Trabaja elaborando diversas mantas textiles que realiza desde 7 años, junto a su madre, quien la ayuda en la confección y a venderlos en los centros mineros de  la región. A Lorenza le agrada elaborar diversos tipos de mantas de colores, porque  ahí puede usar su creatividad, darle color y sentido a su trabajo, además estas  mantas son muy solicitadas en la sierra del Perú, ya que gracias a que son abrigadoras, la gente las compra para cubrirse en sus noches de frío. Aunque el confeccionarlos es muy tedioso, por el proceso de hilar el tipo de lana que le mandan los ganaderos. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tuvo problemas de pago. Con le dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de lana de carneros para luego hilarla y fabricar mayor cantidad de mantas.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 28 and lives with her four children and her mother. For seven years she has made a variety of blankets. Her mother helps her weave the blankets and sell them in the region's mining communities. Lorenza really enjoys making many styles of colorful blankets, because she can use her creativity and add her personal style to her work. Her blankets are very sought-after in the Peruvian highlands, where people buy them to use as ponchos on cold nights.
