The process of making the blankets is very tedious due to the kind of wool that is available for her to make into yarn.

This is Lorenza's third loan from Kiva's partner MFP, and she has not had any problems with repayment. She will invest this loan in the purchase of more wool to be able to weave more blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more wool

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas en la casa de su suegra. Hace 3 años inició su trabajo como vendedora de productos de belleza, lo cual le agradó desde siempre, ya que el maquillaje y las joyas son una muy buena forma de ganarse el dinero. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es conocer y tener amistades en diversos lugares de su ciudad, siendo esta también la forma de ganar clientela en diversos  ámbitos y espacios. Lo dificultoso es mantener sus metas de venta, debido a la gran competencia que hay hoy en día dentro de las diversas  marcas de empresas de belleza. Nelly no tiene problemas de pago, este es su tercer préstamo con MFP. Ella está dispuesta a incrementar sus productos de belleza y aprovechar las ofertas  para adquirir en cantidad los productos para luego revenderlos a sus clientas al precio que le resulte beneficioso.
texts.en:
Nelly is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in her mother-in-law's home. Three years ago she began selling beauty products. She has been very happy with her work, since make-up and jewelry are a great way to make money. What she enjoys about her work is developing friendships with people throughout the city. Traveling around the city is also a good way to build her clientele in different locations. The hard thing about her job is making her sales goals, since there are excellent products available from so many competing beauty product companies.

This is Nelly's third loan with Kiva's partner MFP, and she has not had problems with repayment. She wants to increase her supply of beauty products in order to be able take advantage of quantity discounts and make more of a profit.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the variety of products offered

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es: La Sr. María tiene 56 años de edad, habitante de un barrio de la capital de Managua llamado Laureles Sur, soltera y con cuatros hijos mayores de edad. Sus hijos le ayudan  Doña maría trabaja por su propia cuenta vendiendo cosa de horno en su casa y en las calle todos los días. Vive en una casita humilde  de zinc. Sus planes son aumentar la venta de cosa de horno, sus planes   es compra  mayores cantidades de maíz, dulce, para hacer sus ricas rosquillas También cambiar el zinc por una mini falda de concreto y mejorar exterior e interior su casa. Gracias a los préstamos brindados por Afodenic lograra realizar sus planes.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old, single, and lives with her four adult children in the “Laureles Sur” neighborhood of Managua. Her children help her sell baked goods from her home and in the streets every day. She lives in a very humble home made out of zinc. Her plan is to increase profits from the sale of her delicious donuts by buying ingredients such as corn and sugar in bulk. She will also make improvements to her home such as replacing her zinc walls with concrete. Thanks to the loans provided by AFODENIC María will be able to realize her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to complete her house

loans.name: Stalin

texts.es: Stalin tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos menores. El viene trabajando como panadero junto a su familia, ya que su pequeño negocio es familiar y se dedica a ello por 5 años, donde comparte junto a sus familiares  momentos de abundancia y escasez, pero lo importante es que le agrada elaborar diversos aperitivos  y riquísimos pasteles, que suele preparar con mucho cuidado  y con mucho gusto. Cave resaltar que gracias a la ausencia de competencia por su zona puede distribuir sus productos a las tiendas y casas, las cuales solicitan los pedidos constantemente. Pero lo difícil es distribuirlos, ya que se gasta en movilidad, y es una inversión adicional. Stalin es puntual en sus pagos, este es su tercer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materia prima en cantidad, como la harina, que es indispensable, pero de alta costo, y ahora por fiestas desea invertir más para ganar más.
texts.en:
Stalin is 36 years old, lives with his wife and their 3 children. He has been working as a baker with his family, as their small business is family run. He has been doing this for 5 years, where he shares with his family moments of abundance and scarcity. What is important is that he is pleased to create diverse appetizers and rich cakes, which he prepares with much care and great pleasure. Due to the lack of competition in their area, he can distribute their products to stores and homes, which are constantly placing orders. However, what is difficult is distributing the products, as money spent on a bus would be an additional investment. Stalin is punctual in his payments. This is his third loan with MFP. With the money requested, he will buy raw materials such as flour (which is essential but high cost) and now for the holidays he wishes to invest more to earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of flour

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo, sus dos hijos y su pequeño nietecito. Ella creció junto a sus padres agricultores, quienes le enseñaron desD. muy pequeña a poder inmiscuirse en las labores D. un agricultor, es así que desD. los 10 años aprendió a ayudar a sus padres en sus chacras. Pero para Susana este trabajo no es  desagradable, por el contrario, es un trabajo muy gratificante, por los frutos que obtienen cada seis meses, que es el tiempo que espera para su cosecha, pero la espera es beneficiosa, ya que dentro D. la temporada D. producción, los comerciantes  solicitan grandes cantidades D. productos que ellos mismos llevan, ya que es muy difícil trasladar sus productos a las ciudades y venderlos. La señora Susana es nueva en el banco comunal, por tanto es el primer préstamo D.  solicita. Con el dinero que solicita seguirá invirtiendo en la producción D. papa y maíz y en sus terrenos, para ello requiere D. semillas y abonos.
texts.en:
Susana is 55 years old, lives with her husband, her two sons and her grandson. She grew up with her parents as farmers, who taught her from a young age about the possibility to interfere in the work of a farmer. This is how since she was ten years old, she learned to help her parents in the farm. However, for Susana this work is not unpleasant; by contrast, it is a very rewarding job by the fruits they get every six months, which is the time that she waits for the harvest. However, the wait is beneficial, as within the time of production, traders seek large quantities of products, and it is very difficult to move their products to cities and sell them. Señora Susana is new to the community bank, so this is her first loan request. With the money requested, she will continue to invest in the production of potato and corn on her farm, which requires seeds and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Alfonso Ines

texts.es: El Sr. Alfonso tiene 58 años de edad, habitante del barrio Laureles Sur de la capital de Managua, casado, tiene dos lindos hijos de 20 y 25 años de edad que son independiente y trabajan por su cuenta, pero le ayudan a sus padres don Alfonso es pastor de una pequeña y humilde iglesia, que poco a poco se ha ido construyendo, pero todavía falta. Sus planes como familia es contribuir con la enseñanza de la palabra de Dios a los hombres, pero especialmente la construcción en la fe hacia nuestro señor Jesucristo. Son cinco años de conducir a su rebaños por los caminos de Dios y luchando contra las adversidades de los enemigos. Los planes a futuro del pastor Alfonso es la culminación de la Iglesia pero esto  requiero de un préstamo que Gracias a Afodenic lograran comprar materiales como: cementos, hierro, ladrillos, piedras, perlines, para terminar de construir, lo cual va hacer de gran beneficio para el pueblo ya que las puertas estarán abiertas, en un local seguro
texts.en:
Alfonso is 58 years old, and a resident of the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital of Managua, he is married and has two beautiful children, 20 and 25 yearsold, who are independent and work on their own, but they help their parents. Alfonso is the pastor of a small and humble church, which little by little has been being built, but it is still not done. Their plan as a family is to contribute with the teachings of the word of God to men, but especially the construction in faith toward our savior Jesus Christ. for five years he has driven himself on the path of God and fought against the adversities of his enemies. The future plan of Pastor Alfonso is the culmination of the Church but this requires a loan, which thanks to Afodenic they were able to buy materials like: cement, sand, stones to finish the construction, which is going to be a big benefit to the people since the doors will be open in a safe place.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to finish the building

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Luís tiene 46 años de edad, habitante de barrio Laureles Norte de la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 19 años de edad, casado su esposa es la que atiende la pulpería. Los planes que tiene para su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y que sus hijos se preparen con una profesión .Don Luís posee una pulpería desde hace cuatro años de edad, el inicio con recursos propios generado por el trabajo que poseía. En el ámbito económico es aumentar las ventas con nuevos productos que nuestros clientes van a preferir. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic cumplirá los planes económicos en la compra de productos como: granos básicos, verduras, frutas, cosméticos y variedades aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Luís is 46 years old, a resident of the neighborhood Laureles Norte of the capital of Managua. He has two sons, of 12 and 19 years of age. He is married to his wife, who is the one who works in the shop. The plans that he has for his family are to improve the living conditions and to prepare his children for a profession. Don Luís has had the shop for four years and started it with his own resources by his work. In the economic field, he wants to increase the sales of new products preferred by his clients. Thanks to the loans from Afrodenic, he will meet the economic plans in the purchase of products such as grains, vegetables, fruits, cosmetics, and varieties to grow his revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in materials and products for a small beauty parlor.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge tiene la de edad de 44 años, habitante del barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, casado su esposa es ama de casa, tiene tres hijos de 2, 8 y 12 años de edad, dos de ellos estudian y en sus tiempo libre la mayor ayuda a sus padres. Los planes en el ámbito familiar es que sus hijos se preparen y verlos con futuro mejor Don Jorge tiene su profesión de panadero y trabaja vendiendo desde hace seis años. A futuro es obtener su propio negocio de panadería para brindarles a los clientes sus productos de calidad y ricos panes variados Gracia a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra invertir en equipo de panadería como: horno, batidora entre otros. Para comenzar a trabajar en su propio negocio
texts.en:
Señor Jorge is 44 years old, a resident of the neighborhood Laureles Sur in the capital of Managua. He is married to his wife who is a homemaker. He has three children of 2, 8 and 12 years of age; two study, and the oldest supports her parents in her free time. His family plan is that his children will be prepared and see a better future. Don Jorge is a baker and has worked for six years. In the future, he wishes to obtain his own baking business to provide customers with quality products and a rich variety of breads. Thanks to loans from Afrodenic, he will fulfill his investment in bakery equipment such as an oven, blender, among others to begin working on his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a blender, oven, and others to make bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow and fodder to fatten it

loans.name: Apaza Condori

texts.es:
La señora C. desde hace dos años pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del centro poblado de Chimbo, del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos veterinarios y también  la ayuda a criar animales para engorde. 

Con el préstamo que recibió de S/. 500 inició este negocio y compró ganado ovino. 

En la actualidad cuenta con ganado vacuno y ovino, los cuales vende para pagar el préstamo del banco comunal. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará productos veterinarios.
 
C. manifiesta que con el préstamo de Manuela Ramos pudo iniciar un negocio ya que otros bancos no dan esa facilidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. has belonged to the city of Chimbo's communal bank "Espíritu Santo" for two years, located in the Yunguyo district and province of the Puno Region. She is a married mother of two dependent children whose husband sells veterinary products and helps her raise animals for fattening. With the 500 soles loan already received, she began this business and bought sheep livestock. Currently she has cattle and sheep, which she sells to pay off the communal bank loan. With this 1200 soles loan, to be paid over five months, she will buy veterinary products. Mrs. C. has stated that she was able start a business with the loan from Manuela Ramos since other banks do not provide this service.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy veterinary products

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es: Enedina tiene 30 años, vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su esposo y sus  2 hijos. Desde muy joven le agradó el bordado y el arte que se pone para elaborar cada uno de los trabajos, es así que desde hace 8 años empezó a trabajar en mantas y  diversos tejidos que le permitieron apoyar en la canasta familiar.  Enedina se siente feliz de trabajar en lo que realmente le agrada y elaborar  mantas de todo tipo le apasiona, además, de la misma forma es muy gratificante porque la venta de cada manta cubre sus horas de trabajo y los materiales invertidos en cada una, aunque  estas horas sean largas noches sin dormir. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y no tiene problemas de pago. Con el dinero que solicita desea incrementar los materiales que requiere para seguir  trabajando.
texts.en:
Enedina is 30 years old and lives in a rented house with her husband and two children. She has enjoyed the art of embroidery since she was very young, which is how she got her start eight years ago, working on blankets and varied weaves, allowing her to contribute in supporting the household. Enedina is very happy to work at what she truly enjoys, and making all types of blankets is a joy, but it is also gratifying that the sale of each blanket covers her hours of work and the invested materials, even though the hours can stretch long into the night. This is her third loan with MFP and she has no problems with payments. With the requested money she wishes to invest in raw materials she needs to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander tiene 35 años, es soltero y vive con sus abuelos y hermanos. Es panadero, actividad que practica junto a su familia, quienes desde hace 3 años  vienen realizando diversos pasteles y tortas que distribuyen por su localidad. A Alexander siempre le agradaron los pasteles y realizarlos es todo un reto, ya que a un inicio no le agradó la cocina, pero cuando fue probando los deliciosos  pasteles que preparaba fue perfeccionándose en su  trabajo, así logro ser un panadero muy  solicitado por sus vecinos. Además que ahora los pedidos se han incrementado, y gracias a la mano de obra de todos sus hermanos, pueden atender los pedidos,  aunque para ello tengan que sacrificar horas de sueño. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y no tuvo hasta la fecha problemas de pago. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de algunas máquinas necesarias  para agilizar su trabajo dentro de su panadería y pastelería.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 35-year-old single male who lives with his grandparents and siblings. He is a baker in his family's business. For the past three years they have been creating various types of pastries and cakes that they distribute at their locale. Alexander has always enjoyed pastries and it has been an accomplishment to create them, since at first he did not enjoy working in the kitchen. As he gradually tried the delicious pastries that he was making, he began perfecting his work, which is how he became much sought after in the neighborhood. Now the orders have grown and, thanks to help from his siblings, he can fill the orders, although they sacrifice a lot of hours of sleep. This is his third loan with MFP and to date he has not had any problems with payments. With the requested money he will invest in machinery that will speed up work in the bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bakery equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy toys, gifts, ornaments, panetones, etc.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. ElL. es una mujer muy trabajadora y comprometida con su trabajo, desD. hace 3 años sale todas las noches a partir D. las 5 D. L. tarD. a vender sus  riquísimos anticuchos (brochetas) en L. esquina D. su casa, acompañada D. sus pequeños hijos, quienes L. ayudan con el trabajo. Siendo importante y agradable para elL. D. su trabajo que no tiene que movilizarse mucho, sino sólo tener muy bien preparado  los aperitivos y salir, gracias a que los prepara muy bien es muy frecuentado su  pequeño espacio D. venta ambulante D. comida, lo difícil es poder lidiar con el clima y el tiempo D. lluvia en su  localidad. Nely es puntual en sus pagos, es su 3er préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará una carpa para poder vender todos los días a pesar del mal tiempo.
texts.en:
Nely is 35 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She is a hard working woman who is committed to her work. For the past three years she has gone out after 5 in the afternoon to sell her tasty kebabs at the corner of her home. She is accompanied by her children, who help her with the work. It is important and agreeable to her that her job does not require to move around much, instead she only has to be well prepared with her snacks and head out. Thanks to the quality of her kebabs, her small food stand is highly frequented. The difficult thing is battling the climate and the rainy season in the area. This is the third loan for Nely, who is punctual with her payments. With the money she is requesting she will purchase a canopy to be able to sell her products everyday no matter the weather.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a canopy to protect her from the weather

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: José

texts.es: José tiene 36 años, vive solo con su hijo de 2 años. Por más de 8 años viene vendiendo impresiones diversas de publicidad, letreros de seguridad, entre otros, actividad que es muy creativa y demanda mucha paciencia  para obtener un trabajo de calidad, pero estas dos cualidades son las que priman en  José, ya que desde pequeño tuvo arte para  realizar sus trabajos. Sin duda es un negocio que le ha generado ganancias, ya que todo puesto o espacio público requiere de avisos o anuncios de seguridad, y recurren a José, quien es muy cumplido en su  labor. Lo difícil es cubrir la materia prima que requiere para sus trabajos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita se abastecerá de materiales, que son el eje central de su trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and lives alone with his 2-year-old son. For more than 8 years he has offered printing services for publications, safety signs and other items. The is a very creative activity that requires a lot of patience to achieve a high-quality product, but those are qualities that thrive in José, who since a young age has worked with art. Without a doubt, this is a business that generates income, since all outposts and public areas needs signs, warnings or safety notices, and they turn to José to create these items. The difficult thing is to cover the raw materials needed for his jobs. This is his first loan, and with the money he is requesting he will stock up on materials that are the central axis of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to make his printed products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rugs to resell

loans.name: Huerta Ramos

texts.es:
La Señora J. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos que aún estudian, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el Valle de Ite, lugar donde siembra ají para luego venderlo, ambos se dedican a ese negocio. 

Con el primer préstamo obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500, compró un chanchito para engorde y luego venderlo para pagar su préstamo. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la compra y venta de ají, el cual compra en Desaguadero y luego lo vende en Moquegua.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 5 cuotas, comprará un quintal de ají.

loans.use: Comprará un quintal de ají.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 43 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y su hija. Se dedica a elaborar diversos adornos para diversas temporadas de fiestas y para decoración de las casas, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, siendo  esto lo que le permite mantener su hogar y solventar los gastos de su hija. María se siente muy satisfecha de elaborar y plasmar toda su creatividad  en su trabajo, lo cual, por temporadas es muy rentable, sobre todo en las fiestas navideñas, donde sus pedidos se incrementan, la demanda es muy fuerte, y tiene que tener  el capital necesario para cumplir los pedidos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima, como telas, para elaborar sus más hermosos diseños navideños.
texts.en:
María is a 43-year-old single mother and lives with her parents and her daughter. She makes a living making diverse ornaments for different holiday seasons and decorations for houses, and activity she has carried out for 10 years. Doing this allowed her to take care of her home and cover household expenses. María feels very satisfied to make her items and express all of her creativity in her work, which, through the seasons is very profitable, especially during Christmas time when her orders increase, demand is strong and she has the necessary capital to fulfill her orders. This is her first loan, and the money she is requesting will be used to purchase raw materials, such as fabrics, to make her beautiful Christmas designs.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make her seasonal holiday crafts

loans.name: Fresia Mercedes

texts.es: La Sr. Fresia tiene 34 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación de la capital de Managua , casada su esposo se desempeña como mecánico y tiene tres lindos hijos de 1, 9 y 12 años de edad dos lo tiene estudiando en un colegio de la capital. Doña Fresia trabaja como cajera en una empresa privada desde hace ocho años de experiencia, su plan para su familia es brindarle un mejor nivel de vida  en el ámbito laboral, tener un trabajo  que le genere mayor ingreso y mejorar su casa que actualmente es de madera y zinc  a corto plazo desea construir su casa. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cementos, hierros, bloques,  Para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y tener seguridad para su familia ya que la delincuencia anda día a día haciendo daño, lo cual es de su preocupación y desea terminar pronto de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Fresia is 34 years old, is a resident of the Villa Reconcilación neighborhood in the capital of Managua, and is married. Her husband works as a mechanic and they have three lovely children aged 1, 9 and 12 years, two of which are studying in a school in the capital. Fresia works as a cashier in a private company, and her plan for her family is to provide them with a better standard of living in the working world, and for them to have a job that earns a higher income. In the short term, her plan is to improve and construct her house which currently is made of wood and metal. Thanks to the Afodenic loans she will be able to purchase construction materials such as cement, rebar, and blocks. Improving the infrastructure of her house will provide security for her family since she worries about the crime that is ongoing every day, and she would like to complete the improvements to her home soon.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle to fatten.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow to fatten

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more clothing to keep running a small business.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La señora Nieves es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos que aún mantiene.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 500 aumentó su capital y compró tela para confeccionar casacas. Tiene casi 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal. Nos cuenta que no terminó sus estudios secundarios porque no tenia medios económicos y tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800, el cual será cancelado en 5 cuotas, comprará 2 rollos de telas para vender en Lima.

Nieves desea continuar trabajando para que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the “Espíritu Santo” (“Holy Spirit”) Community Bank, located in the village of Chimbo in the Yunguyo region of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four dependent children. She did not finish secondary school because she had to work to help support her family. She has worked with the bank for two years. She invested her first loan of 500 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $165) in the purchase of fabric to make jackets. With this loan of 1,800 nuevos soles (US $600), to be repaid in five installments, she will buy two bolts of fabric to sell in Lima. Nieves wants to continue working to ensure that her children complete their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bolts of fabric

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es nueva integrante del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. 

Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos pequeños, es casada y su esposo trabaja junto con ella en la crianza de animales menores. Sabina nos cuenta que no pudo estudiar porque sus padres decían que las mujeres debían dedicarse a los cuidados de la casa.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará ganado ovino y porcino para engorde.

Su deseo es comprar más ganado y así continuar con la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sabina is a new member of Banco Comunal “Espiritu Santo” of Centro Poblado de Chimbo, in district and province of Yunguyo, and department of Puno. She is 34 years old and is mother of three little ones. She is married and together with her husband she breeds young animals. Sabina tells us that she could not study because her parents told her that women should dedicate themselves to household work. With this loan of 500 Peruvian Sol, which she will pay in 4 increments, she will buy sheep and pig for fattening. She hopes to buy more livestock and continue with breeding animals.

Translated from Spanish by Christina Stoddard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock to fatten

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in clothing and footwear to keep running a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy candy and cookies

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza tiene 37 años, vive con  su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de sus  padres. A ella siempre le gustó el arte de tejido, lo que practicó junto a su madre , y es ahora su actividad económica, con la que ya lleva 10 años, con mucho esmero elabora diversas chompas y ropones para bebé que son muy hermosos, y cuando no tiene  pedidos de tejidos sale a vender a las ferias de su ciudad  ambulatoriamente, lo cual es muy difícil porque no tiene un puesto estable y tiene que caminar largas cuadras  para vender algo de tu mercadería. Es la primera vez solicita un préstamo con MFP, es nueva en el grupo del banco comunal. El dinero solicitado se invertirá en materia prima, para elaborar mayor cantidad de  chompas y diversos tejidos para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 37 years old, she lives with her husband and 2 children in her parent's house. She has always liked the art of weaving, which she practiced together with her mother, and now it's been her economic activity for the past 10 years. With pains, she makes varied jackets and clothes for babies that are very beautiful, and when she does not have any orders for weavings, she goes to sell at the markets of her city as a traveling salesman, which is very difficult because she does not have a stable stall and she has to walk long blocks to sell some of her merchandise. It's the first time requesting a loan with MFP, and she's new in the community bank. The money requested will be invested in raw materials, to make a large quantity and diverse weavings to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool to make her weavings

loans.name: Friscana

texts.es: Friscana tiene 62 años, es viuda y vive con su hijo. Se dedica a los bordados de faldas que utilizan las mujeres en los días festivos,  como las fiestas patronales, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 50 años,  prácticamente desde que era niña  y ayudaba a su mamá en la elaboración de  estas faldas. Francisca se siente muy contenta por el trabajo que realiza, ya que lo hace de una manera muy efectiva, por la creatividad que pone en cada uno de sus  bordados, y esto hace que las personas acudan a solicitar sus servicios con anticipación, debido a la cantidad de pedidos que recibe por año. Pero comenta que lo más tedioso es poner los adornos a los acabados de las faldas, lo cual toma mucho tiempo. Este es su 10mo préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas en sus pagos. Friscana  invertirá 1000 soles en la compra de hilos especiales que requiere para los acabados de las faldas, lo cuales son muy costosos.
texts.en:
Friscana is 62 years old, a widow and lives with her son. She works embrodering the skirts that women wear on holidays such as patron saints celebrations. She has been in this business for 50 years, practically since she was a little girl, when she started helping her mother make these skirts. Friscana is very happy with the work she does because she does it very effectively because of the creativity she puts into each one of her embroideries. Because of this come to ask for her services in advance because of the number of orders she receives every year. She says that the most tedious part of her job is embellishments on the finishing elements on the skirts because it takes her a lot of time. This is her 10th loan with MFP and to date she hasn't had any problems with her payments. Friscana will invest 1000 soles in the purchase of special needles that she needs for the embroidery, which are very costly.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase special needles for embroidery.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 27 años, vive con su hijo de un añito. Es una joven muy entusiasta que a pesar de las circunstancias no deja de trabajar, desde hace un año inició un negocio de confección de camisetas dentro de su hogar  para luego venderlas en los mercados, o distribuir los pedidos, sobre todo en  fechas y eventos deportivos. Para ella este trabajo está lleno de creatividad y dedicación, por los diseños, y no es difícil, ya que cuenta con un gran don para confeccionar diversos modelos, sobre todo porque es muy rentable. Lo difícil es abastecer su taller con todos los tipos de telas novedosos. Luz es muy puntual en sus pagos, este es su 10mo préstamo con MFP. Ahora está dispuesta a poner un taller en el centro de la ciudad y exponer sus  diversos diseños en una tienda de confecciones, para ello quiere invertir 1000 soles.
texts.en:
Luz is 27 years old and lives with her son who is one year old. She is a very enthusiastic young woman and because of her tough circumstances works very hard. One year ago she started a business making t-shirts in her own house. She then sold the shirts in markets or by order and especially at sports events or days. For her this type of work is full of creativity and dedication because she designs the shirts. It is not very difficult for her because he has a gift for making various designs. Above all it is a profitable business. The hard part is keeping her workshop stocked with all types of new materials. Luz is very punctual with her payments. This is her 10th loan with MFP. Now she is ready to open a workshop in the city center and sell her various design in a clothing shop. For this she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a textile workshop in the city center to sell her clothing.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
“I love my family. I will do my best to make them happy and live a better life", says Elvira H., a 41-year-old mother of four children from Fatima, General Santos City. 

She and her husband have been working hard to provide for their children's needs. Together they are engaged in making stoves made of clay that they sell to all their neighbors and friends. In an interview, she said, “Sometimes we received orders from nearby towns. However, we don’t have enough capital to produce more stoves for our customers”. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional materials used in making stoves. She also is also considering looking into other income sources to generate income for her family. “With my loan, I could accommodate well my customers”, she said.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials used in making clay stoves

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El señor V. tiene a su esposa e hijo, actualmente viven en casa de sus papas, está muy agradecido con sus padres por brindarle un techo donde cobijarse, sin embargo quiere tener su propia casa, y ya dio el primer paso para lograrlo; adquirió un terreno en el que ya tiene contemplado construir dos cuartos para mudarse, la ventaja que él tiene es su conocimiento en el ramo de la construcción pues solo invertirá en el material.
Pide el apoyo para hacer realidad su sueño y el de su familia. Agradece infinitamente la ayuda que le puedan dar.
texts.en:
Mr. V. is married and has one son. Currently they live in his parents' house. He is very grateful to his parents for providing them with a roof over their heads but he still hopes to have his own house and has already made the first steps to getting it. He bought a plot of land and has already planned to build two rooms that they can move into. He has the advantage that he has construction experience so he will only have to pay for the materials.

He is asking for support so that he can achieve his and his family's dreams. He is infinitely grateful for the support that you can give him.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es: Magda tiene 31 años, vive en una casa alquilada, con su pequeña hija. Ella elabora faldas para mujeres desde hace 6 años, iniciándose desde que nació su pequeña hija. Esta actividad no solo le es muy útil para solventar los gastos de educación de su hija, sino para también se sienta realizada, ya que el bordado  es lo que le apasiona realizar, además es muy rentable, por la demanda que hay en las ferias y los pedidos que tiene cada mes, lo cual eleva su nivel de trabajo y dedicación, por lo que solicita  ayuda de jóvenes para cumplir sus pedidos. Es su primer  préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de telas  para  elaborar las faldas, además, comprará adornos que requiere para el acabado de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Magda is 31 years old and lives in a rented house with her young daughter. She has made skirts for women for the past 6 years, beginning when her young daughter was born. This activity is not only useful to her to pay for the educational expenses of her daughter, but also for personal fulfillment, since she is passionate about embroidery. Moreover, it is very profitable because of the demand there is in the fairs and the orders she gets each month, which increase her level of work and dedication. She solicits the help of young people to meet her orders. This is her first loan with MFP. She will use the money from this loan to buy fabrics to make the skirts and to buy the decorations that she needs to complete the finished product.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric for the creation of her embroidered skirts

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 45 años, vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo. Trabaja como maestro de obras en construcción de casas, oficio que  practica por más de 25 años, desde muy joven, esta labor, le permitió independizarse económicamente de sus padres, ahora le ayuda a mantener su hogar. Además, le agrada construir hogares para personas que lo necesitan, es una gran persona y un muy buen profesional, la mayor parte de sus vecinos solicitan sus servicios para el arreglo de sus casas. Pero lo más cansado es trasladar los ladrillos, para lo cual requiere de ayudantes, para ello también le ayuda su esposa, mostrándose como ayuda idónea para don Manuel. Este es su 10mo préstamo con MFP, y es puntual es sus  pagos. Con la cantidad que solicita construirá un depósito para los materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Manuel is 45 years old and lives with his wife and young son. He works as a foreman in the construction of homes, an occupation which he has had for more than 25 years. Since he was very young, this job allowed him to become economically independent from his parents. Now his job helps him to provide for his home. Moreover, he enjoys constructing homes for people that need them. He is a great person and a very good professional. The majority of his neighbors ask for his services for the repair of their houses. Yet, the most tiring job is to move bricks, for which he needs helpers. His wife also helps with this task, proving herself as suitable help for Manuel. This is his tenth loan from MFP, and he is punctual in his payments. With the loan that he is asking for, he will construct a warehouse for his construction materials.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a warehouse for his construction materials

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Víctor Alfonso M. y su esposa tienen una hija, quieren darle lo mejor.
En este momento ellos están en el proceso de adecuar cada área de la casa para vivir más cómodamente.
Con sus ahorros han construido dos cuartos, pero falta concluirlos, el siguiente paso es la elaboración de la losa. La mejora la están llevando acabo en la parte posterior de la vivienda. 
Don Víctor es obrero de una maquiladora y su ingreso no le permite realizar una inversión tan fuerte, por lo cual pide apoyo para completar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Victor Alfonso M. and his wife have a daughter, to whom they want to give the best. Currently, they are in the process of adapting each area of the house to live more comfortably. With their savings, they have constructed two rooms, but they still need to finish them. The next step is to put down the flagstone. They are starting to realize the improvements in the rear part of the house. Victor is a worker in a maquiladora [a bonded assembly plant set up by a foreign firm near the US border]. His earnings do not allow him to realize such a large investment. For this reason he is asking for support to complete his project.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a concrete patio

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma lives in Brgy, Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela, a place near the long Cagayan River in the Philippines. The town is driven by agricultural. The people mainly farm rice and corn.

Gemma is married to Benjie, who drives a passenger tricycle. Together they had three children, Jaymark, Rea Angeline, and Johnny. Jaymark is 8 years old and in grade three, Rea Angeline is 7 years old and in grade two, and Johnny is 5 years old.

Gemma raises pigs in her backyard piggery. Her business helps her husband earn the daily living for their family.

Daily, Gemma keeps their house clean, washes their clothes and prepares her children for their schooling. She does all of this even as she also manages the piggery business, which is next to their house. Gemma is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to improve her business. She wants to buy an additional two heads of pig. With the remaining amount of her loan she will purchase feed for the pigs. She believes that her business will help her husband raise more income to sustain their family needs.

Even with the hardships she has encountered in her life, Gemma dreams is of sending all her children to school. She hopes they will be able to finish their courses in college someday. Only then, she believes, can she say that she has became a successful mother to her children.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora has been blessed with two children, Prescious who is 10 years old and Kevin who is one year old. Aurora helps her family in her own little way by selling viands and snacks in their barangay while her husband farms. Despite the hardships they encounter with everyday life, they still manage to stick together as one family.

Aurora generates an income of PHP 250.00 per day through her business. She wants her family to escape poverty and so she has joined hands with her husband to strive harder to improve their way of living. To further develop her business, Aurora now requests a loan of PHP 5,000 so she can purchase farm materials for her husband. This will help him to maintain his crops.

Like any other mother, Aurora dreams of giving her children a good education. She believes that by working with her husband, she will be able to fulfill this dream. Together they will be able to taste the beauty of life, even if just for a little while.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Babyline

texts.en:
Babyline D. is a young mother; she is 20 years old. Despite her young age, she is very responsible and she uses every resource she can think of in order to solve life’s difficulties. Babyline is married to Romel D.. Romel drives a passenger tricycle to help her support the family's basic needs. Now, with their first born Nathaniel, who is just one year old, they need to try harder to improve their life. The family lives in a mountainous area where most people plant crops.

Babyline manages a small store in their village. She earns PHP 800 each week. She wants to improve her business so that the family can have a better source of daily income. She has promised herself that she will save for the future so they can care for their child in an emergency.

Babyline has not stopped looking for creative ways to develop her business. She perseveres for her family. Therefore, she is requesting PHP 6,000 to help grow her business so that she can realize her family's dreams.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, a member of the Rubi (“Ruby”) Village Bank, is 60 years old and the widowed mother of three children. Travelling regularly to the market in Andahuaylas to buy animals which she then has slaughtered, Victoria sells the meat wholesale to market vendors from her rented stand in the Nery Garcia Market.

She is now requesting a loan to buy pigs and sheep. Victoria’s dreams are to improve her business and for her youngest daughter to graduate from college with a professional degree. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy pigs and sheep.

loans.name: Beatris

texts.en:
For almost two years, Beatris has had a business raising hogs. She lives in Brgy, Magassi Cabagan, Isabela. The town is located along the national highway on the way to Tuguegarao City. The majority of the villagers rely on farming corn and rice to earn an income.

She is married to Venancio, a farmer who manages their corn field. They have five children. Aveline is 30 years old and a high school graduate, Brigette is 28 years old and studied in college, Nino Nito is 25 years old and has graduated from vocational school, and Cliff is 22 years old and studied in college. The youngest child, Eunice, was adopted. She is 8 years old and studies in elementary school.

Beatris would like to improve her backyard piggery from one piglet to five pigs. She currently faces difficulty in maintaining enough food and vaccines to care for the pigs. These supplies are necessary for the pigs to grow healthy, but they are costly. Beatris will therefore need PHP 5,000 so she can buy the supplies.

If Beatris can increase her business, then she believes she can grow her profits and therefore help the future of her family.

Beatris encourages her children to finish their college education. She wants to have a simple and assured life for her children. Together with her loving and hard working husband, she works hard to improve their lives, now and for the future.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth and her husband Richard have one daughter, Andrea Lhei, who is 3 years old. They live in the rural area of Brgy. Minallo  Naguillan, Isabela.  Their house is at the top of the hill where they are blessed with rich soil for growing rice and corn products which are their major source of income.  Bernadeth is also raises pigs in their backyard, and Richard does carpentry work.

Bernadeth strives hard to help her carpenter husband in supporting their family's needs. Though they work very hard, their income is limited. She is requesting a loan so her can open her own small sari-sari store (a community variety store). This will increase the family's earnings so they can better their living conditions.

At present, they live with her mother-in-law, but Bernadeth dreams of earning enough money for a house of their own. “I put God first in everything I do so that my daily business routine will be blessed”, says Bernadeth.

loans.use: To open a small variety store to create additional income

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
“To teach my children good values as they grow older is very important” says Elvie A., a client who is engaged in hog raising business. Elvie is married to Melanio who farms and does carpentry work. Elvie is 39 years old and has three daughters: MaryJane (20 years old, married, and a high school graduate), Marina (16 years old, high school graduate, and a house helper in anearby municipality), and Marissa (10 years old and in fifth grade). 

Elive raises hogs, which helps provide money for farming and emergencies, and also allows her to perform her daily household chores. She is requesting a loan so she can expand her business and earn money to help her two younger daughters attend college. Despite problems that arise, Elvie's goal is to have a better life, especially for her daughters. She prays to overcome the challenges that arise through faith and hard work.

loans.use: To expand hog-raising business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline describes her village as mountainous with rough roads. It is a purely agricultural- based community where rice and corn farming are the major sources of living for the villagers. Evangeline has a sari - sari store (a community based sari-sari store) business in the village. Her husband Leonard is a house carpenter. They are blessed with two children: Jhon (7 years old and in grade two) and Cristian Joy (3years old)>

To earn more money so she can educate and better care for her children, Evangeline wishes to begin a hog-raising business. This is a home-based business that enables her to take care of the sari-sari (also home-based) and her family responsibilities.

She is requesting a loan to purchase new stock for her store and to help her with the new hog-raising business. More merchandise in the store means the villagers will save time and effort because they can purchase their needs closer to home. This will improve Evangeline's income.

She believes that through their untiring efforts and sacrifices, God will continue to bless her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for a small variety store

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị L. năm nay 43 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ thương từ năm 2003. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị xin vay 1.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ. Qua 5 năm sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả  hiện nay chị đã là chủ một cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh quần áo.Hàng  tháng ngoài nguồn thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, kinh doanh gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương của chồng nên kinh tế rất ổn định.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh quần áo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị L. is 43 years old. She's been participating in the TYM Fund since 2003. She put her first loan of 1,000,000 VND towards raising livestock and a small business. She has had success with the borrowed funds and now is the owner of a clothing store. The family's income from raising livestock and the family business is supplemented with her husband's salary each month. Therefore, the family's financial situation is steady. For this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest further into her clothing store business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her clothing retail business

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đỗ Thị Hà năm nay 29 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện nay công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ kinh doanh quần áo. Hàng tháng chồng chị đi lấy quần áo từ hà Nội về để chị bán cho các cửa hàng bán lẻ trong địa bàn huyện. Ngoài ra gia đình chị cũng có một cửa hàng bán lẻ để phục vụ cho nhu cầu của bà con. Công việc  kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn mua thêm các loại quần áo thu đông  về cung cấp cho khách hàng.
texts.en:
Ms. Đỗ Thị Hà is 29 years old. She's been participating in the TYM Fund since 2007. Currently, the main source of income for her family is a clothing business. Every month, her husband goes to Hanoi to bring back clothes for her to resell to storefronts in her district. The family also has their own storefront selling general goods to the community. The family's business is growing well and provides an income of 4,000,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND to purchase more winter clothing to meet customers' demands.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hà Thị Hường năm nay 46 tuổi. Chị hiện đang sống cùng hai con  tại huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương. Năm 2003 chị Hưòng tham gia vào Quỹ và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Đến nay sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ với nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi,  làm thuê  và sự hỗ trợ của 1 người con đã đi làm kinh tế gia đình chị Hường đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển. Vòng vốn tơí chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua 5 con lợn giống và  1 tấn thóc làm thức ăn dự trữ phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ha Thi H. is 46 years old. She is living with her two children in Ning Giang district, Hai Duong province. In 2003, Mrs. H. joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to raise livestock. After five years of participation to the Fund, with incomes from livestock raising, miscellaneous jobs, and the support of one working child, the economic situation of Mrs. H.'s family is increasingly stable and improved. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND10,000,000 to purchase five breeding pigs (sows) and one ton of rice as food reserve for livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Khuc Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Bến năm nay 37 tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại huyện Gia Lộc tỉnh Hải Dương. Năm 2007 chị tham  gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào sản xuất kinh doanh đồ gỗ. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị hiện nay. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ chăn nuôi và trồng trọt nên kinh tê gia đình chị Bến rất ổn định, cuộc sống của gia đìnhcngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất và kinh doanh đồ gỗ.
texts.en:
Mrs. B. is 37 years old. She is currently living with her husband and two children in Gia Loc district, Hai Duong province. In 2007, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed money to make and sell furniture. This business is the main source of income for her family at the moment. In addition, her family gets extra income from livestock and farming. Therefore, the economic situation of Mrs. B.'s family is very stable, and her family's standard of living is improved. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND9,000,000 to buy additional raw materials for the furniture business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan consisting of four borrowers. All of the members are people who live in Knasondaiy Commune in the Siem Reap Province. Mr. B. Ly , age 22, sells carving woods, ordering the wood from a wholesale supplier and transporting the wood to sell to markets nearby his commune. His wife, Mrs. Pouv Kimnan, 22, is a grocery seller and is the mother of one young child. Ly requests is requesting a loan to purchase a wheel to use to connect to his cart for his business transportation. Ly is a group leader that has three additional members as listed below:

Mr. Peou D., age 25, owns a car and provides customers taxi services. He requests a loan to buy a car wheel to replace a broken one.

Mrs. Chea P. is a 39 year old widow that sells thatch from her home. She would like additional income and therefore requests a loan to purchase piglets to raise.

Mrs. Po S. makes a living by selling Chinese Noodles. She applies for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a wheel

loans.name: Hang

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi và dịch vụ làm đầu, chăm sóc sắc đẹp cho chị em phụ nữ. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm một số trang thiết bị đầu tư cho cửa hàng
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Hang is 26 years old, and joined TYM fund in 2007. Presently the main sources of income for her family are raising farm animals, and a beauty salon to do hair and make-up for women. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to purchase additional beauty supplies for her salon.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo, a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank, is 38 years old and married with two children. Consuelo studied agricultural science but has not yet gotten her degree. She has a consulting firm located in a rented office where she employs seven people and offers services for a wiD. variety of projects.

Consuelo is now requesting a loan to pay for the costs associated with getting her college degree. Consuelo dreams of finishing construction on her home and expanding her consulting firm.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To pay the costs of completing a college degree.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuỳ năm nay 45 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại thị trấn Gia Lộc tỉnh Hải Dương. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi và  kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.  Nhờ có sự hỗ trợ giúp đỡ của chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành nên công việc kinh doanh của  gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm hàng hoá phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng   của bà con địa phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Thuy is 45 years old and joined TYM fund in 2007. She lives with her husband and 2 children in the town of Gia Loc in the province of Hai Duong. Presently the main sources of income for her family are from raising animals, and operating a grocery store. With the assistance of her husband and children, who are grown, their business is profitable and brings in 183 USD average per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to purchase additional merchandise to meet the customers' needs for the upcoming Tet Holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Vuong

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Vượng năm nay 47 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi  gia đình chị còn đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh quần áo. Công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị Vượng đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập ổn định khoảg 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Với mức thu nhập này gia đình chị Vượng không chỉ thuận trong việc hoàn trả vốn vay mà còn có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh quần áo.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Vuong is 47 years old, and joined TYM fund in 2007. Presently, in addition to raising farm animals, her family also has a clothing store. Her business is developing quite well, and brings in a stable income of approximately 183 USD per month. With this level of income, not only is her family able to repay the loans but also able to improve their livelihood. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to invest in her clothing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Đoan năm nay 42 tuổi,. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi chị Đoan còn kinh doanh thêm các mặt hàng tạp hoá.Chồng chị hiện đang làm công nhân tại nước ngoài. Hàng tháng chị đều nhận được sự hỗ trợ của chồng  nên thu nhập của gia đình  rất ổn định, việc hoàn trả vốn vay cũng rất thuận lợi.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua thêm một số mặt hàng bia, bánh kẹo… để phục vụ cho nhu cầu của ngưòi dân địa phương trong dịp Tết.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Đoan is 42 years old. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. Currently, in addition to raising animals, Đoan also has a small grocery shop. Her husband is now working as a labourer in a foreign country. Each month, she receives a regular remittance from her husband, so the income of the family is very stable, thus assuring her ability to repay the loan. In the next lending cycle, she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in her grocery by buying beer, candy, etc., in order to meet the demands of her local community during the Tet holiday (lunar new year).

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her grocery

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phan Thị Lập tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ đầu năm 2007. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại xã Gia Xuyên huyện Gia Lộc tỉnh Hải Dương. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi làm thuê còn chị ở nhà chăn nuôi và kinh  doanh hàng tạp hoá. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn  và sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả hiện nay thu nhập của gia đình chị Lập đạt khoảng 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Với mức thu nhập này  gia đình chị Lập cũng có thêm điều kiện để  cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con ăn học
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm các mặt hàng tạp hoá về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phan Thị Lập has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. She currently lives with her husband and two young children in Gia Xuyên cummune, Gia Lộc district, Hải Dương province. Each day, her husband goes to work as a day labourer while she stays at home and raises animals and runs a small grocery. Thanks to her hard work and effective use of previous loans, Lập's family income is now about 3,000,000 VND per month. With this level of income, Lập's family now has the ability to improve their standard of living and to invest in their children's education. In the next lending cycle, she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to buy more goods to sell in her grocery shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her grocery

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
TeofiL., a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank, is 54 years old and married with seven children, four of whom still live with her. Purchasing her wares in the city slaughterhouse, TeofiL. works as a street vendor, selling animal skins in the Grau Market. She also travels to various markets to buy cheeses and live animals, slaughtering them herself at home. She sells the meat and cheese door-to-door.

TeofiL. is now requesting a loan to buy more sheep and cheese. Her dreams are to improve her business and to open a store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy sheep and cheese.

loans.name: Palattao

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Palattao, 33 years old and married with five children, lives in Tuburan, Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. At a young age she was forced to earn a living for her family and so started a sari-sari store to support their daily needs. She decided to join Paglaum MPC in September of 2006 and now is requesting a loan to buy load wallets (Electronic Loading) and cases of soft drinks & beverages for her sari-sari.

Mrs. Palattao wants to expand her store into a mini – grocery someday. Seeing her children finish their studies and obtain stable careers is her greatest hope as a mother.

loans.use: To buy load wallets (electronic loads) and cases of soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga, a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank, is 29 years old and lives with her partner and their two children. Olga bakes traditional Peruvian bread three times per week in her in-laws’ oven and then sells the bread in various regional markets.

She is now requesting a loan to buy flour, and dreams of increasing her investment capital and owning her own home and oven.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy flour for bread.

loans.name: Thi Nhung's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Nhung, sinh năm 1949 (Ms 010105040007), tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để mua nguyên vật liệu sản xuất bao bì đựng đinh sắt. Cô có lương hưu và có nghề phụ tạo thu nhập thường xuyên.Các con cô vẫn còn đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô kH.ảng 3.000.000 vnđ / tháng. Cô là người có uy tín và được mọi người yêu mến, hiện cô là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Vương Thị Như, sinh năm 1944 (Ms 010105040008), tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở cửa hàng bán thuốc tây, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô kH.ảng 2.000.000 vnđ / tháng.
 Ngô Thị Chính (Ms 010105040010), sinh năm 1958, tham gia vay vốn mức vay 4.028.000 để có tiền mua thu gom bao bì đựng đinh rồi bán phân phối cH. các cửa hàng, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô kH.ảng 2.500.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Đỗ Thị Hiền , sinh năm 1962 (Ms 010105040012), tham gia vay vốn mức : 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình kH.ảng : 2.500.000 vnđ/ tháng
 Ngô quý Chiến, sinh năm 1976 (Ms 010105040006), tham gia vay vốn mức vay 4.028.000 để đầu tư cửa hàng sửa chữa xe máy, anh có thu nhập theo ngày kH.ảng 90.000 vnđ/ngày.
 Hồ Thị Nga, sinh năm 1971 (Ms 010105040032) , tham gia vay vốn mức vay 4.028.000để đầu tư ao cá và chăn nuôi lợn, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị kH.ảng 3.000.000 vnđ/ tháng.
 Nguyễn Thị Minh Phương, sinh năm 1982 (Ms 010105040014), tham gia vay vốn mức vay 4.028.000 để đầu tư cửa hàng cắt tóc gội đầu, chị có thu nhập theo ngày kH.ảng 100.000 vnđ/ngày.
 Nguyễn Thị Thảo, sinh năm 1971(Ms 010105040017) , tham gia vay vốn mức vay 4.028.000 để đầu tư cửa hàng bán quần áo, chị cũng có thu nhập theo ngày kH.ảng 100.000 vnđ/ngày.
 Tô Thị Thuỷ, sinh năm 1979 (Ms 010105040016), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tưmua nguyên liệu may mặc, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị kH.ảng: 2.500.000 vnđ/ tháng.
texts.en:
N. Thi Nhung, born 1949 (ID 010105040007), requests a loan of VND 3,604,000 T. buy raw materials T. produce bags for steel nails packaging. She receives pension and has extra jobs that bring regular income. Her children still go T. school. Average monthly income of her family is about VND3,000,000. She is trusted and beloved, and she is the leader of the group of borrowers including:

V. Thi Nhu, born 1944 (ID 010105040008), requests a loan of VND4,028,000 T. open a drug store. Average monthly income of her family is about VND2,000,000.

N. Thi Chinh, born 1958 (ID 010105040010), requests a loan of VND4,028,000 T. buy bags for steel nails packaging and then distribute T. retail shops. Average monthly income of her family is about VND2,500,000.

D. Thi Hien, born 1962 (ID 010105040012), requests a loan of VND3,604,000 T. raise pigs. Average monthly income of her family is about VND2,500,000.

N. Quy Chien, born 1976 (ID 010105040006), requests a loan of VND4,028,000 T. invest in a motorbike repair workshop. His daily income is about VND90,000/day.

H. Thi Nga, born 1971 (ID 010105040032), requests a loan of VND4,028,000 T. invest in the fish pond and pig raising. Average monthly income of her family is about VND3,000,000.

N. Thi Minh Phuong, born 1982 (ID 010105040014), requests a loan of VND4,028,000 T. invest in a hairdresser's. Her daily income is about VND100,000/day.

N. Thi Thao, born 1971 (ID 010105040017), requests a loan of VND4,028,000 T. invest in a clothing store. Her daily income is also about VND100,000/day.

T. Thi Thuy, born 1979 (ID 010105040016), requests a loan of VND4,028,000 T. buy clothing material for tailoring. Average monthly income of her family is about VND2,500,000.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock, agriculture, services, retails, manufacturing

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn L., 21, and her husband, Mr. Nak Chum, 24, live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple has been married for 6 months and they live with Chanthorn’s mother. 

Chanthorn has been a silk weaver for 5 years, a skill she learned from a neighbor. She sells her finished product to a middleman, who brings it to Phnom Penh to sell. Her husband has been raising pigs and producing rice wine for 4 years. Chanthorn is requesting for a loan of $1000 to purchase more pigs for her husband to raise.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Poverty is not a hindrance to having a big and happy family. Lucia C., who is a mother of eight, proves it. Her family lives in Brgy. Sisim Alto, a peaceful place with lots of agriculture.

Lucia's husband is a farmer, and she sells vegetables in their village, which helps support her family, including three grandchildren. Despite her age, Lucia is motivated to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy a wider variety of vegetables and add other foodstuffs (meat, fish, snack foods) to the items she sells. The loan will enable her to have her own vegetable booth in front of their house, a dream Lucia has been dreaming so she no longer has to go "house-to-house" to sell her products.
 
Time is golden, says Lucia. So she lives her life to the fullest and treasures every moment she still has.

loans.use: To expand her food-selling business

loans.name: Sumaq Huaytas Group

texts.en:
The Sumaq Huaytas (“Beautiful Flowers” in Quechua) Village Bank is located in the Arizona Village of Huamanga Province in the Ayacucho Department of central Peru, about 3,200 meters above sea level and about 50 km outsiD. the city of Ayacucho. It is located on a major highway, so most of the village is involved in commerce. The zone also produces corn, potatoes, and barley, and some villagers raise livestock. 
	
Leonor and Luzmila are two members of the Sumaq Huaytas Village Bank:

Leonor, married with four children who are 17, 16, 13 and 11 years old, runs a small dry goods store, a business she launched two years ago. She plans to use her loan portion to buy more merchandise for her dry gods store as well as sheep to take to Ayacucho to sell for meat.  Her dreams for the future are that her children will graduate with professional degrees and that her business will grow. She is saving for any emergencies that might arise involving her family.  

Luzmila, married with six children between the ages of 27 and 12, buys small pigs and fattens them up to sell for a higher price. She also raises guinea pigs, a local delicacy, to sell in the city of Ayacucho. A veteran of this business, Luzmila says that when she was first starting out, her lack of experience led to some mistakes, but now she knows the business very well. With the help of loans from FINCA, she has increased her income and improved her business. 

Luzmila plans to use her portion of the loan to buy more young pigs, and dreams of her children growing up to be working professionals so that they don’t have to face the same hardships she has endured. She would also like to open up a large dry goods store. She is currently saving up to buy more commodities such as rice and sugar to sell door-to-door and to traD. for barley and wheat which she can grind up and use to fatten up her pigs.

loans.use: To buy young pigs, sheep and dry goods

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Bopha V., 26, and her husband, Mr. Rithy Nuon, 30, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two sons. Her elderly mother lives with them also. 

Mrs. V. has been a silk weaver for 10 years, a skill she learned when she was hired by her villagers to weave and take in extra income. But now she has her own loom and weaves by herself. She sells her finished product to a middleman, who sells it in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been driving a horse cart for 4 years and also has raised chickens for 14 years.

Bopha is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase raw silk and cotton thread for weaving, and to buy chickens for husband to raise and sell.

loans.use: To purchase silk and cotton thread for weaving, and to buy chickens for resale.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
“Poverty is not a hindrance to success” is Nenita Y.'s philosophy of life.

Perlita is 48 years old and married to Nestor. Her husband drives their passenger tricycle from their village to the public market of Tumauini, Isabela. They are blessed with five children namely: Cherilyn – 27 years old, married, college graduate and presently working in Manila, Cleofe – 20 years old also works in Manila, Philip Mar – 18 years old still in college (3rd year), Cathel – 16 years old and senior high ,and Nestor Jr. – 8 years old and currently in grade two. They love living in the peaceful environment of Sisim Alto Tumauini, Isabela which is situated near the beautiful Abuan River.

Perlita is requesting a loan to repair their motorcycle which, along with farming, is the family's source of income.

The safety of the passenger (in the tricycle) is very important to the success of that business. “I dream to have another  passenger tricycle to be operated by my son,” said Perlita.  With another unit, they will be able to increase their daily income and sustain their basic needs and the education of their children.

loans.use: To repair transportation business equipment

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A., a 38-year-old mother, is selling cakes in Calumpang, General Santos City. She knows well that with her husband's income as a carpenter, they could hardly provide for their family's needs. Together, they began making cakes and selling them to the neighborhood.

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional kitchen utensils and stock for her cake business. She aspires to having her own stall to display her cakes to attract customers for volume orders.

“I love cakes, This is where I get money to spend for my family”, she said. “I really wanted to raise my son well and provide him a good future”, she added.

loans.use: To purchase additional kitchen utensils and stock

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun H., 47, is single and lives with her nieces and newphews. Two of them attend school and the other one is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a small village off of National Road No. Two, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. H. has been a village leader for 6 years. Currently, she and her family members live in an old, small house. She wants to build new house for them but lacks the money. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to combine with her own money to purchase construction materials for a new house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for building her new house.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Mrs. Ken M. (pictured with her mother), 29, was married in 1998 and has four children; two sons and two daughters. Three of them attend school and the other child is too young for school. The family lives in a small village across from the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Ken has been a silk weaver for 4 years, a skill she learned from a neighbor. She sells her finished product to a middleman, who then sells it in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a fisherman and also builds wooden houses. Ken is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Mrs.Yi T. is a married  35-year-old woman that grows rice and raises pigs to earn a living. Her husband is Ngeng Vanna, age 38, who works on the farm along with his wife. They are the parents of two children and live in the Kompong Cham Province. Yi's goal is to provide her children with a higher education. She has applied for a loan to purchase more piglets, feed, and a cow for her family's business activities.(The picture shows Yi's husband because she was not available)

loans.use: To purchase more piglets, feed, and a cow.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda N., a 50-year-old mother from Calumpang, General Santos City, is already a widow. Her life has been hard. She needs to work double-time to raise her three children and provide for their needs. “I am worried how I would be able to support my children", she said. 

She sells various goods in her store and earns enough for her and her children. She is requesting a loan of to purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann M. says, “In this world everything is unfair. That is why I do not hesitate to improve our poor living condition in Sisim Alto." She does not believe in waiting to see what blessings come to her family, but instead believes in working hard to make those blessing occur.

Mary Ann M. is a 33-year-old, hard-working woman who is married to a farmer-husband named Jerry. They are blessed with two children in elementary school: Jelly Ann – 11 years old currently in grade five, and Jomar – 8 years old. They live in Sisim Alto near the clear Abuan river, wherein the road conditions are still rough.

Mary Ann manages a small store in their village, and the small income she earns is used for her family's basic needs. She is requesting a loan so she can stock more merchandise at one time. This will save on transportation costs and enable her to be more able to meet her customers' need. She also will be able to save some money for the high school and college education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of items for her store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Thanh Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị T., sinh năm 1959 ( Ms 010105040029). Gia đình chị làm nông nghiệp nên rất cần vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Anh chị tham gia vay mức vốn: 4.028.000 vnđ để mua ngan, gà về nuôi. Hàng ngày, chị còn đi chợ buôn bán chè búp. Thỉnh thoảng chồng chị đi làm them đem lại tổng thu nhập của cả gia đình khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chi được mọi người tin tưởng và bầu làm nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Ngô Thị Lan, sinh năm 1964 ( Ms 010105040034),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư bán hàng bánh kẹo tại nhà, chị có thu nhập theo ngày khoảng 70.000 vnđ/ngày.
 Vương Thị Vân, sinh năm 1966, ( Ms 010105040037),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ  để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
 Nguyễn Thị Vân, sinh năm 1969, ( Ms 010105040035),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ  để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Hai vợ chồng chị có thu nhập ổn định từ lương  khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/ tháng 
 Vương Thị Nụ, sinh năm 1958, ( Ms 010105040038),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ  để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ /tháng.
 Nguyễn Thị Minh, sinh năm 1947, ( Ms 010105040031),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lơn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Vương Thị Tỵ, sinh năm 1965, ( Ms 010105040026),. tham gia mức vay : 4.028.000 vnđ để bán hàng ăn sáng  ( bán bún, phở, cháo,…). Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ/tháng.
texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị T. was born in 1959. Her family are farmers so they have a great need for capital to invest in raising animals.
